story:
The Story

“Return of Christ” is the story of Jesus as never told before on the big screen. This epic movie begins with the birth of Jesus, follows Him through His ministry, His miracles, His betrayal and His crucifixion. The story then takes us to the near future with the return of Jesus and His final earth-shaking conflict with the Anti-Christ. It is a historical drama, chronicling one of the most inspiring and fascinating figures in human history.

"Return of Christ."  This movie is revolutionary for its:

· Depiction of the return of Jesus to battle the anti-Christ.
· It will depict a portion of the New Testament that mankind has 
  pondered for 2,000 years.
· It will be historically accurate sticking to the scholarly 
  interpretations of The Book of Revelation.

Click here to visit our website and view more webisodes - www.returnofchrist.com

About The Producer

Producer Jeff Most is the originating producer of the biggest independently owned franchise in Hollywood, THE CROW, which spawned four features, a TV series, video games, and an upcoming remake. 

Jeff's first three feature films all opened number #1 at the box office and set new box office records for their opening weekends.

Jeff is an Emmy nominated Executive Producer of the true story, CBS TV Movie, THE COURAGEOUS HEART OF IRENA SENDLER about the 2007 Nobel Peace Prize Nominee who saved 2500 children during WWII.  The TV film and Jeff Most were Emmy nominated and won several awards including winning an Emmy Award, a Christopher Award, and a Cammy Award.  The film also received Golden Globe, Writers Guild, Directors Guild, A.S.C Award, and Movieguide Award nominations for Best Television Movie.

Jeff is a member of the Writers Guild, Producers Guild and The Academy of Television Arts and Sciences.

IMDb:  http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0609184/

Website:  http://www.mostfilms.biz/

 

About The Writer/Director

Jack Snyder is an award-winning filmmaker who has written, directed, and produced both features and short films.In 2006, he co-wrote and directed the supernatural thriller, GHOST IMAGE, starring Elisabeth Rohm (American Hustle, Joy), and Stacey Dash (Clueless).  The film sold to 20th Century Fox and NBC/Universal and has aired hundreds of times on the Showtime Network and The Movie Channel.

In between making films, Jack has done many work-for-hire screenplays. He was the script-doctor on the film WALKING WITH THE  ENEMY in which he was hired specifically to write scenes for Ben Kingsley. The film was released in theaters nationwide in April of 2014.  

When Jack is not writing screenplays or making movies, he teaches several online media courses at the University of Missouri – St. Louis.  Jack and his family currently reside in Los Angeles.

IMDb:  http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0811468/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1 

See what people are already saying on "Return of Christ, the Movie's" Facebook page.

What We Need

We have our script written, locations scouted and are just months away from filming. We need to continue to spread the word and raise as much awareness for this project as possible so we can produce a movie of this magnitude to its full potential.

We can use all the help we can get and your contribution and purchase of a perk will go a long way in making sure we start filming as soon as possible. The funds received from your contributions and purchase of perks will be used for the following:

We have finished scouting across eight countries from the Holy Land in Israel to locations in Spain, Italy, Morocco and the UK.  We have made a concerted effort to find the look and setting to bring this epic story of Jesus to life. 

 We need your contribution to help complete the preparation period during which we will seek to achieve the financing of the film’s $30 million dollar budget. This includes traveling to finance symposiums to meet financiers and distributors worldwide.  We also need additional money to increase awareness of our project through social media platforms.  We will make this movie happen. We just need a little assistance from you to put us over the top. 

We are the first to film a documentary following our director and producer around the world scouting locations and describing the various challenges in determining suitable locations to film "Return of Christ."  Our videos can be viewed on Youtube on the channel:  "Return of Christ, the Movie."

Perks

This epic movie begins with the birth of Jesus, follows Him through His ministry, His miracles, His betrayal and His crucifixion. The story then takes us to the near future with the return of Jesus and His final earth-shaking conflict with the Anti-Christ. It is a historical drama, chronicling one of the most inspiring and fascinating figures in human history."Return of Christ."  This movie is revolutionary for its:· Depiction of the return of Jesus to battle the anti-Christ.· It will depict a portion of the New Testament that mankind has   pondered for 2,000 years.· It will be historically accurate sticking to the scholarly   interpretations of The Book of Revelation.Click here to visit our website and view more webisodes - www.returnofchrist.comAbout The ProducerProducer Jeff Most is the originating producer of the biggest independently owned franchise in Hollywood, THE CROW, which spawned four features, a TV series, video games, and an upcoming remake. Jeff's first three feature films all opened number #1 at the box office and set new box office records for their opening weekends.Jeff is an Emmy nominated Executive Producer of the true story, CBS TV Movie, THE COURAGEOUS HEART OF IRENA SENDLER about the 2007 Nobel Peace Prize Nominee who saved 2500 children during WWII.  The TV film and Jeff Most were Emmy nominated and won several awards including winning an Emmy Award, a Christopher Award, and a Cammy Award.  The film also received Golden Globe, Writers Guild, Directors Guild, A.S.C Award, and Movieguide Award nominations for Best Television Movie.Jeff is a member of the Writers Guild, Producers Guild and The Academy of Television Arts and Sciences.IMDb:  http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0609184/Website:  http://www.mostfilms.biz/ About The Writer/DirectorJack Snyder is an award-winning filmmaker who has written, directed, and produced both features and short films.In 2006, he co-wrote and directed the supernatural thriller, GHOST IMAGE, starring Elisabeth Rohm (American Hustle, Joy), and Stacey Dash (Clueless).  The film sold to 20th Century Fox and NBC/Universal and has aired hundreds of times on the Showtime Network and The Movie Channel.In between making films, Jack has done many work-for-hire screenplays. He was the script-doctor on the film WALKING WITH THE  ENEMY in which he was hired specifically to write scenes for Ben Kingsley. The film was released in theaters nationwide in April of 2014.  When Jack is not writing screenplays or making movies, he teaches several online media courses at the University of Missouri – St. Louis.  Jack and his family currently reside in Los Angeles.IMDb:  http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0811468/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1 See what people are already saying on "Return of Christ, the Movie's" Facebook page.
What We NeedWe have our script written, locations scouted and are just months away from filming. We need to continue to spread the word and raise as much awareness for this project as possible so we can produce a movie of this magnitude to its full potential.We can use all the help we can get and your contribution and purchase of a perk will go a long way in making sure we start filming as soon as possible. The funds received from your contributions and purchase of perks will be used for the following:We have finished scouting across eight countries from the Holy Land in Israel to locations in Spain, Italy, Morocco and the UK.  We have made a concerted effort to find the look and setting to bring this epic story of Jesus to life.  We need your contribution to help complete the preparation period during which we will seek to achieve the financing of the film’s $30 million dollar budget. This includes traveling to finance symposiums to meet financiers and distributors worldwide.  We also need additional money to increase awareness of our project through social media platforms.  We will make this movie happen. We just need a little assistance from you to put us over the top. We are the first to film a documentary following our director and producer around the world scouting locations and describing the various challenges in determining suitable locations to film "Return of Christ."  Our videos can be viewed on Youtube on the channel:  "Return of Christ, the Movie."Perks

story:
Our film is reuniting much of the crew from 2016’s Oak Bones. The primary crew is the Junior/Senior class from Messiah College’s Film and Media Arts program. The entire project is a high quality undergrad student work. We have students from all different disciplines making costumes, artist renderings, social media campaigns, and press releases.  Messiah has an exemplary program, with a rich history of beautifully filmed shorts. You can see who will be doing each crew position in our Gallery here on IndieGoGo.

Restraint is a Film about class warfare, and the haves and have nots. It is a science fiction film done in the classic tradition of speaking about social issues of our time, using primarily practical effects. Inequity between people is an important issue that is still happening today and that harms everyone. We hope our film will speak strongly to this issue.

How the Money will be spent when raised

We’re giving it our all to make the best film possible.  Each of the crew have put in their own money and time to make this film a reality.  We have a half dozen other crew members who are volunteering their time as well. And to top it all off Messiah College has graciously allowed us to use all the film equipment we need.  They have even purchased new pieces that will be used in the making of our film.

Even with all this we are still falling short of what we need to make the film.  We need money to pay for locations, high caliber actors, and feed the crew. As we may not reach our full goal here is a breakdown of how the money will be spent as we reach each landmark.

$1000-The first Thousand dollars will go to paying for locations, housing for actors on location, and costuming.

$2000-The second Thousand will go towards feeding the crew and actors, and travel expenses for actors.

$3000-The Third Thousand will be spent on Improving the food we feed people and the quality of everything else we have already listed.

$4000 The Final Thousand will go towards, paying for the film to be distributed to festivals, and paying for the perks we are giving you.

All money raised above the stated amount will go towards improving the quality of what we have already stated and for travel and other festival expenses.  Festivals are an expense that we have only allocated a relatively small amount of our budget given its actual cost.

Budget BreakDown

$1080-Feeding Cast and Crew on Set

$550-Locations and Permits

$870-Housing, Travel, Per Deim for Actors

$400-Perks

$500-Costuming and Effects

$600-Film Festival Entry

 

Thank You for taking the time to read our pitch and thank you for supporting us on this project.

story:
Curvy Girls Rock The Series (CGR), written by Shakesha Williams, was created with the idea that real women should be represented on television. The female leads of CGR are strong, independent, funny and ambitious women. They represent the majority of women around the country. CGR will allow women to see themselves onscreen. 

The Impact

The success of Curvy Girls Rock The Series will: 

  • Show Hollywood that it's time to cast size diversity in leading roles more often. 
  • Allow the creators of CGR to create the show with it's intended vision
  • Make it clear to the industry that plus size women are the majority, not the minority and can be sexy, desirable, proud, ambitious and intriguing. 

Jazzy is a beautiful, vivacious, confident , highly successful fashion blogger and plus size model. Self proclaimed fat Beyonce. She is a leader in the plus size fashion industry and speaks out on issues related to fat shaming and beauty in all sizes. She has everything and more. She's not looking for love. She's satisfied and single.

NAIMAH TERRY stars as Jazzy.   She is a NJ native and is studying acting at Shiek Studios and with Coach April Yvette Thompson.  Naimah has been professionally modeling for 3 years.  From national Modeling Campaigns for Ashley Stewart to Fit Modeling in China; Naimah has international fashion experience.   She is a recent graduate from Rutgers University, as well as, a motivational speaker for local non-profit organizations.

Adrienne is a fashion designer. She's cute, quirky, and wears her heart on her sleeve. Adrienne is obsessed with online dating but can't seem to find the one. Her closest friend, Bruce, is in love with her, but stuck in the “friend zone”.

ZOE GOSLIN stars as Adrienne. Zoë came to New York a year ago after graduating from the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art. In that time, she has done voiceover work and numerous theatrical productions, most recently appearing in "Much Ado About Nothing" at Easy Leap Theatre Company. Curvy Girls Rock marks her first web series, and she is thrilled to be part of a project that champions inclusivity and sisterhood.

Zuri is a museum owner and Reagan's ex-sister-in-law. A lover of art and culture, Zuri is well-educated, down to earth, funny, and has a dry sense of humor. When people see Zuri, the term black is beautiful comes to mind; she is self-confident and sexy.  She just broke things off with her long time love and  not interested in finding love, just growing with her museum. Her potential love interest is a world traveling photographer showing at her gallery.

ELLISHA MARIE stars as Zuri. Ellisha Marie is a New York native and first generation American, born to parents from the Island of Trinidad and Tobago. She attended A.M.D.A, the American Musical and Dramatic Academy, a college and conservatory of the performing arts, where she received training from top instructors from all over the country. After graduating AMDA, Ellisha Marie gained professional experience in singing and stage work opportunities. Ellisha Marie is very excited about making her TV/Film debut as “Zuri”.  She is honored to be a part of a movement that will inspire women to love and value their bodies and their true, authentic self. 

Reagan is Jazzy's assistant and recently divorced. She's not comfortable with herself. She lost her way and wants to reinvent herself. She's smart, creative and wants to start a new life. She's packed on the pounds after her divorce and wants to jump back into the dating world.

ANDREA ILENE SHAPIRO stars as Reagan. Andrea Ilene Shapiro is a comedian, actor, writer and voiceover artist from NYC. She has appeared on “Orange Is the New Black”, “Dr. Oz”, TLC’s “Suddenly Rich", was a finalist in the NBC “Welcome to Sweden” sketch contest, and in a bevy of independent films. As a comedian, Andrea was a finalist for Moveon.org's "Laughter Trumps Hate" stand-up contest & has performed at venues such as UCB, Gotham Comedy Club, Greenwich Village Comedy Club, Broadway Comedy Club and many more. She hosts the monthly all-female stand-up show “Saw Her Stand Up There” and the weekly show "Bunk Bed Time" at QED in Astoria which has been featured in Timeout NY, CBS and NY Times. She has written for XOJane & Slop Sandwich and is currently the host of “Cool Shit…And…Shit” with Missive Behavior Productions.

Ivy is a singer and entertainer. She is strong, but struggling with independence while dealing with her on-again, off-again relationship.

RASHEEDA WALLACE stars as Ivy. Rasheeda has worked and graced the stage with the likes of Chaka Khan, DMX, Talib Kweli, Patti Labelle, and Wyclef just to name a few.  She is also a curvy model.  She has been featured on Good Day New York and a host of other entertainment programs.  She is a business consultant int he (fix) fashion and entertainment industries. Rasheeda's rising star shines brightly is (as) an artist-prenuers.

Shane is Jazzy’s love interest. He’s a music festival programmer who comes back into Jazzy’s life. Will Jazzy and Shane rekindle their romance?

NATHAN M. RAMSEY stars as Shane. Nathan is an actor, singer and songwriter from the Bronx, New York. He served in the U.S. Air Force for eight years before he returned to New York in pursuit of a dream far too long deferred. During his time abroad , he traveled to 14 different countries and experienced a wide variety of cultures, which he channels to give his work a unique life that far extends his Bronx roots. Nathan has appeared on the Bronx's own Lehman Stages in Clifford Odets' "Waiting for Lefty" and Luis Rafael Sánchez's "The Passion of Antígona Perez". His film credits are spread throughout various short films, student films and, most recently, the independent feature film, "In Character" set to debut in 2017.

Bruce is a graphic designer and best friends with Adrienne. He is caring, kind and funny. The question remains is friendship all that Bruce wants from Adrienne?

NICK BOMBICINO stars as Bruce. Nick is an actor and musician based in NYC, born in small town Vermont. He studied at Ithaca College, and then went off to the UK to get his Masters at the Birmingham School of Acting. He hung around England after finishing his degree before moving to NYC. His Film and TV credits include "Totally Patriots" (2016) and "Skeleton Crew" (2016). His Off-Broadway and New York credits include "Delirium’s Daughters" (The Clurman); "The Two Gentlemen of Verona", Becky Shaw (Spicy Witch Productions); and "Hay Fever" (Birmingham Repertory Theatre) and "We Are Three Sisters" (The Old Joint Stock Theatre) in the UK.

Conroy is a photographer who is taken with Zuri. Will these two type A personalities ultimately find joy and comfort in one another?

SJ HANNAH stars as Conroy. SJ Hannah is thrilled to be a part of the cast of Curvy Girls Rock.  Onstage , he has performed in regional productions such as "Blues for an Alabama Sky", "Train is Comin", and most recently "Invisible Life, The Musical", based on the book by E. Lynn Harris at the World Famous Apollo Theatre.  He also toured the country as Simba in "The Lion King".  On the screen, he has been seen in "Mysteries at the Museum", and the award winning indie film, "Sneakers and Soul".    

Max is Reagan’s upstairs neighbor who stirs up a sexual awakening in her after her divorce.

DANTE SHARPE stars as Max. Dante was born and raised in West Palm Beach Florida. He played football and track, but after a major injury he never played the same again. After year of soul searching, he realized his passion for acting and moved to New York City. He feels that being able to create a story that can distract, embody or influence someone’s life in any way is what brings him most joy. This is Dante’s first web series.

 

WRITER AND CREATOR

Shakesha Williams has been in the entertainment business since 2003 where she was an intern for Universal Music Group in the urban publicity division of Motown Records. In 2006, she started Harlem Fusion Enterprises, a entertainment company. Harlem Fusion was the founder of concert series featuring indie artists in New York City and Atlanta. She was also VP of Publicity for record label Ru1 Records. In 2009, she began her career as a writer, producer and director. She has produced a series of short films and worked in various roles on commercials, web series and feature films. Most recently, Ms. Williams wrote and executive produced “My Story”, a short film that has received critical acclaim.

Challenges To Making The Series

This is considered an ultra low budget project by industry standards. But raising this money will make season one of CGR exactly the way it was envisioned. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute $$$ at this time, you can still help. SPREAD THE WORD! Let everyone you know about the Curvy Girls Rock Campaign.

story:
The project focuses on development of innovative on-line role game with elements of shooter and other styles, including educational elements. The design philosophy provides different players with the chance to play together in our world. The project will support possible shift of the user’s interest during the game, provide both convenient mechanisms of such shift and possibility of different types of users’ coexistence in a single space. Game environment will hardly compel or limit them.

The company’s project is a mass on-line game with educational elements. The communicative background of the project is virtual reality that represents different territories.

All actions of the game take place in the real time three dimension spaces, except for some actions held in specific interfaces, such as economic aspects. 

The logic of the game environment is successively built by means of property factors and principles, revealed by the project originators, such as capital, money, law, power, private property, etc., that characterize modern world order. The environment, constructed in such a way, will encourage different activities in the form they exist in reality, stimulating working with complex institutional objects.

The game is basically    RPG one, with elements of 3D shooter and the main idea of technocracy (science fiction). MMORPG/MMOFPS.

  • 3D – shooter (the basis is shooter with partial solo game);
  • Tactical shooter (the basis is team actions);
  • Stealth action (avoiding of possible hostile contact);
  • Economy (real economy emulation. Elements of MMORTS);
  • Adventure (quests, based on the game plot;
  • Specific quests;
  • Role play – RPG (development of the personage’s skills, elements of MMORPG).

The company plans to use the hybrid business-model of service monetization with an accent upon the free-to-play component.

Competitiveness of the developed game is caused by the following factors:

  • the game represents a new trend in the game industry.  Essentially, it is birth of a new game style.
  • the project is developed for a large number of users:
  • - people, who search for new knowledge in different spheres;
  • - people, who search for new experiences, feelings and emotions;
  • - gamers.

- solves a problem of comprehensibility and improvement of quality of information perception by participants of the project (solves problems of availability of the gained knowledge to the large number of people, taking into account dispensing, categorization, relevance, definition of the necessary information to eachparticipant of the project);

- solves problems of interaction of communities (small, average, big) in various directions (from private, to general), solving the problems of the game.

  • solves problems of availability of knowledge to the wide mass of people;
  • deals with problems of real IT tendencies;
  • is engaged in promoting and development of scientific activity.

Examples of technological advantages of the project:

  • tools for creation of own, unique game elements;
  • flexibility - the scalable and flexible interface in control, easily adaptable;
  •  use of experimental theory of training (training, based on experience).

  • Project of the global scale;
  • localization;
  • encouragement of any user’s participation ;
  • stimulation of personal progress of the user;
  • diversity of functions and flexibility;
  • reliability;
  • safety;
  • constant development of the project.

Cold Turkey is a psychological thriller being produced by students at the Westminster Film School, a highly regarded institution that is recognised for its work being screened in festivals around the world, going on to win student Oscars and has seen many successful alumni through its doors, some of which have gone on to win Academy Awards.

It tells the story of Ellie, a heroin addict going clean in an abandoned cabin. When David breaks into the cabin, Ellie unwittingly finds herself in a game of psychological cat and mouse with the mysterious man, as they both attempt to work each other out – and discover the dark secrets that they both hold. How far would someone go to be free from their past?

 

CHARACTERS

Ellie, mid 20’s, is a recovering drug addict who is in a weakened state due to her withdrawal from drugs. Each bruise or track mark hides a secret to a past that she so desperately wants to be free from, a desire that runs so strongly within her that she’ll go to extraordinary lengths to make it happen – even if there are people standing in her way.

DAVID, late 30s/early 40’s, is physically intimidating and robust. Whilst claiming to work in construction management, David arrives shrouded in mystery and holds any information regarding who he is close to his chest. He takes a particular interest in Ellie’s personal life, seemingly taking advantage of her weakened state. He is erratic and abrasive which puts Ellie on edge. His confidence in himself results in his downfall.

This is an intimate story, set entirely within the abandoned cabin that Ellie and David break into, and that’s why we need your help. Our plan is to build the cabin in our film studio and we want to make it as realistic and lifelike as possible. We want to create a set that not only looks fantastic on screen but also acts as a living, breathing environment for the actors to thrive in.

We’re aiming to raise £1,000 to put towards our budget through IndieGoGo. Any money that we receive will be witnessed on screen, as it will be used to create the cabin. The materials we need to purchase are expensive. Take a look at our floor plan for the cabin we're building below:

REWARDS

 

Through the help of your generosity our film will be able to come to life. To say thank you, we're able to offer rewards and perks in return for your kind donations, check them out:

£5 - Watch the film early.

£10 - A special thank you on our Facebook page + link to watch the film early.

£20 - Exclusive behind the scenes stills of the cast and crew working on set + link to watch the film early.

£50 - A signed version of the Cold Turkey script, signed by writer/producer Patrick Forster and director Harry Holroyd, exclusive behind the scenes stills of the cast and crew working on set + link to watch the film early.

£75 - Receive limited edition signed posters of the film signed by all of the crew, as well as a signed version of the Cold Turkey script, signed by writer/producer Patrick Forster and director Harry Holroyd, exclusive behind the scenes stills of the cast and crew working on set + link to watch the film early.

£150 - A MASSIVE thank you, including a thank you on our Facebook page and executive producer credit, receive the handmade lion statue prop especially made for the film, as well as limited edition signed posters of the film signed by all of the crew, exclusive behind the scenes stills of the cast and crew working on set + link to watch the film early.

We feel that ‘Cold Turkey’ has the potential to be a powerful film, one that stays with you long after you’ve seen it and makes you think. It explores themes of addiction and how far people are willing to go to gain their freedom. We’ve got a talented crew that have worked with each other previously, all of whom are bringing something different to the table.

 

Risks and challenges

As a project, ‘Cold Turkey’ brings a number of challenges that we can’t wait to tackle as we approach the shoot. We have learnt so much already from our time at Westminster Film School so far and we want to use these skills to tell the story of David and Ellie. One of the risks we face currently is the phenomenal cost of our production design. Our art department are working hard to build a phenomenal cabin, but we can only afford to make this fully through the help of fundraising.

 

Locations

While building the cabin in the studio presents us with the challenge of creating a set, we will also be shooting on location for one day. The final shot is so important to us and it’s crucial that we capture the woods that surround the cabin to enhance the viewing experience. This creates logistical problems such as transporting elements of our cabin set to the woods as well as equipment and the crew. Through the help of your donations, we will be able to support our travel costs for our cast and crew and assist out location fees to create this fantastic final shot.

(The final shot of the film to be shot on location at the woods)

Cast

We are currently in the midst of casting and it is a very exciting time. Our casting director, Katherine, has been in discussion with many great actors with the support of Patrick and Harry. Casting is especially important because the film is heavily performance based, revolving around two characters and the psychological games that they play with each other. This will give the actors a great chance to really explore the characters and bring out the exciting story of Cold Turkey.

Stunts

The film culminates in an intense fight scene that means we are going to bring in a professional stunt coordinator to ensure the stunts are carried out professionally and effectively. We will hire a trained stunt coordinator who can  ensure the fight scene is both safe and looks realistic on screen. Health and safety is of the highest importance when working on a film set, so we will ensure that our stunt coordinator is well trained to ensure that no one gets hurt - the help of your donations support our costs for a professional stunt coordinator.

 

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute but even just sharing this page would be a massive help to us! Thank you for your time and for checking out our campaign!
story_txt: Cold Turkey is a psychological thriller being produced by students at the Westminster Film School, a highly regarded institution that is recognised for its work being screened in festivals around the world, going on to win student Oscars and has seen many successful alumni through its doors, some of which have gone on to win Academy Awards.It tells the story of Ellie, a heroin addict going clean in an abandoned cabin. When David breaks into the cabin, Ellie unwittingly finds herself in a game of psychological cat and mouse with the mysterious man, as they both attempt to work each other out – and discover the dark secrets that they both hold. How far would someone go to be free from their past? CHARACTERSEllie, mid 20’s, is a recovering drug addict who is in a weakened state due to her withdrawal from drugs. Each bruise or track mark hides a secret to a past that she so desperately wants to be free from, a desire that runs so strongly within her that she’ll go to extraordinary lengths to make it happen – even if there are people standing in her way.DAVID, late 30s/early 40’s, is physically intimidating and robust. Whilst claiming to work in construction management, David arrives shrouded in mystery and holds any information regarding who he is close to his chest. He takes a particular interest in Ellie’s personal life, seemingly taking advantage of her weakened state. He is erratic and abrasive which puts Ellie on edge. His confidence in himself results in his downfall.This is an intimate story, set entirely within the abandoned cabin that Ellie and David break into, and that’s why we need your help. Our plan is to build the cabin in our film studio and we want to make it as realistic and lifelike as possible. We want to create a set that not only looks fantastic on screen but also acts as a living, breathing environment for the actors to thrive in.We’re aiming to raise £1,000 to put towards our budget through IndieGoGo. Any money that we receive will be witnessed on screen, as it will be used to create the cabin. The materials we need to purchase are expensive. Take a look at our floor plan for the cabin we're building below:REWARDS Through the help of your generosity our film will be able to come to life. story:
Our love interests. From left: Erin Caesar as "Alexis" and Omete Anassi as "Nick." Photo courtesy of Joy Ofodu.

The Inspiration and Impact

In mass media narratives focusing on Black stories are rare, and Black love stories are often even rarer. When Black narratives do exist their stories are often oversimplified and one-dimensional, misrepresenting Black experiences, or worse, perpetuating harmful stereotypes about the Black community.

Our film, Flowers, is meant to combat this, by presenting a narrative not often seen in the media; Flowers is a story that represents an authentic day in the life of four black San Diego teens. Since the film is based off the experience of  Writer/Director Nick Earl, it presents the audience with appropriate portrayals of Black San Diego teens, which Nick hopes can help the audience humanize and empathize with these three-dimensional characters and force them to realize that their lives, and representation, matter.

The Team Behind It

Nicholas Earl - Writer/Director

My name is Nicholas Earl. I was born in Flint, Michigan and have been living in San Diego, California for the past 7 years. Inspired by my love for animation, I’m currently studying Cinema and Media Studies with a minor in Screenwriting at the University of Southern California’s School of Cinematic Arts (SCA), where I’ve been introduced and exposed to the world of live-action filmmaking. After aspiring to be an animator for so long, my experiences at SCA has inspired me explore my newfound love and respect for storytelling through live action filmmaking. Flowers is only the beginning of a long list of stories I wish to tell, but, nonetheless, it is one that I feel I need to tell first. The concept for Flowers was inspired by my teenage experiences growing up in San Diego. With this film, I explore universal life struggles such as dating and young love. However, most importantly, I do so by telling the overlooked story of  minorities living within a majority white community. I want to give a new perspective both culturally and cinematically to San Diego by telling my story. As many of you know, the film and television industries have historically overlooked, stereotyped and/or silenced minority voices, especially those of the black community. And stepping outside of San Diego community to come to USC only emphasized how belittled and forgotten about the black community was in the city of San Diego- associating it only with the ritzy areas of La Jolla or Torrey Pines. My goal with this film is to focus on authentic storytelling, to step into a day in the life of black kids in San Diego as they face struggles we can all empathize with: dating in the 21st century. With this film, I want to challenge cultural expectations and bring black people to the forefront, not only to represent our community but also to humanize it for other communities.

Bringing a film to life will always be a grueling task, but that’s why I’ve assembled such a talented team to help bring my vision to fruition.

 

Lauren Foley- Producer

Born and raised in Pasadena, California, Lauren Foley graduated from Westridge School for Girls in 2015 and enrolled at the University of Southern California, where she is currently a Sophomore. Inspired by her lifelong passion for storytelling and filmmaking, Lauren is majoring in Narrative Studies and double-minoring in Cinematic Arts and Screenwriting. Lauren keeps herself busy at USC as an executive board member for the Women of Cinematic Arts (WCA) where she curates student events to foster a community of female driven filmmakers.

Interested in filmmaking from an early age, Lauren has gained ample experience working both in front of and behind the camera as an actor, director, editor, script supervisor, and production assistant, among other things. As a result of her work on over 10 different productions, both student and professional, Lauren has acquired a unique understanding of the different aspects of production as well as a holistic perspective on the processes of filmmaking.

Outside of her academics, Lauren spent three years interning at the National Council of Jewish Women Los Angeles (NCJWLA), a nonprofit grassroots advocacy organization, where she Co-Created the Teen Advocacy Working Group in 2014 and, most notably, The Talk Project in 2015. The Talk Project, a peer-to-peer sexual violence education program for high school students, visited over 1,000 students in its first year, including local Los Angeles high schools Oakwood, LACES, Milken, Detoledo, and Brighten Hall. The Talk Project expanded Lauren’s skill set, propelling her to not only research, write, and edit an academic curriculum but also become a social media manager, graphic designer, peer-educator, and peer-trainer for the program. In the summer of 2016 Lauren culminated her work with both NCJWLA and The Talk Project by curating a student art show, “Rise”. Afterwards, Lauren passed on her position of Co-Chair to a new generation of student leaders. Through her experience with The Talk Project, Lauren strengthened her leadership skills- influencing her to listen more carefully, think more creatively, lead more holistically, and manage more effectively.

Currently, Lauren is working as a development intern for Daniel L. Paulson Productions where she assists with the production of the second season of their hit series Chesapeake Shores. Next year Lauren will be the Co-Vice President of the Women of Cinematic Arts at USC where she will be in charge of planning events, managing her team, and producing projects for student outreach.

 

Nisha Malhotra- Producer

Born and raised in Glendale, California, Nisha Malhotra graduated with honors from Mayfield Senior School in 2015. Following Mayfield, Nisha enrolled at the University of Southern California. Now a rising junior at USC, Nisha is majoring in Narrative Studies and double minoring in Cinematic Arts and Screenwriting. From a young age, Nisha pursued her love of writing in many different forms, including fiction and poetry writing, for which she’s won 5 awards, including the John J. Connolly Award for Creative Writing. Most recently, Nisha had a piece she wrote post-2016 election published in a poetry and flash fiction anthology titled Only Light Can Do That.

Following high school, Nisha continued to pursue her love of writing through comedy; shortly after joining the USC community Nisha became a writer for USC Trojan Vision’s The Breakdown, a news satire show. Nisha has been a writer/performer for The Breakdown since she joined USC. Just this past semester, Nisha joined another Trojan Vision show, SC Comedy Live, as an Executive Producer. Through Trojan Vision Nisha has expanded her understanding of live television and been given ample experience both in front and behind studio cameras.

When Nisha is not studying or working for Trojan Vision, she is interning within the film industry; in the past year Nisha has worked as a development intern for both Lionsgate Motion Pictures, where she worked closely with Executive Producer Bobby Cohen, and Indigo Films. Through her two development internships Nisha has learned the intricacies of the pre-production process- serving her well during the pre-production process of Flowers.

 

The Cast

Photo courtesy of Joy Ofodu.

Omete Anassi as "Nick"

Omete Anassi is a first generation Kenyan-American from Houston, Texas, born and raised. This May, he graduated from the University of Southern California with a bachelor's degree in Neuroscience. As an artist, Omete is an actor, public speaker and spoken word poet. His ultimate dream is to infuse his knowledge of Neuroscience into his performance craft while all in all being a walking, breathing, living representation of triumph.

 

Photo courtesy of Joy Ofodu.

Erin Caesar as "Alexis"

Erin Caesar is a first-generation Trinidadian American and a third year undergraduate student at the University of Southern California, studying business and cinematic arts. She plans to combine these skills to work in the creation and promotion of film and television. She recently interned for the Pembroke Taparelli Arts & Film Festival, a social-justice focused film festival in Hollywood, CA. Erin hopes to create and promote content that both entertains and encourages productive conversations about race, which is why she is so excited to be a part of the "Flowers" team!

 

Photo courtesy of Joy Ofodu.

Tyreece Santana as "Steven"

Tyreece Santana is a senior at the University of Southern California studying Communication and Music Industry. Originally from the Bronx, New York, Tyreece came to Los Angeles to access greater opportunities and meet new people but soon got hooked on the California weather. Tyreece has always had a soft spot for acting and considers it his favorite hobby, which is... why he's so excited to start production on "Flowers." In his free time Tyreece enjoys writing and listening to music, watching movies, playing video games, basketball, and traveling. But Tyreece's main career aspiration is to become a successful rapper- one that is able to make a real difference in the world, beyond just plaques and awards. Tyreece has a similar hope for "Flowers." By bringing focus to a day in the life of black teens, Tyreece hopes that “Flowers” can not only resonate with its audience but also create change through wider media representation.

 


Photo courtesy of Joy Ofodu.

Ozodi Onyeabor as "Tiana"

Born in Miami, FL and raised in Oklahoma and Texas, Ozodi Onyeabor, of Nigerian-descent, is currently a student at the University of Southern California. Ozodi is pursuing her Bachelor's in Communication and Master's in Communication Management. As a social scientist and media analyst, Ozodi studies the social hegemonic formulas of media, where she answers the question "what's the solution?" As she strives to curate new waves of representation in the realms of music, fashion, and social culture, she's also a researcher of diversity/inclusion in the music industry, and a budding Creative Director. Through her media activism, she aspires to curate content away from the racialized media market and mainstream norms. Ozodi's personal and professional experiences have inspired her involvement with "Flowers." With “Flowers” Ozodi is fostering an evolution of race representation in media and art; an evolution led by minorities to create images that are more authentic, holistic, and inclusive than ever.

 

The Logistics

The film will be shot over four days in San Diego. All of the proceeds of this campaign go towards funding the production, with around 80% of the budget going towards equipment, housing, and food, and the last 20% of budget going towards miscellaneous fees and festival submissions fees.

Here’s a visual breakdown of our budget:


 

Why You Should Be A Part of It

Our cast, producers, and writer/director Nicholas Earl. Clockwise from left: Nisha Malhotra, Erin Caesar, Nicholas Earl, Ozodi Onyeabor, Lauren Foley, Tyreece Santana, and Omete Anassi. Photo courtesy of Joy Ofodu.

By contributing to our film, you are financially investing in diversifying the landscape of our media and art. Investing in Flowers means being a part of a movement as much as it means being a part of a film. With your donation, you are supporting the next generation of filmmakers- encouraging them to use their voices to make a difference.

If you believe in our story please help us make this film a reality and get your name in our credits- or a virtual high five in the least!

story:
The Legend of the Crumpets

In 2013 Crumpet Quest began as a simple after college film project and has now blossomed like a sexy flower into something truly beautiful.

Now the year is 2017 and Crumpet Quest is coming to it's climactic conclusion. So what better way to finish the series than making it a feature length, fully funded extravaganza. With your help and donations we can invest in costumes, props, equipment, editing software and crumpets.

More information under the big crumpet.

(Above: Title card test for the film)

The Project

With your support and backing we can fulfil our dream of finishing this film in the best way possible. 

We are looking to raise £1,500 for the project to put towards costumes for our large cast of extravagant characters, new equipment to raise the cinematic quality of the picture and updating our editing software to really make every step of the production as high quality as we believe it deserves to be.

Crumpet Quest has always been our most accessible series, the story has built over several years and many people have joined the cast as time has gone by, meaning "Return of the Crumpet" will have the biggest cast of any of our films to date.

Although this is a huge and ambitious project Ansel and Rob (the directors) have over a decade of experience under their belts, being at university studying film and working with the likes of Channel 4, White Lantern Films Bournemouth and the BFI, with this experience we know that we can make this the final instalment momentous.

 

The Important Part- What you get in return!

As well as being a part of a film production, we think our project needs to be as fair as it can be. So we believe that we have made our perks definitely worth what you are donating!

With more information on each of them at the right hand side of this page the perks range from £5 to a whopping £1,000! In return for you kind donations you'll receive such rewards as: Personalised thank you videos, Executive Producer credits, VIP Tickets to the premiere and much more!

Take a more in depth look into each of them at the side! ---->

Risks & Challenges

With any film production anything can go wrong at anytime, whether it is in pre, mid or post production. So being aware of the possible problems and planning accordingly is the best way to avoid any mishaps.

Both Ansel and Rob have worked on large scale productions before at both student and professional levels meaning that they understand the necessity of planning before shooting and from years of experience are aware of all the challenges of working on a big budget picture.

The biggest challenge we will face in this project will be directing a large cast with the number ever expanding of speaking roles and a growing number of extras as well. Ansel and Rob have worked on productions with lots of people but as the directors they will have to maintain their cool whilst making sure everything is kept to the schedule and is most importantly fun!

Spread the word

We understand that it isn't always easy to just donate money to things like this but think of it as your big opportunity to be a part of something really unique and help us to make Crumpet Quest VI: Return of the Crumpet the best it can be!

So let's spread this campaign like warm butter on crumpets and really make the most of every day of this!

Love the Pretty Good Films team <3
story_txt:
The Legend of the Crumpets
In 2013 Crumpet Quest began as a simple after college film project and has now blossomed like a sexy flower into something truly beautiful.
Now the year is 2017 and Crumpet Quest is coming to it's climactic conclusion. So what better way to finish the series than making it a feature length, fully funded extravaganza. With your help and donations we can invest in costumes, props, equipment, editing software and crumpets.
More information under the big crumpet.


(Above: Title card test for the film)
The Project
With your support and backing we can fulfil our dream of finishing this film in the best way possible. 
We are looking to raise £1,500 for the project to put towards costumes for our large cast of extravagant characters, new equipment to raise the cinematic quality of the picture and updating our editing software to really make every step of the production as high quality as we believe it deserves to be.
Crumpet Quest has always been our most accessible series, the story has built over several years and many people have joined the cast as time has gone by, meaning "Return of the Crumpet" will have the biggest cast of any of our films to date.
Although this is a huge and ambitious project Ansel and Rob (the directors) have over a decade of experience under their belts, being at university studying film and working with the likes of Channel 4, White Lantern Films Bournemouth and the BFI, with this experience we know that we can make this the final instalment momentous.


 
The Important Part- What you get in return!
As well as being a part of a film production, we think our project needs to be as fair as it can be. So we believe that we have made our perks definitely worth what you are donating!
With more information on each of them at the right hand side of this page the perks range from £5 to a whopping £1,000! In return for you kind donations you'll receive such rewards as: Personalised thank you videos, Executive Producer credits, VIP Tickets to the premiere and much more!
Take a more in depth look into each of them at the side! ---->

Risks & Challenges
With any film production anything can go wrong at anytime, whether it is in pre, mid or post production. So being aware of the possible problems and planning accordingly is the best way to avoid any mishaps.
Both Ansel and Rob have worked on large scale productions before at both student and professional levels meaning that they understand the necessity of planning before shooting and from years of experience are aware of all the challenges of working on a big budget picture.
The biggest challenge we will face in this project will be directing a large cast with the number ever expanding of speaking roles and a growing number of extras as well. Ansel and Rob have worked on productions with lots of people but as the directors they will have to maintain their cool whilst making sure everything is kept to the schedule and is most importantly fun!

Spread the word
We understand that it isn't always easy to just donate money to things like this but think of it as your big opportunity to be a part of something really unique and help us to make Crumpet Quest VI: Return of the Crumpet the best it can be!
So let's spread this campaign like warm butter on crumpets and really make the most of every day of this!
Love the Pretty Good Films team <3

story:
The Story:

In a world where everybody has planet Earth for head, we focus on a young man that instead was born with planet Mars for one. He's never lived a normal life and now in his early 20s he awaits for his death, expected to come within 3 months. With not having done much in his life he is as unprepared for death as anybody can be.

Mars still manages to grasp some comfort in his activities, but it is not until he meets a special girl, that his fate starts to change.

 

 

About the Crew:

 

Producer/Writer/Director

 

Gerardo J. De Sousa is a Venezuelan independent film director, screenwriter, producer, cinematographer, editor, and actor. His work covers a wide variety of genres and is characterized by the themes on the battles of truth, nature and humanity often depicted in unrealistic worlds such as the eccentric world of Care Package and the dream-like visual and narrative style of the world of Kukla. His most recent films include: Goldfish (Producer and Cinematographer); Nightcapes (Producer, Co-Director and Cinematographer); Kukla (Producer, Director, Writer, Editor)  Most of his films were produced in South Florida under Blue Nebula Pictures which him and Film Director Scott Alexander Naar lead. Gerardo is now living in Dallas, Texas where he co-produced and co-directed Cassie Marin’s music video for her single “Light” and is now working on his next short film "Life On Mars" which is expected to be released on December 2017.

Actress (Tierra) / Composer

Cassie Marin is a vocalist, multi instrumentalist, producer, film composer and actress. She worked with Gerardo De Sousa in the challenging short film Kukla, where she extensively trained to perform the stunts on the silks in order to play the role of the main character. She has performed on stage and in front of the camera and is always eager to act whenever her musical work allows her. Cassie’s sweet, powerful and angelic voice will be behind the Earth mask of Tierra.

Producer/Cinematographer

Scott Alexander Naar

Scott Alexander Naar is a Jamaican born filmmaker. At the age of 19 he decided to pursue a career in creating films after leaving a career of music after falling in love with the idea of visual storytelling. Since, Scott has made 8 short films and one feature. Two of his short films Nightscapes which was co-directed with Gerardo De Sousa, and Another "Goldfish" are currently on the festival circuit in films festivals in Florida and New York. Currently, he is working on his alleged final Short Film, "Hallie" which will double as his Thesis Film for his graduate degree at the UM cinema department.

 

Anything Helps! We Love You!

If you donate any amount of money you will  become like part of our crew! You will receive exclusive content, updates and will get access to watch the film before anybody else does! Life On Mars is going to be a unique experience and hopefully you want to become part of it!

If you cannot donate anything but you like what you hear you can still help by sharing this with your friends and family. Lets do it for Mars!

 

Where does all that money go?

The films biggest expense is making the masks for our actors. We want them to look unlike anything out there, and also fit perfectly on our actors so they can become part of them. Included in this expense is also the character's distinctive wardrobe, which is going to set a tone of nostalgia for the 90s. 

We also have other expenses, here I’ll break it down into sections:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We want to take good care of what you are donating to. So as you can see, we have a budget set for drives....From the camera cards to storage drives, we consider both very important. We want to record for you on the best quality and keep everything  as safe as possible. For that we are going to need speed and storage, assuring that you will get to watch this film in time with no delays.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

This is a film that requires meticulous design. From costume, wardrobe and locations, everything is intended to feel a certain way and for this we need  as much control as we can get on every aspect of the film. Your donations will truly help  us achieve this vision the way it ought to be, bringing to life the biggest and most alive world Gerardo has envisioned.

 

 

 

Message from the Director

“This is not just a film, this has been quite a unique experience that started since I wrote the first draft of the script. I’ve carried the film in my heart for a while now, and I'm eager to share the experience with you. The film, I believe, is intended to unify us in this lonely planet of ours and therefore I firmly believe that it should be done with the unison of as many people as possible. If you help us, your fingerprints will forever be on this film...The crew and I will forever be grateful for your help. Feel free to reach out to me personally if you are excited about this film, I’ll be sure to reply.” 

-Gerardo

story:
Unfortunately, being passionate about storytelling (which we are!) is not enough because people sill insist in eating food and keep asking for money for things like rentals and stuff… (rolls eyes).

 

Our teachers say crowdfunding is for Friends, Family and Fools, but given my previous experience I honestly think this is NOT TRUE. I was very lucky to raise just about enough to make my last short film (which you can watch here: on VIMEO). We had access to LA screens through festivals like the Hollywood Reel Independent Film Festival and a European Premiere to an audience of over 1500 people thanks to RootedCON who believed in our project from the very beginning. The project just went live (with no password as of March 2nd) and it raised 400 views in a couple of days. It is Creative Commons 4.0, so feel free to use it and share it and maybe have someone learn something in the meantime!

 

We have a new story to tell. One that may be known to many. The story about the sacrifices made by those who flee their hometown to live like expats in the search of something better.

Help us prove film is not for fools, but for passionate people that believe in telling stories and spreading words; for people who want to contribute to the most collaborative art form of them all; and for those who dream of electric sheep.

LOGLINE: During a temporary visit back in his hometown, a young expat will have to face off his own personal daemons and decisions that took him where he is now. How would his life be different had he taken other routes?

The story of how often expats become detached from their home places but can’t still fit in the new place, hence having a feeling of rootlessness and uncertainty on where and why they are heading to. Coming to terms with not being able to always be there and still letting friends and family know you care so much about them. Always an outsider. Because when you’re -9 hours away from your loved ones, there is a time of the day when being an outsider kicks in so hard. That is 3pm. Absolutely everyone you knew up until now goes to bed. Facebook has no voice anymore. No WhatsApp, no texts, no Skype… and you’re on your own, unprotected and ready to face the unlit part of the world as it makes its turn into the night.

7 people at a dinner reunion, a steadicam operator and a crew of 20 will dance to a 15 minute oner (one shot) carefully rehearsed to perfection. Lighting and set dressing will change live during the take and every single detail will be finely tuned to get ONE WAY, and one only, made. The one way you chose when you decide to move abroad.

 

First, we’re going to rub the money all over ourselves, just like Demi Moore in Indecent Proposal. Then, we’re going to kiss each and every dollar bill. Then we’ll fill a pool with the money and do backstrokes through it. Then we’ll bury the money and agree to tell no one about it. Then we’ll turn on each other and make accusations. Eventually, we’ll be forced to put the money in a bank.

But once the money is safely in the hands of a responsible adult every singles dollar will go to the movie or costs involved with shipping the perks (to your right!).

This is how the budget is broken down at the moment:

Notice that most cast and crew are not being paid at the moment. BECAUSE WE CAN’T AFFORD IT. If we go over our basic budget to cover basic expenses (again: food, rentals, insurance and big people stuff), we’ll pay EVERY SINGLE PERSON INVOLVED (but myself). And this is MY DREAM guys. I dream every night with the day I’m able to afford the quality time my colleagues dedicate to my projects.

 

  • Stalk us all over the internet and FOLLOW us. We’re on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. 
  • Get extra karma and LIKE whatever we post, and you’ll be helping us by spreading a kind word to even more people.
  • SHARE by reposting our stuff. Or posting your own.
  • Buy us a coffee! Even if you can’t contribute any other way. If we met at a coffee shop and I was out of cash, would you kindly invite me? (pretty please?) Thank also helps!

story:
What is Flop?

Flop is the story about a young man named Kyle whose overactive imagination has kept him sidelined in his own love life for as long as his best friend Shawn can remember. With a big push from Shawn, Kyle's finally going to get out of his head and make a move. Oh by the way, they're puppeteers for a children's TV show who exclusively control two rapping puppets named Flip (Shawn) and Flop (Kyle). Also, Kyle's latest crush is the new puppet-maker, Marissa.

The script for Flop won 2nd place at Cinequest earlier this year (https://www.cinequest.org/screenwriting-2017-aw...), and we believe with proper financing we can get the finished product into Cinequest and other prominent film festivals.

The "professionals" said that this movie would cost $35,000 to make, which is hella expensive for a short film. I'm here to tell you that I have a lot of talented friends and we're pretty damn sure we can make a quality flick for $10,000. 

About the Team

Writer/director Nick Coleman and his Director of Photography, Joshua Parrera, have made almost 30 short films together. And most of the cast and crew have worked with them either on a movie, or on stage at the Sacramento Comedy Spot where they do improv and sketch comedy together. 

Which means everyone from craft services to the lead role has had their comedic talents battle-tested by live audiences. They're all talented artists and they don't want their name on some garbage. So even though the director has the ice cold stare of a Terminator, none of his friends are scared of him like he wishes and they will definitely yell something at him, like "no, you don't need that f***ing dolly shot right there, dude!"

What We Need & What You Get

PRODUCTION COSTS:

PERKS:

We don't just want you for your money, we want you to be a part of the experience. So on top of all the same stuff you see in other IndieGoGo campaigns, like posters and DVDs, we also have a lot of original, unique perks that will make you slap your knee and shout out, "Hot dang! Deal me in!" — You get to star in  a puppet rap video that will be part of the movie, you get to name a puppet, you can get a line in the movie, and if you're big ballin' we'll come make a one minute movie based on your own idea and starring you. We'll also film your wedding (this is something we've actually done a bunch, so we'll look/act professional, and not get too drunk). 

NOTE: Hover over the "Estimated Delivery Date" to reveal the "Get The Perk" button to make your selection.

The Impact

As far back as I can remember, I always wanted to be a filmmaker. I would grab my parent's giant VHS camcorder, gather the neighborhood kids together, and make such unfinished classics as Space Cons and Underwater Massacre. 

The making of movies fell to the wayside as I got distracted first by puberty, then by joining the Army, then by a string of random jobs as I hopped from town to town, looking to make right what once went wrong. 

Then one day I stumbled into the Sacramento Comedy Spot. I started doing improv and tried out stand-up, but it was the writing of sketch comedy and seeing people act out my words on stage that really drew me in. I soon had my own monthly sketch comedy show, where I met my Director of Photography, Josh, and several other collaborators who are still with me today.

I wanted our sketch show to stand out from the others, so I decided we'd put video sketches in between each live sketch. This got us going on churning out funny videos on a deadline. It also gave us the feedback of a live audience, rather than just sitting around hoping people are watching it on YouTube.

Fast forward to last year when we made our first narrative short film for a festival. Happy Accidents was made in a few weeks on a zero dollar budget and it won Producer's Choice and Best Supporting Actor (Jesse Jones). It also played really well to a packed house and it made me realize that I can write a good script and that I can make a good movie.

I believe Flop can be a great movie that will showcase, not just my talent, but the talent of everyone on board. I think it will take us to the next level and allow us to make bigger and better things. This isn't a hobby for me, it's what I need to do. It's the only thing I'm good at. I just need you to believe in me and my team then we'll take it from there. 

CUE "I Believe I Can Fly" by R. Kelly

Risks & Challenges

We're filming a 20-minute short film! I believe in the material, but 20 minutes could turn off some festivals that are looking for shorter content in order to program more shorts. But Flop is exactly as long as it needs to be and I think that if we have the cash to back the vision, audiences will wish it were 20 minutes longer.

Other Ways You Can Help

Times might be tough for you and you just can't contribute financially. But what you can do for us is share this with people who might be interested, direct message it to them, cold call your relatives, possibly knock over a lemonade stand. However you help us get money, we won't judge.

If we raise more than our goal...

... that money will be divided amongst those who worked for free on the film.

story:
Hey guys!

Riley Dayne here and I want to thank you for checking out my brand new Indiegogo campaign.

For those of you who don’t know me, I'm a young filmmaker from Canada and I'm raising money to make my second movie!

Many of you may know me from my first film “The Abundance Factor”...where I travelled the world on a quest to understand how we can create abundance and live our dreams...which has been seen 1.3 million times!

But now I'm back for a second mission!

This time I'm travelling the world interviewing entrepreneurs on mission to unlock the secrets to success!

In a movie called...

Age Of The Entrepreneur!

Here's a sample of some of the AMAZING entrepreneurs I'll be talking to: 

  • Lewis Howes, creator of the school of greatness podcast, who was just featured on Ellen DeGeneres!
  • Neil Patel, co-founder of Crazy Egg and adviser to companies like Amazon, NBC & HP!
  • Dave Asprey, founder of Bulletproof and author of New York Times bestseller The Bulletproof Diet!
  • Kevin Harrington, the inventor of the infomercial and an original Shark on Hit TV show, Shark Tank!
  • Robin Sharma, world renowned global leadership expert and New York Times bestselling author!
  • Joel Brown, Australian entrepreneur and creator of addicted2success.com!
  • T Harv Eker, author of “Secrets Of The Millionaire Mind” which has helped over 1.5 million people move closer to their goal of true financial freedom!
  • Brian D. Evans, Inc. 500 Entrepreneur, Forbes Top Marketing Influencer, Founder/CEO of Influencive...

As well as so many other amazing entrepreneurs, including  JJ Virgin, Clinton Senkow, Alex Brown, Sonia Ricotti, Alexi Panos, Dana Wilde, Preston Smiles, Drew Little, Wes Hayden, Alex Morton, Sean Cannell, Anik Singal, Tom Bilyeu, and countless others!

But...

The number one question I've gotten while on this journey is why?

Why Are You Making THIS Movie?

...Why do you care about entrepreneurship?

And the answer is simple:

I want to see the world succeed, I want to see YOU succeed, I want to help to end struggle.

You see growing up, my dad was very successful entrepreneur; he had built a 6 figure internet business back in the late 90s at the height of the internet boom...

But in 2008 when the great collapse happened, that fall shattered my father’s business...

We lost everything...

First we lost our cars...

Then we lost our family home...

But we never lost hope...

As a family of five, we moved in with my grandmother and got to work, rebuilding from the ground up.

And I want this movie to do the same for you, I want this movie to give you hope...

Because I truly believe...

This film can change the world!

You see, entrepreneurs built the car, entrepreneurs built the New York skyline, entrepreneurs built the computer, tablet or iPhone you're reading this on right now...

Entrepreneurs are the ones pushing humanity forward!

So whether you have a dream of starting your own business, but you don't know where to start, or you already are an entrepreneur and you want to go grow...

This Movie is For You!

In fact:

This movie is for anyone who doesn't want to have to worry about bills again...

This movie is for anyone who is sick and tired of living pay check to pay check...

This movie is for anyone who wants to take fate into their own hands and build something that can not only change your life forever - but create a business that can impact millions & make the world a better place!

Because the age of struggle, the age of the 9-5, the age of waking up every day to do something you hate is over....

This... this is right now...

This is the Age of the Entrepreneur!

So please...

DONATE NOW & reap the rewards of fast action takers :)

story:
About Saturday night Belleville Sunday morning Bagnolet

 

This is a short film about Claire, a beautiful and ambitious young woman, who wakes up one morning in bed with a total stranger. She is embarrassed and disoriented and tries to leave while he is still asleep. Unfortunately, her shoe falls down when she is almost out of the apartment and Matthew, the stranger, wakes up. They engage into an awkward conversation and Claire finds out how she ended up there. Usually so in control of everything in her life, Claire judges herself for a one night stand. Matthew notices that and comes up with a charming idea how to make her feel better.

This is a story about compassion, humanity, kindness and a bit of imagination;)

 

Our team

 

Daria Simakova, Director, Russia and Switzerland 

Felipe Paiva, Director of Photography, Brazil

Marianna Achba, Production Manager, Georgia

Petr Vinokurov, First Assistant Director, Russia

Valentina Casadei, Production Designer, Italie

Alberto Paez, Casting Director, Venezuela

 

Our Cast

 

Claire - Clémence Thooris

Matthew - Léo Lebesgue

 

Where is the money going

 

The goal of the campaign is to raise funds to finance this short film. This money will help us pay for: 

Location - the most complicated and expensive part. We need one location for the film - a spacious loft where the characters wake up and get to know each other

Equipment - even though most of the equipment is provided by our school EICAR, there are some additional pieces of equipment that we need to buy/rent in order to achieve the best visual and audial quality of the film

Production Design - it includes not only the design of the loft and necessary props but also wardrobe and make up

Catering - it is as important as the other categories, cast and crew need to eat

Transportation - a van has to be hired to transport camera equipment and props

 

Other way of helping us

We absolutely understand that financial help is not always possible. If you'd like to help us, please share this campaign with your friends!

story:
Stephanie + Justin

Stephanie began creating professional dance work in 2012 in Austin, Texas. She liked it enough to continue choreographing works in Asheville, NC and the San Francisco Bay Area; the latter of which awarded her company (Stephanie Patrick Dance) the Principal Creative and Performing Arts first-ever Starving Artists Award in 2015, and two residencies at SAFE House Arts. Now back in Texas, she made her first dance film while driving from San Francisco to Austin - and became addicted to directing site-specific dance work for the camera. She was granted the Dance Artist Development Award in 2016 in support of her dream to make Against Shadows! You can view her previous works at www.StephaniePatrick.me.

Justin has had the pleasure of directing and shooting broadcast, commercial and corporate spots for HBO, Logitech, Verizon Wireless, A+ Federal Credit Union, Sweetwater Living, Grooveshark, LHP Hospital Group, Fuddruckers, Ducati, Doritos, University of Texas School of Education, University of North Texas, among others. He's worked on productions featuring Coors Light and Home Depot. Agencies he's worked with include The Richards Group, ClickHere, Invodo and Tilted Chair Creative. Learn more at www.DigitalShakedown.com. 

Impact

Performer + Crew Pay: It takes a lot of time and cost to create a dance film! The biggest expense is paying the performers and crew what they deserve for their hours of work. We are also giving a small royalty fee to our Scene 1 musician. It takes lifelong training to become a professional artist, and most industry level professionals are underpaid. Please show the team your appreciation! 

Festivals: We will apply Against Shadows to film festivals around the country! Each festival will require an application fee upon submission.

Watch Party: Lastly, we hope to have the budget for a public watch party once our festival submissions have been finalized! 

Funding Breakdown

Each professional performer receives $10/hr for their work on the film. Our team is:

Dancers: Lauren Parra, Krista Robinson, Alex Miller, Mahalaya Tintiangco-Cubales, Kyle Limin, Robyn Nariyoshi, Leslie Panitchpakdi, Michael Love, Alyssa Myers, and Stephanie Patrick.

Musician: Domino.

Creative Team (production, photography, and sound): Justin Kirchhoff, David Kallison, Kyle Kirchhoff, Rafael Alba, Nate Laningham. 

Numbers

Artist Pay (Dancers + Musician + Crew): $2,000.00

Film Festival Costs + Submission Fees: $1,000.00

Public Watch Party: $1,000.00

What's in it for You?

All art that we enjoy takes time, money, and resources to produce. As lifelong artists, we love making others happy with our creations, allowing audiences to think about a personal or societal situation in a new context, and/or motivating creative action in others. We believe art is a human necessity, and it will continue to be created and enjoyed whether or not it is funded; that being said, if our work made you a little happier, a little wiser, or inspired, we'd love to receive your financial appreciation. We want to continue to up our creative ante for our growing audience, and we can only do that with monetary resources. Your help is crucial in making this film come to life, and your impact will be greatly appreciated! 

As we are not currently a 501(c)3 non-profit organization, your donations are not tax deductible at this time.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute. But that doesn't mean you can't help! Show that you believe in our campaign by sharing it on social media or privately sending it to someone of whom can donate on your behalf.

story:
We are two women who decided to write a story that shows our lives and many other women's lives:  happy, career driven, romance filled, exciting, and sometimes rocky, yet always surrounded by accepting people of all different backgrounds, orientations, and creeds. Because why should we continue to see our lives on screen represented as anything but that?

How did this come about?

Hello! Shani Hadjian here, the co-creator, writer, director, and "Isabella" in Up or Out. Elise Murphy (co-creator and "Lucy") and I, long time friends, met for lunch in summer 2015. One of the things we discussed was how we felt under-represented in media, sometimes falsely represented, and how there were very few movies being made that we felt good about supporting. We realized that what we were seeing on the big screen were LGBTQ+ movies that lacked romance, overly-sexualized the lead characters, had no representation of gender queer/ non binary characters, were often written by straight women or men. Most of all: we couldn't think of more than [maybe] two movies where the conflict wasn't about coming out, being closeted, or not being accepted. 

You see, for me, coming out was quite easy: I told my parents. They said, "Is this supposed to be a big deal?" and we moved on. And I know so many people whose family and friends reacted similarly. Yes, sadly, not all families and friends embrace this part of peoples' identities,  but to only represent those reactions in the media is what causes audiences to follow suit; It normalizes the behavior of not accepting. It normalizes the idea that coming out will be hard. Our goal with Up or Out, is to normalize diversity in sexuality. Our conflict has nothing to do with being gay or coming out, it instead seeks to illuminate the comical and sometimes emotional realities of being human.

Here is our extended teaser released 01/01/17!

 

So please consider contributing in order to help us create this film at the best quality we can! You could help change the world. The media is a powerful thing and we can control it for 90 minutes.

What We Need

We have estimated we could make this film for a measly $15,000. If you know how much money goes into films, you'd know this is NOTHING! And yet, I don't have that kind of pocket change laying around. We have written a script that can be made low budget and simple, but still be moving and meaningful. This budget includes location costs, post production, equipment, catering, transportation, cast, and crew. If we could raise MORE than $15,000, then the quality and visibility will just get better and greater. So although our goal is $15,000 on this site, our goal is really "as much as we can get." If we don't reach our goal of $15,000 we are still going to TRY to make this film! If it isn't enough, I will write a shorter version of the feature and we will make that. We will do what we can with what we are given. But this script is meant to be a feature length romcom. You WANT this to be the feature length romcom. 

Please check out our perks below and consider contributing!

Who are we?

Shani Hadjian (creator, writer, director, Isabella)  is best known for her stage career; she was last seen in the national tour of Andrew Lloyd Webber's The Wizard of Oz where she starred as The Wicked Witch of the West. Prior to that, favorite credits include the national tour of Disney's Beauty and the Beast, Off Broadway's Fancy Nancy, The Lady of the Lake in Spamalot, Rose Stopnick in Caroline, or change, and Touchstone in As You Like it. Her screen credits include Stricken, Second Thoughts, and Plastic, Twisted. In addition to acting, Shani owns her own photography business, Shani Hadjian Photography, where she focuses on actors headshots and portraiture. She started her business in 2011 and has built it to a well known staple among the acting community. 

Elise Murphy (creator, Lucy)  is originally from Massachusetts, but made the move to New York City after college. Here in NYC she has performed in promotional material for "Natasha Pierre and the Great Comet of 1812," the Broadway show featuring Josh Groban, as well as  backup vocals for multiple theme parks around the country . She has worked as a performer/dance instructor all over the world with Holland American Cruise Lines, and performed across the country in Sesame Street Live. She has recently started writing her own music and has enjoyed taking the leap from theatre into film, writing, and recording. 

Other cast members involved in the teaser:

Lea Nardi (Rachel), Scott Caron (Sam), Soph Menas (Chris), Courtney Rada (Tara), Ellen Williams (Jane), Chengusoyane Kargbo (Breanna), Steve Bauder (Matt)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, please consider sharing this site! Use the share tools that Indiegogo provides, send it in a mass email to family and friends, post it on your instagram. Please! Anything helps!

Either way, whether you donate or not, thank you for reading this far! I bet the next time you sit down and watch an LGBTQ+ movie, you’ll notice some of the above mentioned things. But hopefully the next LGBTQ+ movie you watch will be Up or Out and you will be pleasantly surprised at how awesome it feels to watch a movie showing acceptance and inclusivity!

Check out an interview with Shani & Elise:
