story:
NEW PERK!

Do you like totebags? Do you like inside jokes? Donate at the $150 level to receive this awesome totebag (or t-shirt!) featuring the protagonist's favorite nighttime radio show host, YVONNE. 

 

STORY SYNOPSIS

Marla is a night cleaner at a community college. Her only “friend” is a nighttime radio DJ who offers odd, existential advice. Marla is content but lonely, and she wonders why she’s alive at all. She starts having strange visions around the same time that she finds a homeless man lurking around the college. When she discovers that the man is living in the storage closet and is deliriously ill, she attempts to nurse him back to health. Through the almost otherworldly relationship that forms between them, Marla learns an important lesson: life persists so that we can be useful to other people, so that the voice of humanity can be heard through each of us in all its mysterious forms.

 

WHAT YOU CAN DO

Every contribution makes a difference, but if you aren’t in a position to donate today, you can still lend your support by SHARING our campaign on social media!

 

THE BUDGET

Our overall budget was painstakingly developed by our director and producers. As a UCLA student production, we are blessed to have many, many talented people working on this film for free. With low labor costs, the budget covers the following:

- Renting locations (plus permits, parking, and staging costs)

- Equipment rentals (camera, G&E)

- Outside hires (sound mixer, hair/make-up person, studio teacher)

- Production design (set design and prop rentals, unique prop creations)

- Costume design

- Production insurance

- Feeding our cast and crew (always a large but clearly super necessary budget line!!)

- And much, much more...

If we are fortunate enough to surpass our fundraising goal, those additional funds will go toward festival submission costs and hiring out some of our post-production needs.

 

OUR TEAM

THE DIRECTOR - ZOE WARD

Zoe Ward is a writer/director in UCLA’s MFA Film Production program. Filmmaking is the focal point around which all her other interests have coalesced: literature, collaborative art, photography, philosophy, and a deep curiosity about people’s instincts, interests, and motivations. She has written, directed, and produced several short films and is currently writing two feature screenplays. She also writes short fiction and was recently selected as a finalist for the 2017 PEN/Robert J. Dau Short Story Prize for Emerging Writers.

 

THE CINEMATOGRAPHER - PRATIK SHAH

Pratik Shah is a cinematographer based in Los Angeles, CA. He is currently working towards his MFA degree in Cinematography at UCLA. Pratik has worked on several short films & a feature film as a cinematographer. With a background in fine art photography, Pratik’s lighting style is strongly influenced by the strong shadows & colors of Magnum photographers and photojournalists, as well as the chiaroscuro aesthetic of Renaissance Art. He has published work for The Washington Post, The Washington Times & The US Department of State, and has been recognized by the National Press Photographer's Association for his multimedia work. Pratik holds a Bachelor's Degree in Fine Art Photography from the Corcoran College of Art + Design in Washington, D.C. Check out his cinematography reel here or visit him on Instagram @pratik8shah.

 

PRODUCER - ARKESH AJAY

Arkesh Ajay is an Indian filmmaker, currently a part of the UCLA MFA Production/Directing program. He was recently awarded the prestigious Alfred P. Sloan Award for his feature screenplay “The Kitchen Chemist’s War”. His last directorial project was a short film with James Franco, Topher Grace, and Alicia Witt in lead roles. It’s an adaptation of a William Faulkner short story - a period film set in 1930s Mississippi. He was one of judges for the Kodak Student Scholarship/Cinematography Scholarship Program in 2014. He holds an MBA from the University of Delhi, and has worked in the Consumer Goods business for three years before making a switch to follow his passion for filmmaking. Arkesh is a recipient of the Hollywood Foreign Press Association Award, Motion Pictures Association of America Award, the Terina Spyropoulou Memorial Award, and the UCLA Graduate Division Fellowship for two consecutive years.

 

PRODUCER - ANNIE PACE

Annie Pace is a writer/director based in Los Angeles. She is currently getting her MFA in Directing at the UCLA School of Theater, Film & Television. Before moving to Los Angeles, Annie previously worked on anthropological films in both Brazil and Mexico. She directed the music video entitled All For One, shot in New York and Tennessee, for the Bluegrass/ Hip-hop band Gangstagrass, known for their single Long Hard Time to Come featured on the FX Network Series Justified.

 

ASSISTANT DIRECTOR - GAYATRI BAJPAI

Gayatri is a recent graduate of UCLA TFT's MFA program in Directing. She has directed multiple short films and documentaries. Her most recent projects are RIO, her thesis film directed under the instruction of James Franco, and a documentary about Francis Ford Coppola's project Distant Vision, produced for UCLA.

 

COSTUME DESIGNER - JIEN SUN

Jien Sun is a costume designer in UCLA’s Theater, Film, and Television theater program. Her love for costume design began in her high school’s theater program. Loving the thrill and challenge of costume design, she continues to expand her skills through classes with some of the most inspiring costume designers and professors in Los Angeles and through collaborations with the film department. This past fall, she studied abroad at University of Arts London: Wimbledon.

 

PRODUCTION DESIGNER - NAOMI GONZALEZ KAHN

Naomi González Kahn grew up and built her life in Mexico City. She is now a Los Angeles based production designer. She spent her childhood in a sewing workshop: design has been part of her life since she was born. She trained as a Bench Jeweler at the School of Arts of the National Institute of Fine Arts (INBA) in Mexico City. She then acquired a BA in Stage Design from the National School of Theatrical Arts (ENAT). She was the recipient of the first place in Costume Design for ​Doctor Faustus on the Sixth National Biennale of Design organized by the National Institute of Fine Arts in Mexico (INBA). Currently, she’s a scholar of the Mexican Council for Science and Technology (Conacyt) and the INBA to pursue an MFA in Fine Arts.
story_txt:
NEW PERK!
Do you like totebags? Do you like inside jokes? Donate at the $150 level to receive this awesome totebag (or t-shirt!) featuring the protagonist's favorite nighttime radio show host, YVONNE. 

 
STORY SYNOPSIS
Marla is a night cleaner at a community college. Her only “friend” is a nighttime radio DJ who offers odd, existential advice. Marla is content but lonely, and she wonders why she’s alive at all. She starts having strange visions around the same time that she finds a homeless man lurking around the college. When she discovers that the man is living in the storage closet and is deliriously ill, she attempts to nurse him back to health. Through the almost otherworldly relationship that forms between them, Marla learns an important lesson: life persists so that we can be useful to other people, so that the voice of humanity can be heard through each of us in all its mysterious forms.
 
WHAT YOU CAN DO
Every contribution makes a difference, but if you aren’t in a position to donate today, you can still lend your support by SHARING our campaign on social media!
 
THE BUDGET
Our overall budget was painstakingly developed by our director and producers. As a UCLA student production, we are blessed to have many, many talented people working on this film for free. With low labor costs, the budget covers the following:
- Renting locations (plus permits, parking, and staging costs)
- Equipment rentals (camera, G&E)
- Outside hires (sound mixer, hair/make-up person, studio teacher)
- Production design (set design and prop rentals, unique prop creations)
- Costume design
- Production insurance
- Feeding our cast and crew (always a large but clearly super necessary budget line!!)
- And much, much more...
If we are fortunate enough to surpass our fundraising goal, those additional funds will go toward festival submission costs and hiring out some of our post-production needs.
 
OUR TEAM

THE DIRECTOR - ZOE WARD
Zoe Ward is a writer/director in UCLA’s MFA Film Production program. Filmmaking is the focal point around which all her other interests have coalesced: literature, collaborative art, photography, philosophy, and a deep curiosity about people’s instincts, interests, and motivations. She has written, directed, and produced several short films and is currently writing two feature screenplays. She also writes short fiction and was recently selected as a finalist for the 2017 PEN/Robert J. Dau Short Story Prize for Emerging Writers.
 

THE CINEMATOGRAPHER - PRATIK SHAH
Pratik Shah is a cinematographer based in Los Angeles, CA. He is currently working towards his MFA degree in Cinematography at UCLA. Pratik has worked on several short films & a feature film as a cinematographer. With a background in fine art photography, Pratik’s lighting style is strongly influenced by the strong shadows & colors of Magnum photographers and photojournalists, as well as the chiaroscuro aesthetic of Renaissance Art. He has published work for The Washington Post, The Washington Times & The US Department of State, and has been recognized by the National Press Photographer's Association for his multimedia work. Pratik holds a Bachelor's Degree in Fine Art Photography from the Corcoran College of Art + Design in Washington, D.C. Check out his cinematography reel here or visit him on Instagram @pratik8shah.
 

PRODUCER - ARKESH AJAY
Arkesh Ajay is an Indian filmmaker, currently a part of the UCLA MFA Production/Directing program. He was recently awarded the prestigious Alfred P. Sloan Award for his feature screenplay “The Kitchen Chemist’s War”. His last directorial project was a short film with James Franco, Topher Grace, and Alicia Witt in lead roles. It’s an adaptation of a William Faulkner short story - a period film set in 1930s Mississippi. He was one of judges for the Kodak Student Scholarship/Cinematography Scholarship Program in 2014. He holds an MBA from the University of Delhi, and has worked in the Consumer Goods business for three years before making a switch to follow his passion for filmmaking. Arkesh is a recipient of the Hollywood Foreign Press Association Award, Motion Pictures Association of America Award, the Terina Spyropoulou Memorial Award, and the UCLA Graduate Division Fellowship for two consecutive years.
 

PRODUCER - ANNIE PACE
Annie Pace is a writer/director based in Los Angeles. She is currently getting her MFA in Directing at the UCLA School of Theater, Film & Television. Before moving to Los Angeles, Annie previously worked on anthropological films in both Brazil and Mexico. She directed the music video entitled All For One, shot in New York and Tennessee, for the Bluegrass/ Hip-hop band Gangstagrass, known for their single Long Hard Time to Come featured on the FX Network Series Justified.

Her most recent projects are RIO, her thesis film directed under the instruction of James Franco, and a documentary about Francis Ford Coppola's project Distant Vision, produced for UCLA.

Loving the thrill and challenge of costume design, she continues to expand her skills through classes with some of the most inspiring costume designers and professors in Los Angeles and through collaborations with the film department. This past fall, she studied abroad at University of Arts London: Wimbledon.

She then acquired a BA in Stage Design from the National School of Theatrical Arts (ENAT). story:
New Perk Alert!  11x17 Toxic Avenger Poster signed by Mark!

 

 

I'M PUTTING IT ON THE LINE! TOXIC TUTU NEEDS YOUR SUPPORT!!

It's been almost 4 years since we started this crazy fan based film. 
"Toxic Tutu" The Almost True Story Of Whatever Became Of The Toxic Avenger's Melvin The Mop Boy Mark Torgl. Most of you guys, fans, friends, and family have helped us make it happen.  Toxic Tutu is steps from the finish line.

Now comes the fun part, 1: Mastering the movie in multiple formats for screenings be it theatrical, streaming, dvd's etc. 2: A Final Audio Mix will make this baby sing. 3: Getting the film into film festivals and attending the festivals whenever we can afford to travel, and 4: Marketing, Marketing, Marketing. 5: Finding distributors in the U.S. and Foreign to market and put the film out there for the public to see. This all takes money, and we are tapped out. What else is new. With your help Toxic Tutu will Live forever.

Toxic Tutu is scheduled for it's grand premier March 25th at The Mad Monster Party Carolinas! This is the convention that started it all and we are pleased to have our opening screening here.

The $10,000, we are attempting to raise will be our final fund raising campaign  and will finally allow us to put Toxic Tutu out to the world.

We are offering some cool perks including signed posters, dvds, and publicity stills. But we think the best perk for your contribution is knowing you were responsible for making Toxic Tutu a reality.

We know a lot of our fans are as poor as we are, so if nothing else help us get the word out about this campaign to everyone you know who supports Indie Film, is a Troma/Toxic Avenger fan, or are just really cool people.  We urge everyone to share the Indiegogo share tools!

 

 

 

  •

story:
When a quirky old Japanese lady is given a pair of healing hands... 

This is a dark comedy/drama set on the brim of the East River, New York, where Keiko Jones, a peculiar Japanese lady, lives out her mundane routine life of chair yoga and Japanese home cooking. One day the ability to heal is bequeathed upon her hands. Being less than nurturing in nature, Keiko does not find this a blessing, however the friendship with a sick little boy changes everything. The boy reminds Keiko of her son Kai, the one person who she ever cared about and who has recently exited her life forever. Through attempting to heal the boy using her newfound powers, Keiko tries to redeem her own past. However, things never go as planned...

Budget

The process of filmmaking is a hard and expensive labour of love. With the help of NYU's department in film, we are able to have access to our principle camera and lighting equipment. However, additional gear, transportation fees, payment of crew, meals, lodging as well as may other expenses are also required, and this is where your support becomes crucial.

Our overall budget is $30,000 but we plan on raising $15,000 on Indiegogo. Here is a breakdown of how we plan to use our fundraising money:

Additional gear: $2,000
Production design: $10,000
Transportation: $4,000
Crew: $6,000
Locations: $3,000
Other key expenses: $5,000

Project Timeline 

Pre-production, Casting: October, 2016-January, 2017 
Principle Photography: Jan.12-Jan.23, 2017 
Post-Production, Sound and Color Correction: February-April, 2017 
Additional Shooting: March, 2017 
Sending out Perks to Backers: April, 2017

Looking Forward: The Feature Version 

As stated earlier, this is only a taste of Keiko in her original form. It has become a new trend for independent feature films to start off as short films. The short form gives investors a taste of how the feature may feel like before committing to investing in it and may reduce their risks in predicting success. This short film is particularly advantageous for this purpose since it is structured as a long short with a major story arc that enables investors to better foresee not only the mood but also the story arc of the feature.  

Casting

Sakurako Kataoka as Keiko Jones

I knew I needed a strong female lead in order to pull off the film's world and when a series of coincidences lead me to Sakurako, I knew I had found the right person. 

Sakurako was born and raised in Japan. She moved to the United States 27 years ago for an MA in communications at NYU. She has been many things in her life, including a Japanese news broadcaster for twenty years, a banker, and full time mom. Like the character of Keiko, Sakurako has recently, at the age of 54, rediscovered a new calling for her life in spiritual art and acting. In 2014 she wrote and performed a one woman show "本当の私宣言" (Declaration of Authentic Me) that has played in New York, Tokyo, Kobe, and Okayama. Sakurako is also involved in Japanese cultural arts and events, and improv/spiritual musical gatherings for self-healing in New York. This project is her film debut.

Adam Ichiro Baker as Shawn Evans 

 Next up on my list was our little boy Shawn. When I saw Adam for the first time on kidscasting.com, he seemed just the right balance of playfulness and endearing compassion. After some tracking, I finally got to meet him. Adam Ichiro Baker is new to acting. He is in 5th grade at PS116 and his favorite subject is PE and math. During his spare time, Adam likes to talk about soccer with his dad and he plays in the local travel soccer team CPSC. He also plays Jazz piano and is an experienced swimmer. In 2014, he played in the feature film Birthday directed by Sonoko Ogata. "Shawn" will be his first lead supporting role.

Yoshiko Tamaki as Fumiko Evans

 Yoshiko has been cast in a variety of TV, film and commercial principle roles and was trained at the Lee Strasburg Film and Theatre Institute. She has also done substantial work as a print model, having worked for companies such as Verison, CitiBank, and Microsoft. On her spare time she likes to do yoga, Taichi as well as Salsa and crocheting. She has been offered the Irene Ryan Finalist at the Kennedy Center American College Theatre Festival Region II and was also an original cast member of The Bakkhai which was performed at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival, Athans, and got the Cyprus Virgil J. Lee Award for Academic excellence and service in Theatre.

Brian Walters as Kai Jones

 Brian Walters has been in numerous commercials and is currently the host of Japanese Batsu-Game Improv Show, BATSU! He is also is a reporter for FCI, interviewing the likes of Iron Chef Morimoto and fashion designer Steven Alan. Most recently, Brian was Ash Ketchum in Epic Rap Battles of History and was the lead for an indie feature film.

Boy-Yo Korodan

 Boy-Yo is a seasoned young actor who has appeared in a variety of short films and commercials, working with companies such as Gymboree and Smilebuilderz. Boy-Yo has worked with Harry Connick, Jr. and Warner Brothers just casted Boy-Yo as their lead for Scooby-Doo commercials. His awards include Best Male Child Actor and Best Male Child Model at the 2015 VIP Choice Awards, Winter Shine Convention, just to name a few...

Laura Snell as Naomi Jones

 Laura Snell is an accomplished pianist, singer, and actress. Born and raised in Los Angeles, her artistic career began as a classical pianist, performing and competing in venues across California, Japan, and Austria from a very young age under the guidance of Akiko Hasunuma. Laura received B.A.s in Music and Dramatic Art from UC Davis while completing coursework in pre-veterinary medicine and working as a veterinary technician. Currently She is currently a musical director at Play Group Theatre in White Plains, NY and maintains a private studio in Manhattan.

Creators

Yun Liang -Writer & Director

 Yun grew up under distinctively Asian and Western cultures and is a familiar stranger to each. With a BA in Philosophy from Stanford, an artist’s background and several languages spoken natively, she wants to tell stories that are gritty, beautiful and contemplative. Her last short film, Noah’s World, had its run in multiple festivals worldwide and had received an offer from Lifetime Network to be made into a TV feature. Currently, she is enrolled in NYU’s Graduate Film Program and is preparing for this film as well as her first feature film.

Ashley Alexander -Producer

Born and raised in Houston, Texas, Ashley Alexander studied international relations at the Woodrow Wilson School at Princeton University, where she fell in love with international cultures and stories. She is currently pursuing a MBA/MFA dual masters in film producing at New York University. Previously, she worked in China as a film and TV producer for several years, focusing on international co-productions. She most recently worked on Entertainment Experience China, a Dutch-Chinese cross-media project led by John Woo. She is interested in international films, especially those that explore the conflict of different cultures and philosophies.  

Jinwei Zeng -Cinematographer

 Jinwei is a seasoned director of photography based in China and has worked for several big companies such as Wanda and General Motors. He has also shot several commercial feature films starring well-known actors such as Lin Zhiling and Sodagreen that have had major box office runs in China. Currently he is working on writing and directing his first feature Fairytale of a Witch, which is being produced by Leste Chen’s team.

Yu-Hsuan Chen -Production Designer

Yu-Hsuan Chen is a New York based set and production designer, originally born and raised in Taiwan. She received her MFA in Design for Stage and Film at Tisch School of the Arts, NYU. Her film experiences include the set designer in feature film KANO(Taiwan) and Conspiracy (Taiwan). Selected short film credits include: Léa (Cinequest Film Festival) and All About Marie (NY Short Film Festival). Spec commercial "Music Everywhere" is shortlisted at the AICP Awards and won a prize at the Porsche Ad Awards in Germany. Visit www.yuhsuanchendesign.com & vimeo.com/165010017 to check out her work.

Lauren Andrade - Co-Producer

 Originally from Barrington Rhode Island, Lauren Andrade is an Independent Film Producer working and living in New York City. In 2015 Lauren graduated from Northeastern University with a degree in Media Studies concentrating on Film & TV Production. She has a diverse set of experience in the industry working in casting, development, and production for various features, shorts and commercials. Recently Lauren has just completed producing the film Gone From My Sight, with Trial By Combat Productions which will be showcased at festivals in 2017. Currently she is producing an IFC web series, and working with Tisch Graduate Students on their theses.

Siyu Lin- Co-Producer

 An experienced filmmaker based in New York and China. Graduated from New York Film Academy in 2014. Produced and participated over 50 short/feature films, including the movies First Love (selected by Cannes Film Festival in 2016), Tower of Silence, Tiny World, Last Fair Deal and SK2 # rewriting fate # and Vivo smartphone commercials.

story:
Destiny

The civil war left a lot of families in disarray. Made widowers of a lot of women. To add to it there was illness that plague families.


A mother becomes widowed... after her husband is killed in the war. Leaving her and his daughter. A Father lost his wife to illness is left with his son.
Through uncommon events the two are brought together. They form a family and make an attempt to start over.


The mother becomes ill like his past wife and she to dies. Leaving him alone with now a Step Daughter and his Son. He becomes angry and starts drinking. He becomes very abusive toward the Daughter and using his son as a tool in this abuse.

The daughter is alone and scared. The only person that can help her is a neighbor boy. At night she would not stay in the house with her step father and half brother. She would hid in a spot only she and the neighbor knows.

One the night the father went looking for her. He finds her with the neighbor boy. He starts to beat him and when he finished he starts after her. In the fighting he drops his gun. The neighbor picks it up and commands him to stop. The father goes after the boy and the boy shoots him. Both think he is dead. The boy drops the gun and runs away. The daughter grabs the gun and runs away.

Later in the night the son looking for his father and half sister finds his dad have dead. His dad tells him what happens and makes him swear he will go after them to revenge his death. The father dies with these words.

Starring:

Jessica Morris (Sara) Christian Boeving (Johnny) Greg Grant (Marshal) Shannon Rebekah (Louise)

Richard Lee, Quest Lee, Johnny Ray Gibbs, Harold Miller Greg Antonucci

Directed By  John Pocino

Based on a Poem by Johnny Ray Gibbs "The Cowboy and the Brown Eye Saloon Girl"

Screenplay By  Rick Gerard, John Pocino

Produced By: Johnny Ray Gibbs, Rick Gerard, John Pocino, Greg Antonucci

Funding:

We are seeking funding to complete the production process and post-production.

Funding needs are for Insurance, Wardrobe, Crew, Cast, Location Permits, Room and Board for cast and crew, and Transportation.

Post Production needs. Editing, Sound Design, Music Scoring, Graphics and Special FX

Perks and Goals

Our perks include but not limited to a complete book of production and behind scenes photos as well as screen credits.

Limited amount of opportunities to be an extra in Destiny and visit the production set and meet the cast.

In the case we don't reach our goal we will proceed as far as funding allows and attempt to obtain more investors and start a new campaign.

Currently will have receive $16,000 from investors which was use to shoot 16 pages of the script. 

 Impact

Destiny is a valuable tool to bring back the excitement, passion and the tradition of classic westerns. Those who contribute will be part of historic return of an American Tradition.

I remember sitting with my Dad watching westerns on a Saturday afternoon. Later going to the Theatre seeing John Wayne on the large screen. The excitement as I watch the old west come alive.

 Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is distribution in specific areas. Such as Theatrical Release and Streaming on the internet (Net Flex, YouTube, Etc.).

Our alternative plan is to start our own webpage with streaming as well as making available DVDs and Downloads through Amazon.  In any situation the public world wide will see Destiny and recognize those who made it possible, such as you.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign to you friends and family. Use social media and other communication tools you have. There are tools to use here on Indiegogo under share tools.
story_txt:
Destiny
The civil war left a lot of families in disarray. Made widowers of a lot of women. To add to it there was illness that plague families.
A mother becomes widowed... after her husband is killed in the war. Leaving her and his daughter. A Father lost his wife to illness is left with his son.Through uncommon events the two are brought together. They form a family and make an attempt to start over.
The mother becomes ill like his past wife and she to dies. Leaving him alone with now a Step Daughter and his Son. He becomes angry and starts drinking. He becomes very abusive toward the Daughter and using his son as a tool in this abuse.The daughter is alone and scared. The only person that can help her is a neighbor boy. At night she would not stay in the house with her step father and half brother. She would hid in a spot only she and the neighbor knows.One the night the father went looking for her. He finds her with the neighbor boy. He starts to beat him and when he finished he starts after her. In the fighting he drops his gun. The neighbor picks it up and commands him to stop. The father goes after the boy and the boy shoots him. Both think he is dead. The boy drops the gun and runs away. The daughter grabs the gun and runs away.Later in the night the son looking for his father and half sister finds his dad have dead. His dad tells him what happens and makes him swear he will go after them to revenge his death. The father dies with these words.
Starring:
Jessica Morris (Sara) Christian Boeving (Johnny) Greg Grant (Marshal) Shannon Rebekah (Louise)Richard Lee, Quest Lee, Johnny Ray Gibbs, Harold Miller Greg Antonucci
Directed By  John Pocino
Based on a Poem by Johnny Ray Gibbs "The Cowboy and the Brown Eye Saloon Girl"
Screenplay By  Rick Gerard, John Pocino
Produced By: Johnny Ray Gibbs, Rick Gerard, John Pocino, Greg Antonucci

We are seeking funding to complete the production process and post-production.

story:
Join us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/groups/193734164389879/

Short Summary


   Hello, folks! My name is Ivan Patraman. I am a director and producer of the movie “Paint it Black”. I work as director and actor in movies and theatre for more than 12 years. In 2014 I graduated from Saint Petersburg State Theatre Arts Academy (Department of acting and directing. St. Petersburg Academy of Theatre Arts, is one of the five best universities of Russia in this profile) Director's work – “Last summer in Chulimsk” (2013), “Romeo and Juliet” (2015) “Kedinin Evi” (2015), "White Night" (2015). Actor's work in movies - "White Night" (2015). "Callsign flock" (2014). "This Job" (2015.), "Alien (2014)", etc.

You can see my profile here: http://www.kino-teatr.ru/kino/acter/m/ros/38677...



   The screenwriter - Fedor Marinoglu. Famous Gagauzian author. In 1983 he graduated from the faculty of journalism Moldavian State University. He is the author of collections of short stories and poems «Ürek dalgası», «İlkyaz girdi aramıza», «Açıkgüllär», «Dışokumakları» In 1999 published a book for the children. In 2000 he became a member of the Union of writers and poets of Moldova. In 2010, 2012 he won in international competitions "Mahmoud Kazhgarly".

   The concept of the film Paint it Black" has a cultural, social and educational character. This project is very important from the historical, cultural and social point of view, embodied in the exciting spirit and adventure genre. The project is realized in the concept of black and white film, which will give to the film the historicity and will fill the unique atmosphere of  life in the last century. Scenario “Paint it Black" is filled with a large number of both primary and secondary lines telling. The film tells the story of love, struggle, betrayal, power and weakness, family rituals. Through the heroes and anti-heroes through the actions and deeds, love and willpower, the script sets the viewer in a unique atmosphere of harmony and a rich world of the spirit.

Cast:


Mihail Konstantinov (as Dimu) who is also one of the main characters in this movie.  Mihail is an actor for more than 20 years and also is a chief of the first national theatre in Gagauzia. He played a lot of main roles in this theatre and also teaching many new young actors.


Ilya Hadji (as Lambu) is an actor, writer, poet and radio host for more than 20 years. He is also a director in the first national theatre.
 

Mikhail Rezunets (as Atanas) is a famous gagauzian actor.



Olesya Sobor (as Nida) is an gagauzian and russian actress.


Anatoliy Radulov (as Yani) is an gagauzian actor.


And many others…


What We Need & What You Get

   Serbest Film Company is searching help from the world to create their first feature film. We are a team of talented professionals who've put together to make this film interesting, mysterious and amazing. We have a lot to prove. If we get a large amount of donations and backers, we will be able to prove to investors that the world is ready for what we have to offer.
    Now we need an extra push in fundraising to help us pay everyone who has given their hearts to making sure this project is of the very best quality.
We need at least 20000 dollars for this project to be finished. So, we need your help. We have a lot of gifts that will surprise you.

The Impact

   The project is implemented with the purpose of preservation and development of the Gagauzian language and culture. One of the main objectives of the project - is the promotion and implementation of the Gagauzian language and traditions in a modern Gagauzian society. The project focuses on large audience, because it affects the important cultural and traditional aspects of the mentality of the Gagauzian ethnic group. In today's world, which is dominated by the mass media and Internet communications, the implementation of «Paint it Black» project will have a tremendous impact on society as this feature film tells about the life-styles of 1920-1930. All events are unfolding in two traditional villages of the Gagauzia. One of the objectives of the filmmakers is to awaken the viewer interest to the rich multi-faceted culture of the Turkic peoples, through the prism of one nation. Preserving the history and language of the Gagauzians through a feature film will develop the Gagauzian culture.
 
Other Ways You Can Help

   In realization of this film you can help us not only with funds. Every share will contribute to finish our campaign successful on IndieGogo. We will be very pleased if a lot of people from around the world will find out about our campaign.

Promotion of the movie “Paint it Black”

   On completion of the feature film «Paint it Black», it will be shown throughout the Republic of Moldova. "Paint it Black" will take part in the national festival of feature films and in the arena of international festivals in Europe, USA, Turkey. This picture will remain in history as a national heritage.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Rob Prince and I teach documentary filmmaking at the University of Alaska Fairbanks.  I have been working in video since 1993 and have won numerous awards at film festivals, including the Audience Choice award at the Newburyport Documentary Film Festival.  My films have been distributed on Amazon.com and Netflix as well as broadcast nationally.

I have dreamed of owning a DeLorean for a long time.  In the summer of 2016 that dream finally became a reality--with one serious drawback...  As you might imagine, there are few DeLoreans for sale in Alaska, so I had to buy mine in the Lower 48.  To get it back home I'll have to drive it 3700 miles back to Fairbanks, Alaska up the dangerous Alaska-Canada (Alcan) highway.   My plan is to film the entire process, from buying the car, meeting people along the way, and arriving (I hope…) safely back in Fairbanks with the DeLorean.

Completing this film is important to me because I believe in pursuing dreams.  When my father passed away in 2009 at 60-years-old, I decided I couldn’t wait until I retired to chase my dreams because I may not end up having that luxury.  However this film is not just about a road trip.  It’s also about how your life changes when you finally get something big you’ve dreamed about for a long time, how it affects your friends, and the importance of following your dreams.

Your support will help me do this film right by providing the funds necessary for music and image licensing, graphic design, film festival entry fees, publicity, and other filmmaking and distribution expenses.  With your help we can make this film the way it should be made with the necessary elements for a really polished and professional documentary film.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This project is scalable, so we can do more with more funding and still complete the film if we don’t reach our goal.  Film festivals alone, for example, generally cost between $25 and $50 each to enter—whether or not your film actually gets accepted.  It’s not uncommon for filmmakers to enter dozens of film festivals in an effort to build publicity, contacts, and a reputation for their film.  That adds up to a lot of money.

If I do not reach my full goal, I will just enter less film festivals, use less (or no) licensed music, do graphic design myself, etc.  The film will still be completed, but it may not have the same polish or reach as large an audience as it could if it were fully funded.

Perks for Contributing:

$5-$39:  Get your name in the film credits!

$40-$79: All of the above and a signed “Back to Alaska” DVD.

$80-$119: All of the above, a Facebook shout out, and a personalized postcard mailed from the filmmaker during the road trip!

$120-$149:  All of the above and a personal phone call from the filmmaker during the road trip!

$150+:  All of the above, a personalized “Thank you!” video on Facebook and deloreandocumentary.com, and a signed “Back to Alaska” movie poster!

 

The Impact

We live in a world where we routinely hear the cliché “Follow your dreams!” in various forms, but many of us never get the chance to pursue our wildest dreams or are too afraid to try.  “Back to Alaska: The DeLorean Road Trip Movie” will follow one regular guy as he dives in and pursues his dream despite his fears and the skepticism of those around him.  What is that like and is it worth it?  This film will encourage some people to finally chase their own dreams while possibly confirming for others that dreams are best left as just dreams.

When you support this project you are not just funding a documentary, you’ll also casting your vote for the dreamers.  You are saying you believe we still live in a world where it’s critical to pursue our dreams.  You’re saying, “Go Rob, go!  Throw caution to the wind and do this crazy thing!”  In doing so, you’re validating your own dreams and, maybe, coming one step closer to achieving them yourself.

Whatever happens, I will finish this documentary.  I’ve been working in video since 1993 and teaching documentary filmmaking since 2005.  I already have all the skills and equipment necessary to complete a documentary.  I’ve won numerous awards for my documentaries at film festivals.  My films have been distributed on Netflix and Amazon and have been aired on local public television stations as well as broadcast nationally.  In my experience, though, one of the key factors in completing films is having a large pool of people hounding you about your progress—and I have that in spades.  Every student I’ve had for the last three years, every coworker, every friend, and every one of my family members knows about this project.  They will not let me rest until it is completed.  My reputation as a documentary filmmaker and professor rest on finishing this project.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk I see in the production of this film is that the DeLorean may not make it back to Alaska for some reason.  For example, it may have a serious mechanical breakdown or we may get in a major accident.

I’ve driven the 3700 miles to and from Alaska three times now.  I know what this road can do and I know how to do this trip safely.  I have also consulted with DeLorean Motor Company (DMC) staff who have assured me the car, when properly maintained, can make the trip without issue.  I’ve also driven the car over 1,000 miles already and learned about some of the key components of the DeLorean and how to work on it, if necessary.  I will bring the car to the DMC Midwest shop for a full inspection shortly before I leave so they can sort out any issues before I’m far away from any knowledgeable DeLorean mechanics.  I will also have a follow car on the trip so we can get external shots of the car driving as well as have a second set of wheels in case the DeLorean is stranded.

Here are some potential issues with the trip and how I plan to resolve them:

Issue: DeLorean has minor mechanical issue that keeps it from being driveable.

Solution: I will consult with DMC and repair the issue myself, if possible.  I have already resolved a non-starting issue myself with consultation with DMC and my own intuition.

Issue: DeLorean has a mechanical problem I cannot fix myself.

Solution: Consult with the DeLorean Company and overnight the parts to a local repair shop.  I own all the shop manuals for the car.

Issue: DeLorean gets in a major accident.

Solution: The documentary has a sad, but incredible, conclusion and I end the film vowing to try again.  The DeLorean is, of course, fully insured.

One of the reasons I chose to do this documentary is because it has a high-likelihood of success.  If the DeLorean makes it 3700 miles without issue, then we have a fascinating road trip documentary in which we meet a lot of interesting people and have the wonderful juxtaposition of a futuristic looking car and rural America/Canada.  In the worst case scenario, we have a dramatic film about one man’s dream exploding in his face when the car irreparably breaks down, is destroyed, etc.…  Either way, the documentary has drama, Americana, and great Cinerama.  Sorry about that…

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t contribute financially or want to do more than just that?  There are lots of ways you can help!  The easiest things you can do are following our Facebook page, telling your friends, and working as a publicist wherever you happen to be.  If you live along our route of travel (TBA on Facebook and deloreandocumentary.com), or know someone who lives along the route, you can help by building awareness in the community about when we’ll be passing through so we can meet you and your neighbors and get some great footage of people reacting to the car. 

Do you have a skill or resource you’d like to offer?  Great at making music?  A whiz at graphic design?  Access to a bunch of people or a big social media following?  Work at a business that might benefit from being an official sponsor of the film?  Your skills or resources might be even more valuable than a financial contribution.  Thanks for considering that!

You can also just send us a note through Facebook or our website to let us know you support this trip and will be following along.  That would be a great boost to our morale.  Finally, you can use the Indiegogo share tools and maybe your friends will decide to support this project as well!

story:
The threat toward your freedom is very real.

Unless we do something now, your rights, your family's rights, your community's rights, all of our rights, will continue to be taken away or infringed upon!

How many times has your Right to Bear Arms (guaranteed by our Second Amendment) been threatened ?  Your Fourth Amendment freedom is gone at airports and other places where you get searched without probable cause.  Have you or a family member ever been labeled for exercising your right of free speech (First Amendment)?   Are you aware that on college campuses there are such areas known as "Free Speech Zones" (the only places where you are free to speak what you wish)?

How real is the threat?

Let's face facts - the US Constitution was designed to rein in or control Big Government, it was NOT meant to keep you, your family and your friends "in check" or "under control."  However, over the years, government and special interests have all too often infringed on your rights and freedoms.  Think about how religion has come under attack, how government surveillance has dramatically increased, how the federal government has taken away your's and your state's rights, etc., etc.

This is a serious situation and something must change!

Knowing when your rights are being threatened is the first step to ensure that you are able to keep your rights and freedom intact!  That is why having the US Constitution firmly in place and knowing what it says is so important to each and every one of us. There is a lot of truth in the old saying, "United we stand, divided we fall."  We must stand united around our Constitution!  

This is why we need to get In Search of Liberty out broadly and your support is vital!  It affects you, your family, your friends, everyone.

Back our campaign now!

Why we need your backing.

There has never before been a film like this, an enlightening yet fun tale about the U.S. Constitution. Your support will help get this movie marketed to many people around the nation. 

In normal cases, a producer might take their film to Hollywood and find a distributor to market their movie, or attend one or more film festivals where distributors attend to find movies they want.  That traditional scenario does not work for us because the liberal Hollywood elite would likely let our movie and its valuable message die.  

Where does the money go?

We are planning to have screenings in at least 20 major cities around the US and will do more depending upon the amount of money raised.  Our director and perhaps some of the actors will appear on local and syndicated radio and TV shows to further get the word out.  We will replicate the DVD and sell it from multiple sources, while also offering digital downloads.  We will advertise in a variety of on-target newsletters, websites and blogs.  There will also be ads running in the top social media circles, specifically Facebook, Instagram and Twitter. And, again, depending on the amount raised, our trailer will air on cable TV in various markets across the US. 

How you can help!

The best way to help back our campaign is to donate as much or as little as you can! Even $5 or $10 helps as there is power in numbers and the more people who back our campaign the better off we all are.  Spreading the word to like-minded people is a big help.  Sharing this page on your social networks, or even posting a video urging family and friends to donate, can make a huge difference.  Thank you in advance for what you do.

Donate now!

Learning the constitution visually

Synopsis

In the movie, a captivating statesman from America’s past takes a modern-day family on a series of wild adventures.

With a spicy mix of humor, magic and logic, he opens their eyes to the origins and importance of the U.S. Constitution, the degree to which it is under attack today and what can and must be done to save it.

Key aspects of the Constitution are clearly outlined and important Amendments — such as those guaranteeing freedom of religion and speech, the right to bear arms, warrants for search and seizure, State’s rights — are shown to be vital in everyday life.

Donate Now!

We must ensure that this nation stays as it was created, for "We the People."

story:
The History

In 2012, I was visiting a beach town where I'd spent many summers as a child. This time, however, my visit was in the fall during the off-season. The atmosphere was completely different. I was walking alone, it was almost dusk and there was a brisk chill in the air. My mind wandered through the empty streets and boardwalk, and as the sun slowly sank behind the ocean waves, I knew a story had to be told there. 

'Intrusion' began as a feature script, but as I thought more about the future of storytelling - that streaming will be the next frontier - I knew we had to make this an Episodic. The framework for the 'Intrusion' universe took 4 years to build and to write. Now in 2017 the film is cast, the locations are set and the gear, ready. 'Intrusion' goes into production this April. 

The Story

The story begins in early winter when a young woman washes ashore in the beach town of Ocean Crest, NJ. Michael Manzeno, (Jarrod DiGiorgi), a former detective is coerced out of retirement by his old partner Mark, (Patrick Jordan).

Manzeno, or Zeno as he's better know, is hired by the deceased woman's family to investigate the true cause of her death. Zeno arrives at the hibernating beach town, which on the surface seems standard and friendly enough. Though, as his investigation begins to deepen, he realizes that he's being entangled in something much larger and more ominous than he could ever imagine. 

Zeno must use his wits and unearth all his 'abilities' to leave this town with both the answers he seeks, and with his life.

About Me

My name's Brad Grimm and I've been making films since I was 8 years old. I've always been interested in exploring the unknown and what lives below the surface of our visual perception. In 2007, I was the first college student in history to win both the Academy of Television's 'College Emmy Award' and granted the Academy's 'Intern Fellowship' in the same year. 

I moved to LA to work on my Fellowship and after its completion, moved back to my hometown of Pittsburgh, PA. To me this marked the beginning of my career in Film Production. With hard work, focus and determination, my career took off and in 2013 I found myself living in New York City. Since, I've completed 2 feature length documentaries, have directed countless commercials for many major brands and am the Co-Founder of NYC based TRĀ Pictures - the production company behind 'Intrusion'. My work has won several awards and my documentaries show in Film Festivals around the country.

Today, my passion for long format storytelling has never been stronger and I've found it's the right time to transition into making an Episodic that will move, engage and thrill you.

We Need Your Help

With years in the industry, I've be fortunate enough to have forged great relationships. Through them, for the creation of 'Intrusion', I've gathered many favors from wildly talented, artists, writers, producers and location connections. We believe in all the possibilities of this story - but most of all, we want to create and deliver quality entertainment for you. 

To do this, We need Your help. 

Every dollar you can donate helps bring 'Intrusion' to life.

We hope to raise $20,000 to see 'Intrusion' completed with few corners cut.

With your backing and belief, your contribution will go to travel, food, lodging, talent, insurance and the additional rentals we need to make 'Intrusion' a reality.

Enough about us...

Let's talk about you! We have some very exciting gifts and rewards for your contribution!

Most of our perks are  100% crafted uniquely for you.

For example, with each $100+ contribution you'll receive an original, high quality print of a frame from 'Intrusion'.

We're also offering an amazing and fun opportunity for you to appear in the film!

With $750+ contribution you can be a Featured Extra. Here, you'll experience the behind the scenes process of movie making and see just how much work it takes to bring a scene to life! 

More offerings include the complete Soundtrack, a Private Screening, Special Credits and VIP Screening Party with the Cast and Crew.

 

Why 'Intrusion'?

'Intrusion' is a journey that's waiting to unfold for you. It's the combination of real world issues wrapped in a uniquely engaging, and fun story. What's equally exciting is that episodic content is the future of original narratives, so, we feel now is the perfect time to start our adventure together. 

This campaign is not just about one person's vision. It's about bringing together a myriad of talented individuals to create art and carry you away in a great story.

Your donation will help plant the seed of a project and production that we feel confident will live for years to come and employ talented industry professionals long into the future.

The Cast:

Jarrod DiGiorgi

David Toole

Erin Krom

Mark Thompson

Patrick Jordan

Daina Griffith

Ronald Grant

 

Crew:

  • Lynn Weatherly - Executive Producer
  • Brooke Loonan - Producer
  • Jessica Drennan - Producer
  • Erica Sperber - Producer/AD
  • Ryan Kroboth - Director of Photography
  • Alex Levin-  Assistant Camera​
  • Mason Cash - Assistant Camera
  • Jim McClain - Gaffer
  • Nathaniel Robinson - Audio Dept Head
  • Allen Martindale - DIT
  • Rachel Vallozzi - Costume and Wardrobe Dept Head
  • Rachael Ryan - Makeup and Hair Dept Head
  • Aldys Minaya - Key Makeup and Hair
  • Steve Tolin - Special Effects
  • Kevin Keller - Composer

  • Kenyon Hoag - Editor

 

 

What if the Pilot doesn't get picked up?

With my many connections at the Academy of Television and New York City, my aim and goal is to tell this complete story in an Episodic format. We'll work very hard to make that happen. 

Should any roadblocks prevent an Episodic format, we also have an outline to turn this Pilot into the first third of a feature film - Which means, no matter what happens, this story will be told. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We need your help to spread the word about this project!  Every link and like counts, So, Please Share with the Social Icons Above!

 

THANK YOU FOR CONTRIBUTING!

​We're excited to share this story with you and the world. Every dollar you contribute helps bring this project from our minds and hearts to your screen!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
"Alchemy of Punk" is the title of this Punk Opera conceived as an iconoclastic journey through time, and bringing together the wildest punk and classical opera.

 

Music & Story

Punk poetics in the broadest sense shall be the Leitmotiv running through the whole opera, featuring all the unexpected and surprising references from music, poetry and art history. The narration shall be poetic and associative, the story shall be told in impressions, moods, images and songs, leaving free space for abstraction, daydreaming and free association. The piece shall enact one main character; a dreamer, an artist, a poet, a troubadour, a punk or the spectator himself, wandering through centuries, daydreaming, and experiencing mystic adventures, love, transience, death, misfortune and wars. During this journey, the main character will encounter various fabulous figures, singing, poetizing, prophesizing, outlining her or his destiny (it is purposely not clear if the main character is a man or a woman). All the songs and texts, selected for the opera, shall have in common themes of: the imminent Apocalypse, heresy, outcry and revolt against the inevitability of decay and death, the elusiveness of life, the political iniquity, the imminence of love and violence, the mediaeval memento mori and vanitas.  

The opera shall be realized as a filmed performance, each act will be a life performance played and recorded in a black box – a theatre or a concert stage. The characters shall interact with each other on three screens – like ghosts or holograms. An open working process, based on encounter and exchange with the invited artists, shall underlie the opera.

„Orlando“ (1928) by Virginia Wolf or „Opera Curiosa“ (1979) by Marianne Sägebrecht served me as prototypes or possible inspirations.

Technical details: 3-Channel Split Screen HD Film Projection (9 x 2.5m); running time: 60 minutes. English, French, German and Italian with English subtitles. Also available as a single screen stereo version of the same piece for cinema viewing, as well as a DVD and a CD.  

About me

My name is Aneta and I am an experimental film maker who travels through time and space using the medium of film and working on themes of alchemy and rebellion as self-finding process. I have been developing the idea of a Punk Opera for three years within the framework of my artistic PhD at the University of Arts, Berlin and Le Fresnoy in Tourcoing, France, collecting forgotten songs, conversation pieces, pictures, punk artefacts and film fragments. Through the creation of a visual and musical installation, I would like to test the relevancy of my theories and ideas about punk poetics as images on stage. I am interested in challenging the existing norms of performing knowledge. 

I was born in Warsaw, Poland. I studied art history at the University Paris 4 Sorbonne, where I explored questions of transmediality in the arts, the uncanny in media and artistic exchanges between the three countries: France, Germany and Poland. At present I live and work in Berlin as an experimental filmmaker, curator, art historian, artist-supporter, and world traveler. 

In december 2016 I was able to realize first shootings for the Punk Opera, featuring great artists such as an internationally renowned soprano Simone Kermes and her music ensemble, as well as Mona Mur - the punk and chanson singer, as well as an underground diva, together with En Esch- industrial rock legend, known from industrial bands KMFDM, Slick Idiot and Pigface, Yoriko Maeno, a butoh dancer from Tokyo and Meritxell Campos Olive, an experimental dancer from Barcelona.

The images as well as the video you can see on this page are the result of these first shootings. 

In order to accomplish the opera however, I still have some shootings ahead. In February and March, I plan to film and record with: Rieko Okuda - a first class pianist from Osaka who will play experimental fugues on piano, Takushi Minagawa - a japanese countertenor, Zazie de Paris - a famous transgender chanson singer from Paris, Margita Haberland, an artist and musician who will realize a life performance accompanied by an improvisation on electric violin, Dieter Meier, an artist and a dandy, who will perform his beautiful lullaby "Schueffele". I also plan working on the composition of the whole opus with FM Einheit in his studio in Bayern, which means the selection of pieces, writing of the score, music producing, mixing and mastering. At the end and with your support, we will have an explosive mixture bringing together some historical figures from the underground scene of punk and from classical opera, put together in an innovative format of a video installation, to be presented in theatres, galeries and off-spaces all over the world and available also on CD and DVD. I need your support to accomplish this, so here is the plan I propose:   

 

Goal #1 - 7,500 €

Even though this seems like a small number, our initial goal to start is 7,500 €. This will put our campaign "in-demand", and enable us to begin rehearsals, shooting and recording with artists with basic equipment. We want to get started NOW, so please help us reach this goal quickly. At this point we will be able to start giving you sneak-peeks of "on set" activity with videos and photos directly from the set.

Goal #2 - 15,000 €

At the 15,000 € level we will be able to gather a professional crew and to hire a costume designer, a make up artist, as well as a camera operator, lighting- and sound technicians. We will also address artists we have in mind (see above), and are currently "in talks" with. All we need is the budget to make legitimate offers to them and they will be on-board right away.

Goal #3 - 30,000 €

This puts us into FULL PRODUCTION MODE. Once we reach 30,000 €, we will be in full-swing and can start producing the vast majority of the installation, including DVD and CD.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may not be able to contribute just yet, but are planning to soon. Until then, here are some things you can do right now to help...

Share your passion for this campaign by sharing it through social media and email. EVERY single time you share or post something about Punk Opera, this project makes progress. 

And that's all there is to it. Now let's make it come true!

I studied art history at the University Paris 4 Sorbonne, where I explored questions of transmediality in the arts, the uncanny in media and artistic exchanges between the three countries: France, Germany and Poland. At present I live and work in Berlin as an experimental filmmaker, curator, art historian, artist-supporter, and world traveler. 
In december 2016 I was able to realize first shootings for the Punk Opera, featuring great artists such as an internationally renowned soprano Simone Kermes and her music ensemble, as well as Mona Mur - the punk and chanson singer, as well as an underground diva, together with En Esch- industrial rock legend, known from industrial bands KMFDM, Slick Idiot and Pigface, Yoriko Maeno, a butoh dancer from Tokyo and Meritxell Campos Olive, an experimental dancer from Barcelona.
The images as well as the video you can see on this page are the result of these first shootings. 
In order to accomplish the opera however, I still have some shootings ahead. In February and March, I plan to film and record with: Rieko Okuda - a first class pianist from Osaka who will play experimental fugues on piano, Takushi Minagawa - a japanese countertenor, Zazie de Paris - a famous transgender chanson singer from Paris, Margita Haberland, an artist and musician who will realize a life performance accompanied by an improvisation on electric violin, Dieter Meier, an artist and a dandy, who will perform his beautiful lullaby "Schueffele". I also plan working on the composition of the whole opus with FM Einheit in his studio in Bayern, which means the selection of pieces, writing of the score, music producing, mixing and mastering. At the end and with your support, we will have an explosive mixture bringing together some historical figures from the underground scene of punk and from classical opera, put together in an innovative format of a video installation, to be presented in theatres, galeries and off-spaces all over the world and available also on CD and DVD. I need your support to accomplish this, so here is the plan I propose:   
 
Goal #1 - 7,500 €
Even though this seems like a small number, our initial goal to start is 7,500 €. This will put our campaign "in-demand", and enable us to begin rehearsals, shooting and recording with artists with basic equipment. We want to get started NOW, so please help us reach this goal quickly. At this point we will be able to start giving you sneak-peeks of "on set" activity with videos and photos directly from the set.
Goal #2 - 15,000 €
At the 15,000 € level we will be able to gather a professional crew and to hire a costume designer, a make up artist, as well as a camera operator, lighting- and sound technicians. We will also address artists we have in mind (see above), and are currently "in talks" with. All we need is the budget to make legitimate offers to them and they will be on-board right away.
Goal #3 - 30,000 €
This puts us into FULL PRODUCTION MODE. Once we reach 30,000 €, we will be in full-swing and can start producing the vast majority of the installation, including DVD and CD.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some of you may not be able to contribute just yet, but are planning to soon. Until then, here are some things you can do right now to help...
Share your passion for this campaign by sharing it through social media and email. EVERY single time you share or post something about Punk Opera, this project makes progress. 
And that's all there is to it. Now let's make it come true!

story:
Why This Film? Why Indiegogo?

Chariot is a pitch black ensemble comedy from Wales, with a fabulous cast. It will be filmed documentary-style with a small crew, and the help of the local community in Swansea, UK. 

The film is a response to the rise of the "Winner Takes All" culture over the last 30 years. It explores this by looking at the actions of one man, and his effect on a small community in post-Brexit UK. 

Due to the thriving film industry in Wales, writer/director Rob Surman was able to write and cast this project around some awesome acting talent, with faces recognisable both sides of the Atlantic.

In order to maintain the integrity of the film, and ensure it loses none of its "Special Sauce", we need to maintain control of it. Therefore, we are not seeking funds from government or corporate sources, and are appealing directly to you. 

We can't do this without you, our CHARIOTEERS!

Who We Are

Time to meet the Chariot family!

Robert Pugh – Actor/Co-producer

A prolific stage & screen actor, Robert Pugh has worked some of Hollywood’s most acclaimed directors, including Ridley Scott (Robin Hood, Kingdom Of Heaven), Roman Polanski (The Ghost), and Peter Weir (Master & Commander: The Far Side Of The World). He recently starred in ITV series Mr Selfridge alongside Jeremy Piven, played Jack Reynolds in the BAFTA winning BBC drama Doctor Foster, and had a memorable stint on Game of Thrones as the bloodthirsty Craster. http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0700059/?ref_=tt_cl_t1

In Chariot, Robert plays the lead role of Len Lewys-Jones, a corrupt, hyper ambitious politician who will stop at nothing to get what he wants.

Darren Evans - Actor

Darren has been a familiar face on our screens since his hilarious turn as school bully Chips in the 2010 movie Submarine, filmed on location in Swansea. More recently, he starred as ‘Danny Two Hats’ in the Channel 4 comedy My Mad Fat Diary, and was part of the main cast of two US network shows – the Welsh filmed FX series The Bastard Executioner and ABC favourite Galavant. He can currently be seen opposite Luke Treadaway in A Street Cat Named Bob. http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2362716/?ref_=tt_cl_t2

Darren’ plays Ceri, a lovelorn young illustrator whose life is impacted by Len’s greed.

Claire Cage - Actor

It’s been a busy few years for Claire, a self-declared “Northern thesp with a hint of Welsh.” Following stints on Coronation Street, Casualty, Being Human and countless other  British TV series, she starred in big screen drama High Tide with Melanie Walters, popped up in Jamie Adams’ indie hit Black Mountain Poets, and recently filmed the hotly anticipated Moon Dogs with Jack Parry-Jones. http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1527369/?ref_=tt_cl_t4

Claire’s character in Chariot is the highfalutin London journalist Nina Hetherington, who travels to Wales to interview Len.

Kyle Rees - Actor

Kyle has an impressive number of screen credits. After appearing in last year’s smash hit Pride, Kyle went on to star in Kurt Sutter’s FX series The Bastard Executioner, alongside Stephen Moyer and Chariot co-star Darren Evans. He was also one of the main cast of National Theatre Wales’ The Passion, a film version of which was released as The Gospel of Us. Later this year he will be seen opposite Orlando Bloom in the taut drama Romans, and has recently completed filming the first series of Will for Sky Atlantic/TNT. http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2939655/?ref_=tt_cl_t5

Kyle plays Jason Lewys-Jones, son of Len, and a monster in the making.

Caroline Berry - Actor

Caroline's numerous screen credits include Doctor Who, Stella, and the horror film Devil’s Bridge. More recently, she played the recurring role of Jo Sutton in BBC thriller Mayday, alongside Aiden Gillen & Sophie Okonedo, and had a memorable stint on Coronation Street as Valerie Phelan, wife of resident psycho, Pat. http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0077504/?ref_=tt_cl_t8

Caroline plays Diane Lewys-Jones - wife to Len - whose ‘trophy wife’ demeanour masks a fierce intelligence.

Nia Trussler Jones - Actor

Nia has worked in Welsh theatre for over twenty years, with companies such as Fluellen, Grass Roots Productions, 4th Wall, Lighthouse, and Owen Money Theatre co. Her screen credits include Eros Unleashed (ITV Wales) and comedy short Complimentary Biscuit. Nia is also a talented silversmith, having produced and sold her own line of jewellery!

Nia plays Toni Davies, a sensitive council worker with an unexpected connection to Len.

Helen Griffin - Actor

Helen has enjoyed an enviable career, including two films with Welsh director Caradog W James, the acclaimed drama Little White Lies – which Helen also wrote, and more recently the sci-fi thriller The Machine starring Toby Stephens. She also appeared in the much loved Twin Town and the recent adaptation of Under Milk Wood, both directed by Kevin Allen. As well as touring her one woman stage show based on the life of Dylan Thomas’ wife, Caitlin Macnamara, she has collaborated on with comedian Jo Brand on BBC series Getting On and Going Forward. http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0341211/?ref_=tt_cl_t6

Helen plays the principled but steely Alice Cartwright, a human rights lawyer who is pitted against Len in the by-election.

Menna Trussler - Actor

With a career spanning four decades, Menna is one of Wales’ best loved actresses, having appeared in dozens of films and TV shows. Credits include August with Anthony Hopkins, Plotz with a View opposite Christopher Walken, and the 2014 hit movie Pride. Her impeccable comedy skills have been put to use in shows such as Little Britain, Stella, and Jam & Jerusalem among others. http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0874447/?ref_=tt_cl_t7

Menna will play the awkward yet well-meaning Enid Wist.

Tom Myles - Actor/Assistant Director

Exeter University graduate Tom is co-artistic director of the dynamic Swansea theatre company, Critical Ambition. In 2016, he starred in their fantastic production of Phil Porter’s play Blink at The Other Room in Cardiff, before transferring to Swansea’s Volcano Theatre. In 2014/15, he toured with James Graham’s moving and highly original play The Man.

Tom plays Martin, the put-upon intern of demanding journalist Nina.

Rhys Isaac-Jones - Actor

Rhys graduated from the prestigious Guildhall School of Music & Drama in 2013. He has since been nominated for an Offie (Off West End Theatre Award) for his performance in the play Jess and Joe Forever, which received rave reviews during its 2016 national tour. Screen credits include ITV series Jekyll & Hyde, short film Complimentary Biscuit, and the Swansea based drama High Tide starring Melanie Walters & fellow Charioteer Claire Cage.

Rhys plays Craig, campaign aide to Len - surely the most thankless job in government...

Sarah Louise Madison - Actor

Sarah is well known to sci-fi fans as the face and talons behind the ‘Weeping Angel’ in Doctor Who. Other credits include the web series Twisted Showcase, horror films Theatre of Fear and The Amityville Asylum, and James Cookson’s short drama Panic, in which she starred alongside Owen Teale and Tom Rhys Harries. Sarah is highly sought after as a guest at sci-fi conventions worldwide. http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4663679/?ref_=tt_cl_t3

Sarah plays Seona, a colleague of Ceri, with whom she starts a tentative romance.

Rob Surman - Writer/Director/Actor

An associate of Critical Ambition theatre company, in 2015 Rob wrote and produced comedy short 'Complimentary Biscuit' alongside Rhys Isaac-Jones, Robert Pugh, & Tom Myles.  He was part of the cast of Critical Ambition's inaugural production of 'The Man', and has performed with several theatre companies including Lighthouse, Fluellen & Pontardawe Arts. Chariot has been a labour of love for Rob, the product of years of shared experiences, and a desire to produce a snapshot of modern culture whilst making people laugh. https://vimeo.com/157956225

Rob plays Marc, illustrator & colleague of Ceri, and another victim of Len's machinations. 

Matthew Derrick - DoP

Time to meet the eyes behind the lens. We're delighted to introduce our wonderful Director of Photography, Matthew Derrick! Matthew recently finished shooting the horror-comedy 'Big Girl', and has worked for Tanabi Films, Pitcairn Group, and many others after starting his career at Swansea based VibeTv. He is also an experienced editor.  http://www.imdb.com/name/nm6555041/

Anthony Jones - Composer

Super talented singer/songwriter Anthony Jones has signed on to create an original score for Chariot. Welsh/Venezuelan Anthony has been performing in English and Spanish for two decades, first coming to prominence as part of boyband UFF. He has since become fluent in all facets of music production, and has gone on to create original music for both theatre and film. We're delighted to have you on board, Anthony!

What We Need

We are seeking to raise a total of £12000. Of this:

  • 32% will be used to pay our large cast
  • 25% will go to our crew
  • 18%  on camera & sound equipment
  • 10% on catering, accommodation & transport
  • 5% to produce our original soundtrack
  • 4% on insurance and room hire
  • 4% on printing materials & props
  • 2% on artwork 

The Good Stuff!!

We want you to become part of the Chariot family, and our perks reflect this. Alongside the usual digital downloads, mugs, T-shirts and posters, we want to provide you with opportunities to meet the team! From the chance to attend one of TWO premieres, to raising a glass (or four) at our wrap party, we'd love to get to know you. We'd especially love you to BE IN the film, and hope that as many of you as possible choose this option!!!

And if it takes your fancy, you can be an ASSOCIATE, EXECUTIVE or FULL PRODUCER, with an imdb credit to match!

Any perks we haven't thought of that you'd like to see? Let us know!

 

The impact your contributions will have

We're so excited to make this film and share it with you! Once completed, we plan to tour it to cinemas in both UK and USA, holding Q&A sessions so we can meet and get to know you. The tour will be followed be VOD (video on demand) release on platforms like amazon, vimeo, and iTunes.

Share The Love!

Even if you aren't in a position to claim a perk, you can still be part of the journey by sharing this page using the Indiegogo share tools at the top of this page. This will create a unique link that we'll be able to track. As a special thank you, we'll be giving a special gift to the person who shares the most love by sharing this campaign!
