story:
Synopsis

A Night in Ramallah  is a short documentary film exploring the lives of young Palestinian creatives and the nightlife that brings the artistic community together. This may be something that happens in the United Kingdom as well, so what makes nightlife in Ramallah different to that at home? You need to think about the culture.

The act of going out and drinking may be normal in the West, but in Palestine it’s something different. It may not be forbidden, but it’s frowned upon by most parts of the society.

The film will explore the groups of people that represent the bubble of society that is formed in local pubs and bars. We will do this by following two young creatives: Ahmad and Noora. How do they both perform their daily routine, and how does the nightlife enhance and contribute to their profession? 

 

Short Summary

We are a group of student filmmakers from Kingston University, London.  As it is our final year of University, we are working on our final graduation project. We are hoping you can help us with funding our film, which will be our final and essential evaluation.

 

What We Need & What You Get

With your help we can create a strong, unique and thought provoking documentary film. Your kind contributions will primarily pay for our trip to Ramallah, plus the local crew and camera equipment that will help us to shoot the film and make our vision a reality. In order to make this film we need £3,500. Below is a pie chart of our budget breakdown:

 

If you make a contribution to the project, you will receive perks.  The higher the donation, the better the perk! 

 

Risks & Challenges

We understand that there is conflict in this region. However, the team members that are flying out have worked in Palestine before. They are familiar and have had experience with the challenges of filming there. They know their limits and how far they can push the filming. Should any problems arise, we can solve these to the best of our ability. We feel confident that we'll be able to walk away with a fantastic and unique film for you all to see. 

 

Other ways you can help...

If you can't contribute, do not worry. However, we would really appreciate it if you could SHARE this page as widely as possible amongst friends, family and colleagues. This film will be unique and different to most films that come out of the region. Lets break the stereotypes by showing a different view of Palestine through this project.

 

MEET THE TEAM

 

Alice Denny: Director/Producer

Alice is a final year BA (Hons) Filmmaking student at Kingston University London. Specialising in documentary film, she has had three years of experience and University working in this form. 

In 2015, she was granted money from the Stanley Picker Travel Award, to make a film about mental health in Palestine, which is still in production. Through this trip, her interest in Palestinian culture grew, which led her to make this film for her final graduation project.

Outside of University, she has had some experience working in the film industry. Partaking in an Erasmus work placement year as part of her studies, she worked for Apple Film Production and ScripTeast workshops in Warsaw, Poland. In 2014, she was commissioned by the company LoveWimbledon to make a video promoting Wimbledon town centre, which reached more than 17,000 views on YouTube. She has also worked as a production runner on the feature film This Beautiful Fantastic, which was recently screened at Palm Springs International Film Festival and won the audience award at Ajaccio Film Festival in Corsica. She also did a runner job for the upcoming documentary War Child, which is due to be shown on Channel 4 in February.

 

 

Dina Amin: Director/Producer

Dina is a third year student on the filmmaking course (BA) at Kingston University.  

Dina is co-directing and co-producing the film with Alice. They work well together and have developed great communication strategies in preproduction that they will take on in the next stages. 

Dina has directed and produced her own films as well as being part of many projects that improved her skills and knowledge. One of the most beneficial internships she undertook was being a producer assistant at FlyFilm’s company. In addition to being an Assistant Director on various short films and a TV Series, Dina is also currently producing a film for the Stop Play Record Program.

 

Michael Zananiri: Director of Photography

Michael  has been a professional cinematographer for 8 years. He has rich experience working a number of short films, TV commercials, feature films and documentaries. While working on these productions Michael has managed to develop extra expertise in non-linear editing, using Final Cut Pro, Final cut pro X, and also cinema digital cameras such as RED Epic, ARRI Alexa and Sony F55.

His goal as Director of Photography is to create images that will not only tell the story, but that will affect the viewer on a subliminal level.

 

Yousef Hammad: 1st AC & Sound Recordist

Yousef Hammad is an independent filmmaker. He has worked on a large variety of projects in the West Bank, Jerusalem and Jordan. He has experience as a Camera Assisant, Director of Photography, focus puller, and a sound recordist.

Alaa' Barghouti: Boom Operator 

 Alaa Barghouthi studied audio engineering at SAE Amman, and currently working in the Palestinian broadcasting corporation as an audio engineer. He also volunteers in the BBC media action as a boom operator. 

Berta Lozano Ferrer: Editor

Berta is a final year (BA) Filmmaking student at Kingston University. She has developed her main interest (editing), throughout the last four years; having done mainly documentaries and experimental shorts.

As an editor she has worked at the UK destination for Korean TV series, Dahean Drama and GFE Entertainment company, specialising in entertainment events.

She has also worked for the Spanish company "Rock Sin Subtitulos", based in London; filming and editing videos of Spanish musicians, comedy shows and the well-known Mega Spanish Party in Scala and The Grand Clapham.

In 2016, she got awarded for the Stanley Picker Award through which she had the chance to do a documentary about the largest refugee camp in Munich - Bayernkaserne. This documentary is currently in the editing stage. She is currently working on a experimental short commissioned by ICA and founded by Channel 4 and the Arts Council.

 

Samuel Keysell: Sound Designer

Samuel is the sound designer for ‘A Night In Ramallah’. His main point of interest will be in conveying the unique sound of the region. He is currently a BA (Hons) Filmmaking student at Kingston University. His previous work includes music production on EP’s from the up and coming band ‘Febueder’, including sound design on short films to be released this year in conjunction with the bands next two EP’s.

 

Eyad Hourani: Associate Producer

 

Mr. Hourani started acting at the age of 14 with the “Days For Theater” Foundation. He completed his studies in Theater Arts Education Program at the Freedom Theater in Jenin, Palestine, following which, he completed his acting training in cooperation with the Arab-American University for three years. During his study period he participated as a lead actor in many theatrical works: Animal Farm, Fragments of Palestine, Men in the Sun, and Alice in Wonderland. He graduated from the program as an actor and a drama coach.

Mr. Hourani's professional career includes many theatrical works:  Richard II (which participated in the Globe's festival in the United Kingdom), While Waiting, The exception and the Rule.
also participated in many Drama and Acting workshops with theaters around the world, including:  Shopene Theater in Germany; National Theatre in Vienna; and The Public Theatre in New York City.

In film, Mr. Hourani played one of the lead roles (Tarek)  in the Oscar nominated movie Omar, directed by Hany Abu-Assad. He Directed his first short film C the C which participated in the World Festival of Short Films Festival.  This December, Mr. Hourani attended the 2015 Dubai Film Festival, where he appeared in two featured films: Zinzana (directed by Majid Al Ansari) and The Idol (directed by Hany Abu-Assad).  Currently, Mr. Hourani is working in Qatar on a soon to be announced sci-fi television program.
story_txt: SynopsisA Night in Ramallah  is a short documentary film exploring the lives of young Palestinian creatives and the nightlife that brings the artistic community together. This may be something that happens in the United Kingdom as well, so what makes nightlife in Ramallah different to that at home? You need to think about the culture.The act of going out and drinking may be normal in the West, but in Palestine it’s something different. It may not be forbidden, but it’s frowned upon by most parts of the society.The film will explore the groups of people that represent the bubble of society that is formed in local pubs and bars. We will do this by following two young creatives: Ahmad and Noora. How do they both perform their daily routine, and how does the nightlife enhance and contribute to their profession?  Short SummaryWe are a group of student filmmakers from Kingston University, London.  As it is our final year of University, we are working on our final graduation project. We are hoping you can help us with funding our film, which will be our final and essential evaluation. What We Need & What You GetWith your help we can create a strong, unique and thought provoking documentary film. Your kind contributions will primarily pay for our trip to Ramallah, plus the local crew and camera equipment that will help us to shoot the film and make our vision a reality. In order to make this film we need £3,500. Below is a pie chart of our budget breakdown: If you make a contribution to the project, you will receive perks.  The higher the donation, the better the perk!  Risks & ChallengesWe understand that there is conflict in this region. However, the team members that are flying out have worked in Palestine before. They are familiar and have had experience with the challenges of filming there. They know their limits and how far they can push the filming. Should any problems arise, we can solve these to the best of our ability. We feel confident that we'll be able to walk away with a fantastic and unique film for you all to see.  Other ways you can help...If you can't contribute, do not worry. However, we would really appreciate it if you could SHARE this page as widely as possible amongst friends, family and colleagues. This film will be unique and different to most films that come out of the region. Lets break the stereotypes by showing a different view of Palestine through this project. MEET THE TEAM Alice Denny: Director/ProducerAlice is a final year BA (Hons) Filmmaking student at Kingston University London. Specialising in documentary film, she has had three years of experience and University working in this form. In 2015, she was granted money from the Stanley Picker Travel Award, to make a film about mental health in Palestine, which is still in production. Through this trip, her interest in Palestinian culture grew, which led her to make this film for her final graduation project.Outside of University, she has had some experience working in the film industry. Partaking in an Erasmus work placement year as part of her studies, she worked for Apple Film Production and ScripTeast workshops in Warsaw, Poland. In 2014, she was commissioned by the company LoveWimbledon to make a video promoting Wimbledon town centre, which reached more than 17,000 views on YouTube. She has also worked as a production runner on the feature film This Beautiful Fantastic, which was recently screened at Palm Springs International Film Festival and won the audience award at Ajaccio Film Festival in Corsica. She also did a runner job for the upcoming documentary War Child, which is due to be shown on Channel 4 in February.  Dina Amin: Director/ProducerDina is a third year student on the filmmaking course (BA) at Kingston University.  Dina is co-directing and co-producing the film with Alice. They work well together and have developed great communication strategies in preproduction that they will take on in the next stages. Dina has directed and produced her own films as well as being part of many projects that improved her skills and knowledge. One of the most beneficial internships she undertook was being a producer assistant at FlyFilm’s company. In addition to being an Assistant Director on various short films and a TV Series, Dina is also currently producing a film for the Stop Play Record Program. Michael Zananiri: Director of PhotographyMichael  has been a professional cinematographer for 8 years. He has rich experience working a number of short films, TV commercials, feature films and documentaries. While working on these productions Michael has managed to develop extra expertise in non-linear editing, using Final Cut Pro, Final cut pro X, and also cinema digital cameras such as RED Epic, ARRI Alexa and Sony F55.His goal as Director of Photography is to create images that will not only tell the story, but that will affect the viewer on a subliminal level. Yousef Hammad: 1st AC & Sound RecordistYousef Hammad is an independent filmmaker. He has worked on a large variety of projects in the West Bank, Jerusalem and Jordan. He has experience as a Camera Assisant, Director of Photography, focus puller, and a sound recordist.Alaa' Barghouti: Boom Operator  Alaa Barghouthi studied audio engineering at SAE Amman, and currently working in the Palestinian broadcasting corporation as an audio engineer. He also volunteers in the BBC media action as a boom operator. Berta Lozano Ferrer: EditorBerta is a final year (BA) Filmmaking student at Kingston University. She has developed her main interest (editing), throughout the last four years; having done mainly documentaries and experimental shorts.As an editor she has worked at the UK destination for Korean TV series, Dahean Drama and GFE Entertainment company, specialising in entertainment events.She has also worked for the Spanish company "Rock Sin Subtitulos", based in London; filming and editing videos of Spanish musicians, comedy shows and the well-known Mega Spanish Party in Scala and The Grand Clapham.In 2016, she got awarded for the Stanley Picker Award through which she had the chance to do a documentary about the largest refugee camp in Munich - Bayernkaserne. This documentary is currently in the editing stage. She is currently working on a experimental short commissioned by ICA and founded by Channel 4 and the Arts Council. Samuel Keysell: Sound DesignerSamuel is the sound designer for ‘A Night In Ramallah’. His main point of interest will be in conveying the unique sound of the region. He is currently a BA (Hons) Filmmaking student at Kingston University. His previous work includes music production on EP’s from the up and coming band ‘Febueder’, including sound design on short films to be released this year in conjunction with the bands next two EP’s. Eyad Hourani: Associate Producer Mr. Hourani started acting at the age of 14 with the “Days For Theater” Foundation. He completed his studies in Theater Arts Education Program at the Freedom Theater in Jenin, Palestine, following which, he completed his acting training in cooperation with the Arab-American University for three years. During his study period he participated as a lead actor in many theatrical works: Animal Farm, Fragments of Palestine, Men in the Sun, and Alice in Wonderland. He graduated from the program as an actor and a drama coach.Mr. Hourani's professional career includes many theatrical works:  Richard II (which participated in the Globe's festival in the United Kingdom), While Waiting, The exception and the Rule.also participated in many Drama and Acting workshops with theaters around the world, including:  Shopene Theater in Germany; National Theatre in Vienna; and The Public Theatre in New York City.In film, Mr. Hourani played one of the lead roles (Tarek)  in the Oscar nominated movie Omar, directed by Hany Abu-Assad. He Directed his first short film C the C which participated in the World Festival of Short Films Festival.  This December, Mr. Hourani attended the 2015 Dubai Film Festival, where he appeared in two featured films: Zinzana (directed by Majid Al Ansari) and The Idol (directed by Hany Abu-Assad).  Currently, Mr. Hourani is working in Qatar on a soon to be announced sci-fi television program.

story:
Short Summary

"Make it or Break it" (working title) is the story of a young dancer and his friends, trying to find their way to the top of the Atlanta dance scene. With the challenges faced both professionally and personally, is he willing to do what it really takes to "Make it or Break it" or will he fall victim to the nightmare of giving up on his dreams?

"Seek A Life Useful" (working title) is the story of four thespians, straight out of high school, with the hopes and dreams of stardom. Entering into the same university, breaking into the same department, each wanting to become the newest face of the university's theatre department. Each met with their own set of obstacles, which of these newcomers truly have what it takes to survive in this cut throat department? 

These are the top two ideas that the short film will be based on.

I am Jared D. Howard, a graduating senior Theatre Performance major, at Georgia State University.  With goals of becoming a better thespian, while seeking a life useful, I am fighting to accomplish set goals. Often times we are told to chase our dreams and never let anything stop you.  Well this is the first step toward chasing my cinematic dreams.  I am reaching out to YOU in order to help fund a QUALITY short film in order to build my cinematic brand, now branching out into the field of writing and directing.  With the help of trusted individuals, it is my goal to advance not only myself, but those involved, one step closer to their dreams.  Your monetary contribution would help reach these goals by allowing the production to be filmed with quality technology, those involved to be compensated fairly, and the necessary fees to be taken care of.  As a college student, funds are limited and let's face it, no one wants to watch, or give credit, to anything produced, filmed or presented low budget.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

I have a goal of $6,500. 50% of that budget will be spent toward equipment, space rentals, promotional expenses and miscellaneous production items that have been deemed necessary. The other 50% will be used to compensate those involved (wardrobe, hair stylists, make-up artists, production assistants, actors, choreographers, editors, etc.) Because no one wants to utilize their talents for free, nor should they have to.  Many times we are expecting of favors or freebies (especially in the art world) and our final products reflect just that.  So to ensure that this production is at it's best, I can not and will not ask anyone to work for free.

 

The Impact

The final product will have the potential to be shopped to various networks in hopes to become something greater than we initially imagined.  This production has been written as an entire series, however, I am using the pilot episode as a short film instead.  This giving the viewers a chance to really see what the product is about. That way, we can figure out what the viewers really enjoyed, learn from mistakes and push to produce an even better production if it is received well enough to continue with.  

Risks & Challenges

The challenges we face are all money related.  Without proper funding, that effects the tools needed, the quality of talent and the amount of time we would have to shoot.  Of course, we would make it work as best we can, but the financial support would take a tremendous load off of the production's back. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.  Your contribution would be greatly appreciated by spreading the word, sharing the link and prayers of great success! Keeping God first can, and will, always be most beneficial.

story:
Behind the Show

I'm Calibe Thompson, the Executive Producer of "Taste the Islands". That title means I'm responsible for bringing the people and resources together to get this show done and on air.

At the beginning of this journey in 2014, Chef Irie expressed a desire to me, to have a cooking show that he would host. I wanted to create a national television series. Two Jamaicans on a mission! It was a natural fit.

I sold my car, ate just-add-water pancakes from a box, and rode a bicycle for a few months to come up with the funds to get production on season 1 started. We found some camera guys, shot some cooking scenes in a friend's kitchen, I edited everything... and then it all sat on my computer for a year.

I'll put the complete story in a memoir some day but suffice to say that after that year, through our preparedness and Chef's connections, we had the opportunity to present the finished pilot to our local PBS affiliate, and the rest was history.

We are the first Jamaican-produced and Jamaican-hosted series on national public television in the US. We've been embraced by the Caribbean community and so many people who simply love Caribbean cuisine and culture. It's really important to us to keep this project alive, and make it bigger and better. The first time around we used bubble gum and shoe strings to piece the show together. This time we spent a little bit on nuts and bolts too.

This time we have a Haitian Chef (Chef Thia) and an island explorer (Lisa Lee) along for the ride with Chef Irie. There are clear improvements in the production, but we still have a little shortfall in the funding. That's why we're turning to you.

In Jamaica we say "one one cocoa full basket", meaning we'll get to our goal a little at a time. The basket is almost full, but we need a few more cocoas to get us to the finishing point.

What We Need & What You Get

We actually need much more than the number in the title here to pay the bills:

  • Many on the team have only been partially paid, others have not been paid at all. These hard working people have contributed their time and talents: 
    • Performing
    • Editing
    • Coordinating logistics
    • Shooting video
    • Shooting still photos
    • Contributing other supporting activities and facilities
  • There are also very substantial technical and insurance fees associated with public television broadcast

Please do what you can to help us get through this.

Contributors can enjoy perks from as simple as the satisfaction of knowing they helped Season 2 happen, to signed letters, cookbooks, access to watch the episodes before they broadcast, and even on-screen credits in the show.

If we raise more than the amount needed to truly clear all our bills, we'll have a little cushion to get started on an even more dynamic season 3!

The Impact

The excitement built the first time around garnered coverage from publications including The New York Daily news, Atlanta Black Star, The South Florida Times, NBC6, WSVN, The Jamaica Gleaner and beyond. This time, we had the privilege of traveling to Barbados, so we're looking forward to the support of the Jamaican, Haitian and Barbadian communities, as well as all the fans who have grown to love the show, website and cookbook!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please note: we have to deliver the completed episodes by the end of January so we only have until the 16th to make this happen. If you can't help financially please help in other ways:

  • If you know someone who can contribute, please encourage them to.
  • You have friends on Facebook, Twitter and other social platforms. Please share our request with them. They may be willing to contribute.
  • If there's anything else you can think of to help bring support, let us know

Thanks so much for taking the time to read all this. From our entire team, we appreciate you!

story:
Creepypasta meets golden age horror. Oscar’s Bell is an atmospheric horror short film that will be shot in Manchester over several nights.

The film follows Duncan’s weekly camping trip with his dog Oscar. The evening begins like the countless others they have spent pitched up in their favourite spots looking out at the nearby forest. Tonight however, there's one big difference. It's the first time that he's brought his son along with him. At the end of a long day together they have settled under the night sky to watch the stars but when Duncan looks out into the woods, something looks back. 



The film features rising star Paul Bullion as Duncan, a proud outdoorsman. Duncan isn't the typical character you'd find in a horror film, he's perfectly at home alone in the wilderness and capable of looking after himself, so when presented with a possible threat he's thrown by the situation. Paul is perfect for this role, as he's an extremely versatile actor and is best known for playing Billy Kitchen, an ally of the the Shelby family, in Peaky Blinders where he appeared alongside Cillian Murphy and Tom Hardy, and as Nicolae in Dracula Untold. As an actor, he's not only believable as a forest ranger who has spent years honing his skills, but we hope to show a more sensitive side to his performance as a father.



 


Paul Bullion as Duncan 

Rio Walker as Duncan's son Ross

TJ as Oscar

We want to create a film that  is inspired by classic horror films like The Conjuring and The Innkeepers that relied on creating a sense of dread and foreboding, rather than special effects to keep the audience on the edge of their seats. It's going to be an atmospheric piece that will hopefully grip audiences and show a different side to director Chris Cronin's work. The reason that we're running the crowdfunding campaign is that we can't do this alone. Over the past few years we've made several high concept, no budget short films like Sophie's Fortune, Moments and Skye. Whilst we're incredibly proud of what we achieved, making Oscar's Bell will help us take the next step towards making our first feature film.

There are several challenges to overcome with making the film. Whilst £5,500 may sound like a lot, all the money we receive will be used to ensure that Oscar's Bell has the highest possible production values. Central to the film is Oscar, the dog that will feature heavily in the film. Due to the requirements of the script we will be working with a german shepherd called TJ and a specialist animal handler from Animal Direction, a leading company who specialise in training animals for film & television. As animal lovers it's important to us that TJ is properly trained and well looked after, which is why we'll be filming over two nights.

In order to create the sense of forboding and dread in the film, we will need special equipment including generators and lighting to help us film at night.

The chart below shows a breakdown of how the money we raise will be used.

We Still Need Crew!

Whilst we have most departments covered, we're always looking for new people to collaborate with. We'd love to hear from people who may be interested in helping out, in particular we're looking for:

- Assistant Director

- Make Up Artist (FILLED)

- Art Director/ Production Designer (FILLED)

- Script Supervisor (FILLED)

- Runner (Ability to drive is required)

Get in touch with this page for more details on how you can get involved. If you just want to be on set and help out let us know!

Sharing the campaign. In some ways this is even more important than contributing financially. And every connection helps - so please do share this campaign with your social networks and contacts. Retweet it. Post it. It all helps to spread the word.


Director & Co-Writer - Chris Cronin

Showreel - https://vimeo.com/121201050

Chris is well known for his high concept films that have thrilled audiences around the world. He was one of twelve filmmakers selected for the inaugural Frontières Finance Forum, an initiative launched by Cannes and Fantasia Film Festivals. He will be presenting his vision for horror feature film Malevolent, alongside the producers of Love & Friendship, The Witch and the director of Sherlock and Doctor Who who will be pitching their next projects. Chris’ previous films include Balcony which won at the prestigious Raindance Film Festival and was described as; “A well-made and unique, but more importantly, intriguing piece of work that leaves you thinking about it after the 14th and final second has passed." David F. Sandberg, director of Lights Out and Annabelle 2 selected Balcony to receive the Technical Achievement Award at the 15 Second Horror Challenge. Chris’ previous films have won several awards including People's Choice Award in the Reed Film competition at BAFTA for his short Peter and Best Director for the 48FilmProject Unkillable, presented at Directors Guild of America.

Producer - Andrew Oldbury

Andrew began his career working in development on the BBC medical drama Holby City after graduating with a Master’s degree in Literature from the University of Manchester. His love of working with writers led him to assist BBC Writersroom on the TV Drama Festival, and then onto joining the development team at Coronation Street. In 2015, he was awarded the Mike Frankovich Columbia TriStar scholarship to study for a Master's degree in Producing for Film & Television at the National Film and Television School.

Over the past three years Andrew has produced several award winning short films which have collectively been shown at over 170 film festivals. He was recently nominated for two Unity awards for the virtual reality game Into the Black, the only UK student game to be nominated, that was praised by VR Focus as “The future is bright and enthusiastic about game creation and VR, based on Into The Black.”

Director of Photography - Alex Stone

Showreel - https://vimeo.com/117120842

Alex Stone is an award-winning Cinematographer, having picked up the Best Cinematographer award in the international 48 Film Project in 2015, plus more recently this year he was among the finalists for Best Cinematography in the biggest short film competition in the world; My Røde Reel.

He is credited with the cinematography on a growing number of features, short films and commercials and is always looking forward to lighting and lensing the next project.

Production Manager - Leah Blackaby
Leah grew up in Hertfordshire and discovered her love of story telling at a very young age. Having started in student television, Leah most recently has been producing on various short films and working as a freelance Runner and Production Assistant in TV and Film. Her latest achievement has been setting up her own production company - Elby Rose Productions through which she is writing and developing her first solo project. Leah's most notable work so far is Producing the short 'Last Man On Earth' which has had various festival selections and awards and is eagerly awaiting the release of the latest short she has produced; 'Rabbit Punch'.

Casting Director - Ben Newsome



Benjamin Newsome is a leading casting director who was nominated at the Top Casting Director Awards UK in 2014, 2015 & 2016. He has cast several dozen theatre productions and short films, that have won numerous awards internationally, including: Mystery Of Edwin Drood (Arts Theatre), Title Of Show (Landor Theatre), Secret Garden & Pop Factor (UK Tour),I Do! I Do! (Riverside Studios), Search For A Twitter Star (Lyric Theatre), RENT (Tabard Theatre), Passing By (Tristan Bates), USHERS (Charing Cross Theatre), Only Our Own (Arts Theatre), Viva Voce, Walk Like A Man (International Tours), RAGS (Lyric Theatre), Carousel (Arcola), The Last Five Years (Greenwich Theatre), Dessa Rose (Trafalgar Studios), Sam Bailey Live In The West End (Lyric Theatre). Beauty & The Beast (International Tour), Flashdance (European Tour). Various casting across London's West End & Off West End.

Resident Casting Director at Ye Old Rose & Crown for Allstar Productions & Resident Casting Director for Arion Prodctions.

The Page To Stage season for Aria Entertainment 2013, 2014 & 2015.

Co-Producer of Divergent Productions.

Post Production Sound - Andrew Layfield

Whether on location or in post production, Andrew works tirelessly through to the final mix creating sound effects and manipulating audio to ensure the highest possible quality of sound is created for every project. This has led to him working with Channel 4 and BBC television. Amongst the aways winning films where his distinctive sound treatment received notice are '2AM', 'In The Shadow Of The Mountain', 'Broadcast Signal Intrusion' and 'Sophie's Fortune'.


Make Up Artist - Mita Patel

Mita Patel has worked in the fashion, media and film industry for the past 5 years. She has worked for the BBC Cbeebies and ITV working for Tiger Aspects production company. She has been taught by award winning media heads such as Emmy winners Neill Gorton and Davy Jones and double Oscar winner Mark Coulier. She has been a part of award winning Genesis Flux for the past three years.

Composer - Adam Orridge

Adam has steadily built up a reputation as an in-demand composer and orchestrator whose work has been heard in cinemas and concert halls around the world. His work is varied, having recently written music for the world renowned Jazz at Lincoln Orchestra which received its world premiere at the Barbican, and worked on advertising campaigns for Red Bull and Radio 3. He has worked on many award winning films, many of which can be currently seen touring the festival circuit.

Production Design - Lara Stark
Lara is currently a student at the Manchester film school, working working on numerous projects as an Art Assistant. During her time there Lara has had the fortune of working on RTS nominated films.

The evening begins like the countless others they have spent pitched up in their favourite spots looking out at the nearby forest. Tonight however, there's one big difference. It's the first time that he's brought his son along with him. At the end of a long day together they have settled under the night sky to watch the stars but when Duncan looks out into the woods, something looks back. The film features rising star Paul Bullion as Duncan, a proud outdoorsman. Duncan isn't the typical character you'd find in a horror film, he's perfectly at home alone in the wilderness and capable of looking after himself, so when presented with a possible threat he's thrown by the situation. Paul is perfect for this role, as he's an extremely versatile actor and is best known for playing Billy Kitchen, an ally of the the Shelby family, in Peaky Blinders where he appeared alongside Cillian Murphy and Tom Hardy, and as Nicolae in Dracula Untold. As an actor, he's not only believable as a forest ranger who has spent years honing his skills, but we hope to show a more sensitive side to his performance as a father. Paul Bullion as Duncan Rio Walker as Duncan's son RossTJ as OscarWe want to create a film that  is inspired by classic horror films like The Conjuring and The Innkeepers that relied on creating a sense of dread and foreboding, rather than special effects to keep the audience on the edge of their seats. It's going to be an atmospheric piece that will hopefully grip audiences and show a different side to director Chris Cronin's work. The reason that we're running the crowdfunding campaign is that we can't do this alone. Over the past few years we've made several high concept, no budget short films like Sophie's Fortune, Moments and Skye. Whilst we're incredibly proud of what we achieved, making Oscar's Bell will help us take the next step towards making our first feature film.There are several challenges to overcome with making the film. Whilst £5,500 may sound like a lot, all the money we receive will be used to ensure that Oscar's Bell has the highest possible production values. Central to the film is Oscar, the dog that will feature heavily in the film. Due to the requirements of the script we will be working with a german shepherd called TJ and a specialist animal handler from Animal Direction, a leading company who specialise in training animals for film & television. As animal lovers it's important to us that TJ is properly trained and well looked after, which is why we'll be filming over two nights.In order to create the sense of forboding and dread in the film, we will need special equipment including generators and lighting to help us film at night.The chart below shows a breakdown of how the money we raise will be used.We Still Need Crew!Whilst we have most departments covered, we're always looking for new people to collaborate with. We'd love to hear from people who may be interested in helping out, in particular we're looking for:- Assistant Director- Make Up Artist (FILLED)- Art Director/ Production Designer (FILLED)- Script Supervisor (FILLED)- Runner (Ability to drive is required)Get in touch with this page for more details on how you can get involved. If you just want to be on set and help out let us know!Sharing the campaign. In some ways this is even more important than contributing financially. And every connection helps - so please do share this campaign with your social networks and contacts. Retweet it. Post it. It all helps to spread the word.Director & Co-Writer - Chris CroninShowreel - https://vimeo.com/121201050Chris is well known for his high concept films that have thrilled audiences around the world. He was one of twelve filmmakers selected for the inaugural Frontières Finance Forum, an initiative launched by Cannes and Fantasia Film Festivals. He will be presenting his vision for horror feature film Malevolent, alongside the producers of Love & Friendship, The Witch and the director of Sherlock and Doctor Who who will be pitching their next projects. Chris’ previous films include Balcony which won at the prestigious Raindance Film Festival and was described as; “A well-made and unique, but more importantly, intriguing piece of work that leaves you thinking about it after the 14th and final second has passed." David F. Sandberg, director of Lights Out and Annabelle 2 selected Balcony to receive the Technical Achievement Award at the 15 Second Horror Challenge. Chris’ previous films have won several awards including People's Choice Award in the Reed Film competition at BAFTA for his short Peter and Best Director for the 48FilmProject Unkillable, presented at Directors Guild of America.Producer - Andrew OldburyAndrew began his career working in development on the BBC medical drama Holby City after graduating with a Master’s degree in Literature from the University of Manchester. His love of working with writers led him to assist BBC Writersroom on the TV Drama Festival, and then onto joining the development team at Coronation Street. In 2015, he was awarded the Mike Frankovich Columbia TriStar scholarship to study for a Master's degree in Producing for Film & Television at the National Film and Television School.Over the past three years Andrew has produced several award winning short films which have collectively been shown at over 170 film festivals. He was recently nominated for two Unity awards for the virtual reality game Into the Black, the only UK student game to be nominated, that was praised by VR Focus as “The future is bright and enthusiastic about game creation and VR, based on Into The Black.”Director of Photography - Alex StoneShowreel - https://vimeo.com/117120842Alex Stone is an award-winning Cinematographer, having picked up the Best Cinematographer award in the international 48 Film Project in 2015, plus more recently this year he was among the finalists for Best Cinematography in the biggest short film competition in the world; My Røde Reel.He is credited with the cinematography on a growing number of features, short films and commercials and is always looking forward to lighting and lensing the next project.Production Manager - Leah BlackabyLeah grew up in Hertfordshire and discovered her love of story telling at a very young age. Having started in student television, Leah most recently has been producing on various short films and working as a freelance Runner and Production Assistant in TV and Film. Her latest achievement has been setting up her own production company - Elby Rose Productions through which she is writing and developing her first solo project. Leah's most notable work so far is Producing the short 'Last Man On Earth' which has had various festival selections and awards and is eagerly awaiting the release of the latest short she has produced; 'Rabbit Punch'.Casting Director - Ben NewsomeBenjamin Newsome is a leading casting director who was nominated at the Top Casting Director Awards UK in 2014, 2015 & 2016. He has cast several dozen theatre productions and short films, that have won numerous awards internationally, including: Mystery Of Edwin Drood (Arts Theatre), Title Of Show (Landor Theatre), Secret Garden & Pop Factor (UK Tour),I Do! I Do! (Riverside Studios), Search For A Twitter Star (Lyric Theatre), RENT (Tabard Theatre), Passing By (Tristan Bates), USHERS (Charing Cross Theatre), Only Our Own (Arts Theatre), Viva Voce, Walk Like A Man (International Tours), RAGS (Lyric Theatre), Carousel (Arcola), The Last Five Years (Greenwich Theatre), Dessa Rose (Trafalgar Studios), Sam Bailey Live In The West End (Lyric Theatre). Beauty & The Beast (International Tour), Flashdance (European Tour). Various casting across London's West End & Off West End.Resident Casting Director at Ye Old Rose & Crown for Allstar Productions & Resident Casting Director for Arion Prodctions.The Page To Stage season for Aria Entertainment 2013, 2014 & 2015.Co-Producer of Divergent Productions.Post Production Sound - Andrew LayfieldWhether on location or in post production, Andrew works tirelessly through to the final mix creating sound effects and manipulating audio to ensure the highest possible quality of sound is created for every project. This has led to him working with Channel 4 and BBC television. Amongst the aways winning films where his distinctive sound treatment received notice are '2AM', 'In The Shadow Of The Mountain', 'Broadcast Signal Intrusion' and 'Sophie's Fortune'.Make Up Artist - Mita PatelMita Patel has worked in the fashion, media and film industry for the past 5 years. She has worked for the BBC Cbeebies and ITV working for Tiger Aspects production company. She has been taught by award winning media heads such as Emmy winners Neill Gorton and Davy Jones and double Oscar winner Mark Coulier. She has been a part of award winning Genesis Flux for the past three years.Composer - Adam OrridgeAdam has steadily built up a reputation as an in-demand composer and orchestrator whose work has been heard in cinemas and concert halls around the world. His work is varied, having recently written music for the world renowned Jazz at Lincoln Orchestra which received its world premiere at the Barbican, and worked on advertising campaigns for Red Bull and Radio 3. He has worked on many award winning films, many of which can be currently seen touring the festival circuit.Production Design - Lara StarkLara is currently a student at the Manchester film school, working working on numerous projects as an Art Assistant. During her time there Lara has had the fortune of working on RTS nominated films.

story:
SIKO THE MOVIE

WHO WE ARE

Hi, my name is Matthew Olivarez and I am a recent graduate of the University of Texas – Film School (Moody School of Communications). I’ve been a fan of film ever since I was a kid and I decided to pursue my passion with a degree in film making. With this in mind and with your help I am hoping to achieve my dream of making movies that people love and enjoy.  Moreover, I have teamed up with other graduates of the UT to make this dream come true. With your contribution you will not only make my dreams come true but as well as the rest of my team’s dreams. Your support is key to making this film become great.

WHAT ARE WE DOING

We are trying to raise the funds necessary to create a film festival winning short film. The short will eventually lead to a feature film and help launch our careers. We need your help! The film festival is hastily approaching and with your help, we can make it AWESOME!!

HOW MUCH WE NEED

We have invested $2500 into this movie but in order to achieve the quality that you deserve, we are trying to raise at least $5,000 to make this short award winning! Don’t be alarmed! You personally don’t have to contribute it all! If everyone just gives a little, then this amount will accumulate fast!  Even if we don't make our goal, we can assure you, based on our passion, this film IS going to be made.

THE PERKS

For your contribution you will receive some great perks! (No matter if we hit our goal of not you will receive your perks for being a contributor!)

We have established several tiers of perks for contribution levels ranging from as little as $5 to as much as $5000.

The Perks include coffee mugs, shirts, shout-outs on social media, credit for donation on our website, film credits, on-location set visits, private screenings, DVD copies, and much more.

WHY WE WILL MAKE THIS A REALITY

This project is special. I have put in the sweat equity and time to study the art of filmmaking at one of the Top Film Schools in the World. My partner has put in the time and efforts in one of the Top Business Schools in the World. We will not disappoint you! With your help we will make this a SUCCESS!

The fans of horror films have been craving a return of the slasher film and we want to bring that back. We are fans of cinema and we make this a reality, and with your help we can make it spectacular. 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

We understand that there are risks and challenges to every venture but we know that with our determination and education we as a team can overcome any obastacle. The largest hurdle we will face with this, are budget constraints and this is the key reason why we are asking for your help. We will continue this effort and others to raise the necessary funds for the film. We have put together a business plan, marketing plan and financial plan to solve all of the challenges we will face. We will also pivot when necessary to make sure we accomplish our goals.

IF YOU CAN'T CONTRIBUE

If for some reason you can’t contribute right now we completely understand; but, you can still help us reach this goal. Do us a favor and get the word out about the campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools! Use your social networks! Join the street team @ sikomovie.com! Let us know and we will give you credit as an official Siko!

story:
When you help me in Japanese, please look at the Motion Gallery website.
日本語での支援をご希望の方は、以下のリンクから応援をお願い致します。
MotionGallery web site

 

STORY

This is another “Peach boy” which is a children’s story from Japanese folklore.

Prince “Kibitsuhiko” has a distinctive power as demigod. For this power,  He is neglected in the Imperial Court.

Princess “Momoso” is a shrine maiden with mystical power, who is concerned about him.

The prince aged fifteen is tasked to defeat deamons which was led by a terrifying ogre named "Ura", and therefore set out for the country named "Kibi".

 

WHY WE NEED HELP

We challenge to realize visual expression in which the theme is japanese myth and Butoh. We started this project a half year ago. However, our budget is insufficient  to make large-scale work like an ancient story because of self produced work. Presently, operations are suspended.

At first, for the next Film shooting in August, we need $18,000.  We'll distribute the budget as follows.

・procurement equipments  --  $3,000

・transportation/lodging expense  --  $3,000

・art/costume/makeup  --  $1,500

・location scouting  --  $2,500

・publicity expenses  --  $2,000

・casts and staff's fee  --  $6,000

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

This project aims at being completed by the next spring. However, we are independent and supported by many volunteer staff. When budgets are not enough, the completion of the work may be late.

However, when we can raise a fund, and the work is completed, we will exhibit this work for a film festival and the media of many countries. We are all convinced that we can send Japan's own myth, art and Butoh for the world.

 

 

 

 

OUR TEAM

Hitomi Higuchi / Director

Videographer and  poet, graduated from Nihon University College of Art.Her accomplishments include videos that recreate a feel of classic Japanese literature with modern visuals and sound. She is traditional japanese poet, in traditional japanese poet group “Mirai Tanka-kai” , which  Okai Takashi organized, He is waka-goyogagari (which is a general affairs official of ministry of  the japanese traditional poet from Japanese Imperial Household)   

She works as music Unit in “KUSURIBUNE”, with Tomoya yamazaki(composer) in Kyoto.

 

Ayuko / Prince KIbitsu-hiko,  Princess Momoso

Actress and dancer and painter, graduated from Shioya Syun`s acter`s clinic.  And She played Giulietta,“Romeo e Giulietta” which directed by Shioya Syunn . She joined in the European tour of the SOMA project, organized by former dancers from the theater company “Wuppertaler Bühnen” which appeared. She had solo exhibition “Ayu Watanabe”in Toyoko in Moto-azabu gallery.

 

Akihito Ichihara / Ura

He is a dancer and a core member of the theater company Sankai-Juku, which has received the Laurence Olivier Awardand and has performed in more than 700 cities in the world. Sankai-Juku has been commissioned for productions for more than 30 years by Theater de la Villa, in Paris, touted as a real international achievement in the field of contemporary dance. Ichihara has played in the Sankai-Juku productions since late 90s.

 

Location Hunting(Chiba ,in Japan)

story:
The Story

"Faded" follows the 28-year-old Jenna, who is happily married to her husband and best friend, Ryan. Her life comes crumbling down when Ryan gets into a car accident, causing him to lose his long term memory, which tragically, includes Jenna.  

With Ryan recuperating at home, Jenna desperately and unsuccessfully tries to reconnect with him. She bravely faces rejection each day, but she is relentless in her attempts to help Ryan recover his health and his memory.

Jenna’s commitment to Ryan’s recovery and her marriage begins to fray. Finally, however, her efforts and time may be proving productive as Ryan shows glimmers of his old self.

 

Director's Statement 

I have always been fascinated by the concept of loss. When we think of the word "loss," our minds jump to the idea of losing something, or someone, that we love permanently. But what happens if one day, we have to lose someone even though they’re very much alive and standing right in front of us?

It comes down to the question of whether we want to continue fighting for what we had, and if we do fight, how many cold responses and rejections can we take before we surrender to our new reality of living with the person who no longer wants us, and just hope to god that things will work themselves out one day.

For the past 7 years, my father has been suffering a form of depression, and he'd have moments when he didn't remember me, brief instances when he simply lost his memories, and those moments have left a lasting impact on how I feel about loss. Losing someone is never easy, but it's a different tragedy when the person you've lost is sitting in front of you. 

Exploring this unique form of loss, I’ve finally decided to tell this story. Because as a filmmaker, I think there’s something very brave in being able to grieve, then moving on to share that very pain you’ve felt, opening yourself up to strangers in the hope that your story will allow them a chance to live more fully through your pain or to hopefully discover new meanings from what you’ve shared.

[http://kingcreative.tumblr.com/post/36786954875]

Thank you so much for taking your time to visit our page. I invite you to learn more about our project and how you can be a part of bringing this story to life, so please stick around!

 

Why We Need Your Help

It not only takes a village to make a film, but also a lot of money. Your contributions will go directly to paying our actors, our assistant director, sound designer, sound mixer, hair and makeup artists, music composer, costumes, props, food for our cast and crew, lodging for the cast, transportation, insurance, truck rentals, only to name a few. In order for this film to come to life, all of these need to be paid for. This is where we need your help.

Your contributions will not go unnoticed! Your names will be in the film's end credits as our backers, and please check out the perks and items we've prepared for our donators, listed on the right of the page.

 

The Team

Pongkarnda "Kik" Udomprasert

Writer/Director

Kik is born a storyteller who's extremely receptive to people's emotions. As a person, she loves making people happy. Her films, ironically, demand the opposite. With her biggest fears being loss and regret, her stories often toy with these negative concepts while leaving the screen with positive messages.

After graduating with a Bachelor’s Degree in TV Production, Kik remained in Thailand for 4 years, working in the production support on many international films and series including Nicolas Winding Refn’s Only God Forgives and the British series, Strike Back: Legacy. In pursuit of her dream, she came to Chapman University in 2015 to study directing and will graduate with a Master's degree in 2018.

Siyue "April" Wang

Producer

As a filmmaker, April applies her extensive experience in communication and journalism to her work, crafting films with a certain delicacy of the world and its characters. She is proficient in the Chinese, American, and Japanese film industries. After studying at Doshisha University, Japan, she moved to the United States to study producing for film and television at Chapman University and has worked on over 10 projects during the first year of her graduate program. The diverse background helps her to better understand the different genres of film and types of audiences.

Sunan "Sue" Lin

Producer

Sue is a young producer who has strong background in filmmaking. She graduated from Peking University, where she was the president of film association for almost two years, having built strong relationships with many film critics in China, then came to Chapman University for a Master’s Degree in Film Producing. During the six-year film studying, she directed three short films and produced over ten successful student films, one of which won Best Student Film in the Peking University Student Academy Award.

She also spent a year working in film marketing and distribution for several American independent films, which makes her a strong and competitive producer in both the Chinese and American industries.

Rodney Clifton

Director of Photography

Rodney is a rising filmmaker possessing a sensitive eye for the beauty of the world around him, and the skill to capture moments as they swiftly pass. Born in Mobile, Alabama, Rodney has a deeply rooted love for his family and a genuine respect for all mankind. He prides himself on his integrity and aims to leave a positive impact on every life that he encounters.         

After graduating from Alabama A&M University, a year later, Rodney was admitted into Chapman University. At Chapman, he is studying the art of cinematography. On his continued pursuit in filmmaking, Rodney plans to stay strong in his faith as he recognizes his journey will be faced with many obstacles.

Min Jeong Chai

Production Designer

For as long as she can remember, Min Jeong wanted to create the story worlds, to become a production designer. She started taking basic design classes in high school and went on to develop her skills further at HongIk University, the most famous art school in South Korea, during which time she had designed over 6 art films and worked on two Korean feature films as an Art Department Assistant.

Min Jeong is currently pursuing a Master of Fine Arts degree in Production Design at Chapman University

Xiaodan "Ariel" Hao

Production Designer

Ariel has an extensive background in Film and Media Arts, having been studying it for over 10 years. She graduated from the Central Academy of Fine Arts, which is the best art school in China. As a storyteller, her passion lies in Production Design. While in China, she had worked on three commercial sets as an Art Department Assistant, and on a feature film as a Production Assistant.

Ariel is currently pursuing a Master’s Degree in Production Design at Chapman University.

Ya-Chun Chan

Editor

Ya-Chun has a wide-ranging knowledge on film and video procedures from inception to completion. Her goal as a storyteller is to remind people to consider the details that they often overlook in their lives.

After graduating with a Bachelor's Degree in Information Management in Taiwan, Ya-Chun spent 2 years in Korea experiencing a new culture. Traveling has made her observant of every moment in life. Chasing after her dream, she came to Chapman University to study Film Editing and has completed 7 short films within 2 years. She also worked as an Assistant Editor for the documentary, “All Hearts and Minds," a film about the democratization of Taiwan.

Fredrick Marcus Craig Jr.

Sound Designer

Fresco has a very unique style of sound design that has been embedded in him through life experiences thus translating through the passion that he puts into his work. Every sound wave tells a story and with this understanding, he cares to connect with the audience for an overall epic experience.

Originally from New London, CT, Fresco served in The Unites States Army in the 82nd Airborne Division for three and a half years before moving to Los Angeles, CA to make his mark as a sound designer. After graduating from The Los Angeles Film School with an Associates of Science in Recording Arts (CL), he instantly began rising as a successful audio engineer in television, music, and podcasts. He is currently enrolled back in The Los Angeles Film School studying for a Bachelor's of Science in Entertainment Business with plans to graduate next year. As a man of God and a father, his values, vibes, and integrity are all positive in everything that he's a part of.

Jesi Nelson

Composer

Jesi is a Los Angeles based composer for Film & TV. She received her BFA in Music Composition and Technology from the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee and Master of Fine Arts in Music Composition for the Screen at Columbia College. Upon her move to LA, she interned for Danny Elfman at Studio Della Morte, and soon after started assisting composer Michael Kramer, writing additional music for the Emmy nominated Disney/LucasFilm Lego Star Wars: The Freemaker Adventures and Ninjago: The Legend of Spinjitzu, under his lead.

Most recently, she was selected as one of 6 composers to participate in the highly competitive Sundance Institute Music and Sound Design Labs at Skywalker Sound.

 

Please help us spread the word!

I have always been fascinated by the concept of loss. When we think of the word "loss," our minds jump to the idea of losing something, or someone, that we love permanently. But what happens if one day, we have to lose someone even though they’re very much alive and standing right in front of us?
It comes down to the question of whether we want to continue fighting for what we had, and if we do fight, how many cold responses and rejections can we take before we surrender to our new reality of living with the person who no longer wants us, and just hope to god that things will work themselves out one day.
For the past 7 years, my father has been suffering a form of depression, and he'd have moments when he didn't remember me, brief instances when he simply lost his memories, and those moments have left a lasting impact on how I feel about loss. Losing someone is never easy, but it's a different tragedy when the person you've lost is sitting in front of you. 
Exploring this unique form of loss, I’ve finally decided to tell this story. Because as a filmmaker, I think there’s something very brave in being able to grieve, then moving on to share that very pain you’ve felt, opening yourself up to strangers in the hope that your story will allow them a chance to live more fully through your pain or to hopefully discover new meanings from what you’ve shared.

[http://kingcreative.tumblr.com/post/36786954875]
Thank you so much for taking your time to visit our page. I invite you to learn more about our project and how you can be a part of bringing this story to life, so please stick around!
 
Why We Need Your Help
It not only takes a village to make a film, but also a lot of money. Your contributions will go directly to paying our actors, our assistant director, sound designer, sound mixer, hair and makeup artists, music composer, costumes, props, food for our cast and crew, lodging for the cast, transportation, insurance, truck rentals, only to name a few. In order for this film to come to life, all of these need to be paid for. This is where we need your help.

Your contributions will not go unnoticed! Your names will be in the film's end credits as our backers, and please check out the perks and items we've prepared for our donators, listed on the right of the page.
 

The Team
Pongkarnda "Kik" Udomprasert
Writer/Director

Kik is born a storyteller who's extremely receptive to people's emotions. As a person, she loves making people happy. Her films, ironically, demand the opposite. With her biggest fears being loss and regret, her stories often toy with these negative concepts while leaving the screen with positive messages.
After graduating with a Bachelor’s Degree in TV Production, Kik remained in Thailand for 4 years, working in the production support on many international films and series including Nicolas Winding Refn’s Only God Forgives and the British series, Strike Back: Legacy. In pursuit of her dream, she came to Chapman University in 2015 to study directing and will graduate with a Master's degree in 2018.
Siyue "April" Wang
Producer

As a filmmaker, April applies her extensive experience in communication and journalism to her work, crafting films with a certain delicacy of the world and its characters. She is proficient in the Chinese, American, and Japanese film industries. After studying at Doshisha University, Japan, she moved to the United States to study producing for film and television at Chapman University and has worked on over 10 projects during the first year of her graduate program. The diverse background helps her to better understand the different genres of film and types of audiences.
Sunan "Sue" Lin
Producer

Sue is a young producer who has strong background in filmmaking. She graduated from Peking University, where she was the president of film association for almost two years, having built strong relationships with many film critics in China, then came to Chapman University for a Master’s Degree in Film Producing. During the six-year film studying, she directed three short films and produced over ten successful student films, one of which won Best Student Film in the Peking University Student Academy Award.
She also spent a year working in film marketing and distribution for several American independent films, which makes her a strong and competitive producer in both the Chinese and American industries.
Rodney Clifton
Director of Photography

Rodney is a rising filmmaker possessing a sensitive eye for the beauty of the world around him, and the skill to capture moments as they swiftly pass. Born in Mobile, Alabama, Rodney has a deeply rooted love for his family and a genuine respect for all mankind. He prides himself on his integrity and aims to leave a positive impact on every life that he encounters.         
After graduating from Alabama A&M University, a year later, Rodney was admitted into Chapman University. At Chapman, he is studying the art of cinematography. On his continued pursuit in filmmaking, Rodney plans to stay strong in his faith as he recognizes his journey will be faced with many obstacles.
Min Jeong Chai
Production Designer

For as long as she can remember, Min Jeong wanted to create the story worlds, to become a production designer. She started taking basic design classes in high school and went on to develop her skills further at HongIk University, the most famous art school in South Korea, during which time she had designed over 6 art films and worked on two Korean feature films as an Art Department Assistant.
Min Jeong is currently pursuing a Master of Fine Arts degree in Production Design at Chapman University
Xiaodan "Ariel" Hao
Production Designer

Ariel has an extensive background in Film and Media Arts, having been studying it for over 10 years. She graduated from the Central Academy of Fine Arts, which is the best art school in China. As a storyteller, her passion lies in Production Design. While in China, she had worked on three commercial sets as an Art Department Assistant, and on a feature film as a Production Assistant.
Ariel is currently pursuing a Master’s Degree in Production Design at Chapman University.
Ya-Chun Chan
Editor

Ya-Chun has a wide-ranging knowledge on film and video procedures from inception to completion. Her goal as a storyteller is to remind people to consider the details that they often overlook in their lives.
After graduating with a Bachelor's Degree in Information Management in Taiwan, Ya-Chun spent 2 years in Korea experiencing a new culture. Traveling has made her observant of every moment in life. Chasing after her dream, she came to Chapman University to study Film Editing and has completed 7 short films within 2 years. She also worked as an Assistant Editor for the documentary, “All Hearts and Minds," a film about the democratization of Taiwan.
Fredrick Marcus Craig Jr.
Sound Designer

Fresco has a very unique style of sound design that has been embedded in him through life experiences thus translating through the passion that he puts into his work. Every sound wave tells a story and with this understanding, he cares to connect with the audience for an overall epic experience.
Originally from New London, CT, Fresco served in The Unites States Army in the 82nd Airborne Division for three and a half years before moving to Los Angeles, CA to make his mark as a sound designer. After graduating from The Los Angeles Film School with an Associates of Science in Recording Arts (CL), he instantly began rising as a successful audio engineer in television, music, and podcasts. He is currently enrolled back in The Los Angeles Film School studying for a Bachelor's of Science in Entertainment Business with plans to graduate next year. As a man of God and a father, his values, vibes, and integrity are all positive in everything that he's a part of.
Jesi Nelson
Composer

Jesi is a Los Angeles based composer for Film & TV. She received her BFA in Music Composition and Technology from the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee and Master of Fine Arts in Music Composition for the Screen at Columbia College. Upon her move to LA, she interned for Danny Elfman at Studio Della Morte, and soon after started assisting composer Michael Kramer, writing additional music for the Emmy nominated Disney/LucasFilm Lego Star Wars: The Freemaker Adventures and Ninjago: The Legend of Spinjitzu, under his lead.
Most recently, she was selected as one of 6 composers to participate in the highly competitive Sundance Institute Music and Sound Design Labs at Skywalker Sound.
 

Please help us spread the word!

story:
The Black Genocide Documentary

The Black Genocide encompasses the narratives of racial minorities in both the United States and Brazil and its residuals: its negative impact on the communities and its psychological effects on the black women who experience these atrocities.

Other human right violations highlighted in the documentary are systemic violence, mass incarceration, violence against children, violence against women, religious persecution (Candomble and Umbanda), torture, disappearances, and murder. 

Our Goal

The goal of this documentary is to raise awareness within the global community and to build international solidarity between racial minorities in both the United States and Brazil. This is a very critical time in our history. We have protested within our domestic enclaves opposing these injustices. We must try something 'new'. Let's face it, we need each other! Now is the time to come together and create something 'amazing.' It's time to love one another, so let's do this! 

Our Team:

Ariel Whitaker: International law/Human Rights researcher and executive producer.

Estefany Herrera:  Transnational Security/Human Rights researcher and creative producer

Sophia Guida:  Independent Human Rights Photo Journalist and Consultant

Matteo Banfo: Independent Filmmaker: The United Nations. 

Website: https://vimeo.com/matteobanfo

Dominic Miller: Independent Filmmaker: Humans of New York. 

Website: https://vimeo.com/dominicmiller

Project Expenses:

International Air Travel for 5 people:  $9,400.00

Domestic Air Travel for 3 people to 5 different locations for 3 days each:  

$4,000.00

Domestic Hotel Accommodation for 3 people 5 different locations, 3 days each location: $2,500.00

International Hotel Accommodations for 3wks in 3 different Brazilian cities for 5 people: $18,000.00

Movement Artist (US) and Capoeira Dance Performers (Brazil): $8,500.00

Transportation Inside of Brazil in 3 different cities for 3 weeks: $8,000.00

Transportation to and from location of interview in Brazil (survivors only) for 3 weeks: $1,500.00

Fixer Rates (for a 3 week period): $4,200.00

Meals: $3,500.00

Production Cost:

Audio-Mixing: $11,000

Color Correction: $8,000.00

Music Licensing: $3,000.00

Editing (for 6 months of work - not including cost of equipment or of an assistant): $60,000

Film Production Team (the director's fees): $9,000.00 (300 per day)

Other Miscellaneous Cost: $5,000.00

 TOTAL: $156,600

Additional Costs: 

Incentives, rewards, and shipping costs (15% of documentary costs): $23,490

Indiegogo fees: $7,800

Processing fees: $4,698

Minimum Goal: $156,600

Medium Goal: $250,000

Maximum Goal: $350,000

GRAND TOTAL: $192,588

Our present goal of $156,600 will cover this documentary (on the lower end). Nevertheless, we want this film to be not only factually comprehensive, but also visually and aesthetically compelling. In order to achieve this goal; raising global awareness for social change, we have to produce a piece that is masterful. This way it will circulate and people will have the opportunity to view the documentary and form their own opinions about the human rights violations that continue to plague our communities.

EVERY 23 MINUTES AN AFRO BRAZILIAN YOUTH IS KILLED

This is Mochon High School in Rio de Janeiro. These are smart, talented, and good kids; however, because of who they are (poor black youths), they are likely to become part of the statistic and 3.7x more likely to die at the hands of state agents. 

Anything from $5 to $10,000. Every little bit helps and we are sincerely grateful.

To increase our changes for success, we have created several fundraising account on other crowdfunding sites with equal or smaller amounts. 

Please, Help Us End the Black Genocide - and Donate Now!

story:
PROMISES TO BE EVEN MORE INTENSE THAN THE FIRST ONE!!

Episode 2 "Paladin" takes place just months after the first episode.  We pickup with 2 rival gangs in a seedy area of Gotham, who are clearly up to no good. Fortunately, they are thwarted by our favorite anti-hero, and the action commences. 

FILLED WITH UNEXPECTED SURPRISES.....UNEXPECTED CAST MEMBERS...UNEXPECTED TWISTS

BUT FIRST WE NEED TO RAISE FUNDS TO COVER THE BASIC COSTS OF:

  • Film equipment 
  • Costumes and Props
  • Shooting location 
  • Artwork & art direction 
  • Post-production 
  • Craft services 


EVEN SMALL DONATIONS ARE A HELP.....

And we have kick ass incentives.....associate producer credits, extra roles (experience what it's like to be set possibly as a gang member or other role), posters, stickers and even the RED HOOD costume is up for grabs.

IF YOU SAW THE FIRST EPISODE YOU KNOW THE QUALITY OF THE FILMING BY DIRECTOR WAYNE TEN.

 

 

AND MORE FROM ACTOR/STUNT COORDINATOR TIMMY PARISH AS RED HOOD
