story:
My name is Kathryn King and I'm a music industry veteran dealing in many different genres of music. My love of jazz blossomed when I was just a wee tad, the daughter of a great singer, Jeri Southern, and step-daughter of a great player/composer/arranger, Bill Holman. In 1998 I did a compilation of some of my mom's best recordings, as a tribute to her. My impulse to do a film about Bill Holman derives first from the immense respect and love I have for him but, equally important, the fact that a comprehensive profile of this superb artist - an NEA Jazz Master - does not currently exist. The fact that he is still charging full speed ahead at age 90 and that his band is smokin' hot after 42 years of playing, touring and recording means that my expert cinematographer Gil Gilbert and I have had the benefit of hours of primary source voices, perspectives, and performances as we have worked on this project for the last 4 years. We are far from finished - there is still some shooting to do, plus editing and a daunting mountain of music licensing ahead - but we really need help in order to continue, let alone complete the film. I hope you'll join us in making Charting Jazz happen! Bill Holman is one of a kind, a great American artist, and I want the world to know about him. Check out the video for Charting Jazz!

The Filmmakers

Videographer: Gil Gilbert

Gil Gilbert is a videographer who has for decades produced EPKs and other creative, tailored pieces for branding and promotion. For 15 years he worked for Sony Music, creating promotional videos for such artists as Billy Joel, Titanic (the film), Wynton Marsalis, The Pixies, Yo-Yo Ma, and Roger Waters. Recent clients include the Metropolitan Opera, the Olana Foundation and Ippolita Jewelry. In recent years he has branched out to longform documentaries, the most recent of which, Misfire: the Rise and Fall of the Shooting Gallery, was invited to show at multiple film festivals upon its release in 2013.

Producer/Director: Kathryn King

Kathryn King, producer/director of the film and stepdaughter of Bill Holman, has spent her entire 45-year career in the music industry. Over the course of this time she has concentrated on two main areas of endeavor - publicity/marketing and audio/video production. Her eclectic tastes inspired her to devote her energies to a wide variety of musical genres as, among other things, Director of U.S. Operations for both ECM Records and Teldec, Director of the Classical Division of ABC Records, Director of Product Management at Sony Classical, and as independent record producer and media consultant. Over the last 20 years she has produced promotional videos on such artists as Esa-Pekka Salonen, the Los Angeles Guitar Quartet, Ottmar Liebert, Midori, and others. Her recordings have been nominated for Grammy Awards three times and in 1986 she won the Grammy for Best Children's Recording for her production of one of 35 records made for Sesame Street. A veteran of many years of publicizing and marketing artists and their recordings, King has enjoyed working with the Vienna Boys Choir, Midori, Art Ensemble of Chicago, Susan Narucki, Donald Berman,Thomas Hampson, Keith Jarrett, Other Minds, Netherlands Bach Society, Iannis Xenakis’ Persepolis L.A., Midori, Zuill Bailey, Frans Brüggen, Denis Matsuev, the San Lucas Band, Arvo Pärt, Emanuel Ax, James Morris, St. Petersburg Philharmonic Orchestra, Paul Moravec, Nikolaus Harnoncourt, LAGQ, Heiner Goebbels, Elena Ruehr, the Juilliard String Quartet, Ottmar Liebert, Jane Eaglen, the Hilliard Ensemble, Bill Frisell, Esa-Pekka Salonen, Daniel Lentz, the Del Sol String Quartet, Yefim Bronfman, the Kuijken Brothers, David Torn, the Eclectic Orange Festival, John Abercrombie and many others.

The Campaign

About this project

Charting Jazz: The Mastery of Bill Holman will tell the story of one of America’s most exceptional musicians, jazz arranger/composer Bill Holman. Revered and beloved by players, critics and scholars of the genre, Holman is nevertheless not well known to the general public. It’s not an exaggeration to say that millions have heard his charts (arrangements) for such artists as Natalie Cole, Count Basie, Michael Bublé, Stan Kenton, the Fifth Dimension, Tony Bennett, Carmen McRae, Lee Konitz, Gerry Mulligan, and countless others, but even dedicated music lovers often don’t understand what the role of an arranger is and why it is important. This film will explain the pivotal role of arrangers in every recording we hear and why this man is considered a consummate master of the art.

Charting Jazz will show Bill Holman in action, conducting a residency at the prestigious Eastman School of Music, rehearsing his own ensemble, the 16-piece Bill Holman Band, and in performance at a supper club in Los Angeles playing the entire contents of the Band’s Brilliant Corners CD, an album of Monk tunes that has taken on iconic status since its original release. Bill Holman won a Grammy for one of the arrangements on the album, for Monk’s “Straight, No Chaser”. In the words of Doug Ramsey, who interviews Holman in the film and writes the essential jazz blog Rifftides:

“Allowed to drop out of sight, never reissued, Holman’s Monk CD recorded in 1997 is one of the large-ensemble masterpieces of the second half of the twentieth century. Nor has there been anything that I know of to match it in the new millennium.”

Charting Jazz will interview Bill Holman’s composing and arranging colleagues, musicians in his band, young players coming up, producers, writers, educators and fans who count Bill Holman among the greatest exponents of America’s artform, JAZZ.

Can’t contribute financially but still want to help out?

We’d LOVE to hear from anyone who has memories, anecdotes, or questions that they’d like to share about Bill or his music. Please post them here in the comment section, or on the social media of your choice and include a link to this Indiegogo campaign.

 

About Bill Holman

NEA Jazz Master Bill Holman (b.1927 in Olive, CA) has been sought after since the earliest years of his career by band leaders, instrumental soloists, and singers alike for his skills as arranger. His unique style utilizes often complex contrapuntal textures juxtaposed with spare, elegant lines which form the perfect framework for a soloist. Holman has provided arrangements for many stellar artists including Charlie Barnet, Count Basie, Louie Bellson, Tony Bennett, Bob Brookmeyer, Michael Bublé, June Christy, Natalie Cole, Buddy de Franco, Maynard Ferguson, The Fifth Dimension, Terry Gibbs, Woody Herman, Lee Konitz, Peggy Lee, Mel Lewis, Carmen McRae, Gerry Mulligan, Mark Murphy, Anita O’Day, Art Pepper, Buddy Rich, Diane Schuur, Doc Severinson, Zoot Sims, Mel Tormé, Sarah Vaughan, Joe Williams, Phil Woods, and many recently completed commissions.

For decades Holman has enjoyed teaching at composing/arranging clinics and master classes throughout both the U.S. and Europe. In the U.S., he has taught at the Berklee, Eastman, Manhattan, and Grove Schools of Music, and at many universities. Outside the U.S., in such countries as Germany, Holland, Switzerland, England and in Scandinavia, he is frequently invited to conduct established resident jazz orchestras at radio stations and festivals, in addition to educational clinics and workshops.

Mr. Holman formed the 16-piece Bill Holman Big Band in 1975. The ensemble continues to perform in clubs, concerts and festivals. Holman, whose roots as tenor saxophonist, composer and writer extend as far back as 1949 in ensembles with such artists as Ike Carpenter, Stan Kenton, Charlie Barnet, Shelly Manne, Shorty Rogers and Mel Lewis, is perhaps most revered today for ushering the genre of big band music into the 21st century. In his hands the language of the big band has continually evolved, so that the arrangements he writes today sound utterly fresh and of-the-moment. The combination of his innovative, virtuosic, often whimsical writing with the mighty power of his band, which has been rehearsing and performing together for over 40 years, is an experience his audiences don’t soon forget. He has been nominated for the Grammy Award fifteen times, most recently in 2013 for his instrumental composition Without a Paddle. He has won three Grammys - in 1987 for Best Instrumental Arrangement (Take the A Train, for Doc Severinsen and the Tonight Show Orchestra); in 1995 for Best Instrumental Composition (A View from the Side for the Bill Holman Band); and in 1997 for a stunning arrangement of Thelonious Monk’s Straight, No Chaser, also recorded by the Bill Holman Band on their album Brilliant Corners.

The National Endowment for the Arts

bestowed the nation’s highest honor in jazz, the 2010 NEA Jazz Masters Award, on Bill Holman “in recognition of a lifetime of extraordinary achievement as composer, arranger and tenor saxophonist.” 

Partial List of Career Honors

Fifteen Grammy nominations; Grammy Award: Best Instrumental Arrangement, 1997 (Straight, No Chaser / Bill Holman Band); Grammy Award: Best Instrumental Composition, 1995 (A View From the Side / Bill Holman Band); Grammy Award: Best Instrumental Arrangement, 1987 (Take the A Train / Doc Severinsen and the Tonight Show Orchestra); Jazz Journalists Association: Arranger of the Year, 2011; National Endowment for the Arts: Jazz Masters Award, 2010; ASCAP: Jazz Living Legend Award, inscribed into Wall of Fame at Jazz at Lincoln Center, 2008; American Society of Music Arrangers & Composers: Golden Score Award, 2008; Rutgers Institute of Jazz Studies & the New Jersey Jazz Society: inducted into the American Jazz Hall of Fame, 2006; Downbeat Readers Poll: Arranger of the Year in 1998, 1999, 2003; Downbeat Magazine Critics Poll: Arranger of the Year in 1998, 1999, 2000; Jazz Times Readers Poll: Best Arranger in 1990, 1994, 1997, 1998; Elmhurst College: Honorary Doctorate, 2009

Revered and beloved by players, critics and scholars of the genre, Holman is nevertheless not well known to the general public. It’s not an exaggeration to say that millions have heard his charts (arrangements) for such artists as Natalie Cole, Count Basie, Michael Bublé, Stan Kenton, the Fifth Dimension, Tony Bennett, Carmen McRae, Lee Konitz, Gerry Mulligan, and countless others, but even dedicated music lovers often don’t understand what the role of an arranger is and why it is important. This film will explain the pivotal role of arrangers in every recording we hear and why this man is considered a consummate master of the art.
Charting Jazz will show Bill Holman in action, conducting a residency at the prestigious Eastman School of Music, rehearsing his own ensemble, the 16-piece Bill Holman Band, and in performance at a supper club in Los Angeles playing the entire contents of the Band’s Brilliant Corners CD, an album of Monk tunes that has taken on iconic status since its original release. Bill Holman won a Grammy for one of the arrangements on the album, for Monk’s “Straight, No Chaser”. In the words of Doug Ramsey, who interviews Holman in the film and writes the essential jazz blog Rifftides:
“Allowed to drop out of sight, never reissued, Holman’s Monk CD recorded in 1997 is one of the large-ensemble masterpieces of the second half of the twentieth century. Nor has there been anything that I know of to match it in the new millennium.”
Charting Jazz will interview Bill Holman’s composing and arranging colleagues, musicians in his band, young players coming up, producers, writers, educators and fans who count Bill Holman among the greatest exponents of America’s artform, JAZZ.
Can’t contribute financially but still want to help out?
We’d LOVE to hear from anyone who has memories, anecdotes, or questions that they’d like to share about Bill or his music. Please post them here in the comment section, or on the social media of your choice and include a link to this Indiegogo campaign. About Bill Holman
NEA Jazz Master Bill Holman (b.1927 in Olive, CA) has been sought after since the earliest years of his career by band leaders, instrumental soloists, and singers alike for his skills as arranger. His unique style utilizes often complex contrapuntal textures juxtaposed with spare, elegant lines which form the perfect framework for a soloist. Holman has provided arrangements for many stellar artists including Charlie Barnet, Count Basie, Louie Bellson, Tony Bennett, Bob Brookmeyer, Michael Bublé, June Christy, Natalie Cole, Buddy de Franco, Maynard Ferguson, The Fifth Dimension, Terry Gibbs, Woody Herman, Lee Konitz, Peggy Lee, Mel Lewis, Carmen McRae, Gerry Mulligan, Mark Murphy, Anita O’Day, Art Pepper, Buddy Rich, Diane Schuur, Doc Severinson, Zoot Sims, Mel Tormé, Sarah Vaughan, Joe Williams, Phil Woods, and many recently completed commissions.
For decades Holman has enjoyed teaching at composing/arranging clinics and master classes throughout both the U.S. and Europe. In the U.S., he has taught at the Berklee, Eastman, Manhattan, and Grove Schools of Music, and at many universities. Outside the U.S., in such countries as Germany, Holland, Switzerland, England and in Scandinavia, he is frequently invited to conduct established resident jazz orchestras at radio stations and festivals, in addition to educational clinics and workshops.
Mr. Holman formed the 16-piece Bill Holman Big Band in 1975. The ensemble continues to perform in clubs, concerts and festivals. Holman, whose roots as tenor saxophonist, composer and writer extend as far back as 1949 in ensembles with such artists as Ike Carpenter, Stan Kenton, Charlie Barnet, Shelly Manne, Shorty Rogers and Mel Lewis, is perhaps most revered today for ushering the genre of big band music into the 21st century. In his hands the language of the big band has continually evolved, so that the arrangements he writes today sound utterly fresh and of-the-moment. The combination of his innovative, virtuosic, often whimsical writing with the mighty power of his band, which has been rehearsing and performing together for over 40 years, is an experience his audiences don’t soon forget. He has been nominated for the Grammy Award fifteen times, most recently in 2013 for his instrumental composition Without a Paddle. He has won three Grammys - in 1987 for Best Instrumental Arrangement (Take the A Train, for Doc Severinsen and the Tonight Show Orchestra); in 1995 for Best Instrumental Composition (A View from the Side for the Bill Holman Band); and in 1997 for a stunning arrangement of Thelonious Monk’s Straight, No Chaser, also recorded by the Bill Holman Band on their album Brilliant Corners.
The National Endowment for the Arts
bestowed the nation’s highest honor in jazz, the 2010 NEA Jazz Masters Award, on Bill Holman “in recognition of a lifetime of extraordinary achievement as composer, arranger and tenor saxophonist.” 
Partial List of Career Honors
Fifteen Grammy nominations; Grammy Award: Best Instrumental Arrangement, 1997 (Straight, No Chaser / Bill Holman Band); Grammy Award: Best Instrumental Composition, 1995 (A View From the Side / Bill Holman Band); Grammy Award: Best Instrumental Arrangement, 1987 (Take the A Train / Doc Severinsen and the Tonight Show Orchestra); Jazz Journalists Association: Arranger of the Year, 2011; National Endowment for the Arts: Jazz Masters Award, 2010; ASCAP: Jazz Living Legend Award, inscribed into Wall of Fame at Jazz at Lincoln Center, 2008; American Society of Music Arrangers & Composers: Golden Score Award, 2008; Rutgers Institute of Jazz Studies & the New Jersey Jazz Society: inducted into the American Jazz Hall of Fame, 2006; Downbeat Readers Poll: Arranger of the Year in 1998, 1999, 2003; Downbeat Magazine Critics Poll: Arranger of the Year in 1998, 1999, 2000; Jazz Times Readers Poll: Best Arranger in 1990, 1994, 1997, 1998; Elmhurst College: Honorary Doctorate, 2009

story:
Who am I? Who are we?

I am a debuting filmmaker with an international background, which is reflected in the film. I am Danish by birth, Belgian by education, Ukrainian by passion. 

I graduated from film school in Belgium in 2008, and have spend the time since then working on different short films, feature films, art films. (Check out my LinkedIn on https://www.linkedin.com/in/helene-wang-b6a8391... a full resume or my youtube channel helenewangfilm for my independent short films)

The feature film that we are aiming to make is about a young woman, Mia, who lives separate lives with different partner, lying to them both but loving them both intensely. Telling her lovers that she works abroad, the reality is different, she works in a high end strip club in Brussels, where she gets the approval and admiration that she desperately needs. When a sardonic man enters her life and starts messing around, things turn ugly, and it becomes increasingly difficult for her to keep the balance.

My personal story has a huge impact on the movie. It is not autobiographical, but the emotions and a lot of the struggles of the main character, Mia, are real and mine. Every step I take the last year has been towards this project. With the trailer, I want to show the beauty and the struggle which is inside my mind. Without it, we will only have words to describe the project - and they will not nearly cover what we have in mind!

The film will be a co-production between Belgium and Ukraine, and possibly other countries like Denmark, UK or Germany. I am working with independent Ukrainian production company UFI (Ukrainian Film Institute Production). UFI is looking for sponsors for the film, but most investors want to have an idea of the project. 
At the same time, we are looking for a Belgian producer to take on the main part of the production. But we need your help to finish off the teaser for them to see. 

We have already shot the main part of the teaser. We need to do some additional shooting and sound recording, and to edit and mix the teaser. We have shot it on the BlackMagicMini (the clip above is from behind the scenes, shot with a lose hand using a Canon5D).

An honest deal

We are looking for money to pay for rental of editing equipment, editor's fee and mixing. 
After finishing, we need to burn the teaser to DVDs etc to get it to the investors.

If we reach our goal, we will spend some of the money on promotional material to go along with the teaser. Posters, flyers, business cards, prints etc. If we only manage to get a part of the total sum, we will focus on the teaser.

We are keeping all costs as low as possible, but we can't compromise the visual quality we need. We want to work with young and upcoming professionals and pay them appropriately. You will contribute to an honest way of working, where people are being paid for their skills.

Why I want to make the film at all?

The idea of the project has grown for a few years. At the moment, the script is finished. It is hard, visual, sensual, and dealing with the profound self perception that we all struggle with - women in particular. The main character of the film, Mia, feeds on the approval and admiration of others, escaping immediately when she risks to fail. She is hungry for love, but fails to find it in its pure form. 
When I tell the story to women, I very often notice a pain in their eyes towards the end. In the beginning, they are all in love with the story, which is catchy and intriguing. But when we start digging into matters, they feel that it is about them, that it strikes one of the most vulnerable parts of their self-esteem, something they struggle with but try to hide behind a facade of happiness. Just like Mia, in the film. With my film, I want to reach out to all these women, and to the men who know them

Almost there

We are close to our goal. We have invested time and money so far, and we are building a team based on mutual trust and enthusiasm. A lot of people in Ukraine, Belgium, UK are working in their free time to get our project through. We want to take it all over the world, but we need to finish the last part. 

Are you with us?

If you, too, are out of money?

Please tell your friends about the project. Check out our Instagram and Facebook pages, and the website of UFI. Like, follow and share, straight from the Indiegogo page.

https://www.instagram.com/helenewangfilm/?hl=en

https://www.facebook.com/Atomic-Lovers-15279233...

http://filminstitute.org.ua/en/about-us/

story:
Short Summary

"This is my second documentary film. When I first heard all the commotion surrounding Donald Trumps candidacy for President of the United States, I at first bought in to the hyperbole of Trump being a fascist, but as I continued to work on this film and delved deeper into the history of the conflicts that are now starting to boil over, not only were my preconceived notions blown out of the water, but my whole worldview as well.  

This film not only documents what fascism is and how it rises, but also what it isn't. While making this documentary, I came to understand the forces that were gathering represented not only a desperate attempt to fight back against an existential threat to our civilization, but that this was mapped out and predicted 100 years ago, and that we were following this blueprint with startling accuracy." 

-Richard Heathen

If you look at the first film released by Liberty Machine News, produced by Richard Heathen, Hidden Influence: The Rise of Collectivism, (watch free) you'll see that we are capable of creating professional quality films. 

What your money will contribute to:

For A New Fascism is about half completed, but the budget for the film has been exhausted. To make it as powerful as it can be, we need money for traveling. There's a number of events Liberty Machine News would like to attend in order to film the clashes between rightwing activists and Antifa, as well as conduct interviews for the film. These events include:

-Unite the Right rally in Charlottesville VA August 12

-Free speech rally in Berkeley CA August 27

-Western Civilization: Circumventing the Frankfurt and Post Modern Schools Conference September 26  NYC

Money will also be used to pay graphic artists.

Supporters will be eligible for a number of perks including early access to the film, a signed copy of the DVD, and a personal conversation with the director, Richard Heathen.

The Impact

The goal of the project is to orientate people, give them a context through which they can better understand the current political upheavals we are seeing, not just in the US, but all over the West.

Richard's first film Hidden Influence: The Rise of Collectivism, was ahead of it's time. That film predicted the ever increasing rise of the far left. It also  documented how the power elite had funded the advance of far leftwing ideologies since the dawn of the 20th century. For A New Fascism promises to be an even more important, more groundbreaking film.   

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute financially please share this campaign. We are also looking for people to volunteer their time such as, graphic artists, as well as people who would be willing to film and do interviews at the events listed. If you're interested in getting involved please contact us.

story:
TW: gore, bullying, suicide     

 Greetings! Some of you know me as the sweetest gay gorehound of the Midwest, but to most, I am Aaron Eischeid, a Chicago-based filmmaker, activist, and cheesecake maker. A horror fanatic since seeing John Carpenter’s Halloween on a sneaked-in VHS tape at age 8 and a queer kid since always, I have always held a passion for the fringe and the bizarre. My interests never meshed well with my rural upbringing,  and the exploration of my passions was often met with brushes of hatred. I found solace in Chicago, and in 2014, I graduated with a BA in Gender & Women’s Studies with a focus in film from the University of Illinois at Chicago. I moved on to engage with local activists and like-minded cine-maniacs. Through this journey, the genre bending, queer focused company Paradigm Shift Productions was born and our first major film ENTRANCE EXAM comes screaming towards your screen.

            This campaign is to raise the funds necessary to fully realize the production of ENTRANCE EXAM. The film is a labor of love that came from a dark void: an emptiness instigated by the very public loss of young LGBTQ souls to real life terror. Bullying, suicide, degradation—much of it perpetrated by our trusted academic institutions. In this story’s case, the culprit is the prestigious Thornton Academy, where children are forced to adhere to an unattainable perfection, ruled by prejudiced morality clauses and the oppression of their budding identity. Our cast and crew are mostly queer Chicago artists, and we seek to rip flesh off this horrid bigotry within our unique hellscape. The aesthetics and dialogue of the film are greatly inspired by trailblazing films like Hellrasier, The Hunger, and Mulholland Drive, and pay homage to classic horror and 80' camp. Together, with your help, we can tell one of the many stories too eagerly hid in society’s shadow and have ourselves a time doing it.

            To achieve this we are raising $50,000. The fund will go towards completing the production of the film. A majority of the cost will go towards paying the cast and crew. It is a core value of ours to make sure the artists who dedicate their expertise and their time are fairly compensated. The second major expenditure will go towards the design and creation of practical effects. Our production has a commitment to the craftsmanship of visceral practical effects and is working with the very talented Catherine Woods to create a monster you will never forget. We want to bring you torn flesh that seethes gore, uniquely dangerous and detailed weapons that will appeal to your kinky sensibilities, and more jaw-dropping prosthetics like those of the oversized mouth featured in the trailer. It’s all included.

            Included too is what we all want: PERKS! We want you to have as much joy in making this film as we do. Thus, each donation tier has a ton of loot! You will run away with goodies like copies of a new zine also produced by Paradigm Shift, prints of our hand painted character posters, visits to the set, and even customized condoms for you to enjoy the ride responsibly.

            The ambitious scope of ENTRANCE EXAM, as with any film, presents the cast and crew with a unique set of challenges. Setting us up for success is our collaboration with the independent production company Bummer Camp Media. They are a collective of artists who have spent their careers utilizing limited resources to their advantage and have created a body of work that is both experimental and subversive. ENTRANCE EXAM is their first narrative short film as well, and they are looking forward to expanding their repertoire into the realm of horror. The depth of interdisciplinary experience from our cast and crew, and their enthusiasm for cultivating the bizarre, carries with it a great ambition to obliterate any obstacle that will inevitably reveal itself. We are all eternally grateful for your support and are chomping at the bit to get started. 

           So, are you ready to raise Hell? Let's go. Time to play.

story:
• THE TWO MOVIES

 

Asymmetry directed by Arthur Beauchet, a thriller

       Jane is invited for dinner at John’s. However, while she is looking for romance, he seems to desire something else…

 

Concerto en silence majeur by Denitsa Dodeva, a drama

       After his accident, Frank’s sister helps him recover through music.

 

  • OUR BUDGET​

This is how our goal is divided among the different parts of the production. 

   1 → Food, the most important thing on set.

   2 → Transportation, for our crew, our gear and other equipment.

   3 → Production design, because without it, there is nothing to watch.

   4 → Platform fees, an imperative.

    If we exceed our goal, the money will be equally distributed among every part of the production. You can bring this movie to life. However, we won’t let you do it without a compensation.

 

  • PERKS

​

  • WHY IT’S IMPORTANT TO US

    We won't make money with these films. However, they are our occasion to learn how to make movies and to prepare us for the professional world. Your help is not only a support to students, it’s a support to the future of cinema. Therefore,  a thank you might not be enough for that, but still, thank you for helping us.

 

  • RISKS AND CHALLENGES

    We are a young team that will probably make mistakes during the shoot. Maybe the budget we made is not realistic but that’s okay. That’s how we’ll learn, realizing where we went wrong. And in order to make mistakes, we need to act.

story:
Short Summary

Welcome! Thanks so much for taking the time out to learn more about this short film.  Yemi’s Dilemma is the story of three sisters, a wedding and a family torn apart because of it.  The sisters are first generation Americans, who, although they are proud of their Nigerian heritage, tend to relate more to the American culture within which they were raised.  Their parents, however, have a strong desire to maintain the traditions of their country and this ultimately leads to culture clashes in the family.  The eldest, Yemi, is expected to marry a Nigerian man, but she’s keeping a huge secret from her parents that will forever change the dynamic within the family for better and for worse.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $25,000 to shoot this film.  As explained in the video, this money will go to directly to physical production and post-production fees, including equipment, wardrobe, actor and crew fees, and editing. We even have a large party scene at the start of this film and this money will help get all the moving pieces together.  

Your contribution will be considered tax-deductable, through our fiscal sponsor Cinefemme.  For more information about Cinefemme, visit www.cinefemme.com. Cinefemme is a non-profit organization which supports female filmmakers to realize their independent, artistic film projects.

By donating to this film, you can receive one of the perks listed on this page, ranging from a copy of the finished film to an executive producer credit for those who are able to invest more into this project. Donations of any size are appreciated. If you have any questions or would like to donate outside of this site, email info@floweravefilms.com.

The Impact

Along with the larger cultural issues, this film also aims to explore the tight bonds between sisters and how the fallout from a family crisis affects their relationships. 

By supporting this film, you’re helping to bring audiences a unique and important view of the struggles some first generation Americans have as they navigate between two worlds.  You would also be backing a film that will feature two groups often underrepresented on-screen  – African and African American actors.

Other Ways You Can Help

Stay plugged into this page and our social media sites to follow the progress of this film from start to finish!  But don’t let things stop there, after donating, please share this campaign with your friends, co-workers or anyone you feel may be interested in supporting this movie.

Even if you cannot donate at this time, you can still help! Please take a moment to share this fundraising campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, Twitter, your church announcements, your work bulletin board, everywhere and with everyone you know.  Use Indiegogo's share tools to help spread the word!

Thank you so much for taking time out to learn about this campaign. And thank you so much for you contribution!


About the Director & Producer

Both the director and producer of this film have a strong track record with creating and seeing through productions of different sizes.

Writer/Director/Producer: Sade Oyinade is the Senior Producer on the award-winning TV One shows “Unsung” and “Unsung Hollywood” - both series that celebrate African American artists, music and movies. As a director, her first short was Who Do You Know?, a film about HIV in the black community.  It received positive reviews in Arts & Understanding  magazine, became a featured selection of the 2013 Pan African Film Festival and was featured on ASPiRE TV as part of their ABFF Independent series in August of 2015.  Sade is also currently working on a feature film adaptation of “Better Than I Know Myself”, by Virginia DeBerry and Donna Grant.   

Producer: Deshawn Plair is a producer/director who has most recently worked as an Associate Producer on the award-winning TV-One series "Unsung" and "Unsung Hollywood". She regularly manages talent, budgets and production schedules for this show. Deshawn has also served as director and producer for a successful web series called Dating Chronicles of Phoebe Miller.  She has a strong background in clearance, with the ability to communicate with record labels, film production companies, distributors and more. With the ability to wear many hats, Deshawn also has a knack for producing events, most recently coordinating the launch party for popular new trivia app, Quiztory.
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Welcome!
Thanks so much for taking the time out to learn more about this short
film.  Yemi’s Dilemma is the story of
three sisters, a wedding and a family torn apart because of it.  The sisters are first generation Americans,
who, although they are proud of their Nigerian heritage, tend to relate more to
the American culture within which they were raised.  Their parents, however, have a strong desire
to maintain the traditions of their country and this ultimately leads to
culture clashes in the family.  The
eldest, Yemi, is expected to marry a Nigerian man, but she’s keeping a huge
secret from her parents that will forever change the dynamic within the family for better and for worse.
   What We Need & What You Get 

We need to raise $25,000 to
shoot this film.  As explained in the video, this money will go to directly to physical production and post-production fees, including equipment, wardrobe, actor and crew fees, and editing. We even have a large party scene at the start of this film and this money will help get all the moving pieces together.  
Your contribution will be
considered tax-deductable, through our fiscal sponsor Cinefemme.  For more information about Cinefemme, visit www.cinefemme.com. Cinefemme is a non-profit organization which supports female
filmmakers to realize their independent, artistic film projects.
By donating to this film, you can receive one of the perks listed on this page, ranging from a copy of the finished film to an executive producer credit for those who are able to invest more into this project. Donations of any size are appreciated. If you have any questions or would like to donate outside of this site, email info@floweravefilms.com.   The Impact 
Along with the larger cultural issues, this film also aims to explore the tight bonds between sisters and how the fallout from a family crisis affects their relationships.

story:
A Message from the Writer, D.J. Hale

"Criminal gangs in the U.S.A. have swelled to an estimated 1 Million members..... 40% of these members are under the age of 18." - Kevin Johnson, USA Today

“IF I RETALIATE” is a gritty hard hitting short film, that sheds light on how our communities can be affected through the senseless cycle of gang violence festering within our neighborhoods. This is a real scenario that happens every day in the “Hood”, where an innocent person loses a life and their assailants continue to roam the streets, leaving those affected heavily conflicted and morally destroyed.

Growing up in the streets of South Sacramento, before moving to the Lincoln Village territory of East Sacramento, I experienced first hand what it is like surviving in the "Hood." Gun shots, car jackings, drugs and prostitutes plague these areas on a daily basis. There's nothing like watching a couple kids, maybe (9-13) walk down the street draped in gang colors clutching a pistol in their waistbands daring someone to try them. My experiences dealing with these characters, as well as my friends, their friends, and my Family members who are all immersed in the "Street life", have led me to write about them and share them with the world. These are hard hitting facts, details often overlooked in the public eye! "IF I RETALIATE" will take you on a journey through the Hood' through the eyes of a Private School Student who just wants to play Football. Let his harsh reality become an eye-opening experience for you, and potentially spark a change in your lifestyle for those who can identify with these characters...

Agree With Our Message? GREAT! We Need You!

As you know, you have to have money to do ANYTHING in this world... Especially make a professional quality Short Film of the highest standard! We have proposed a budget of $12,000 and need YOUR help in raising it!

Each Donation Comes With its Own Set of Perks for YOU!!! ---------------------------->


Some of the Cast!

We are still casting and reaching out to Celebrities for key roles but here is a snapshot of the Principal Cast so far! More additions to come.

       D.J. Hale - Jahlil

This is D.J.'s first attempt at Directing and starring in his own Written Screenplay, as the morally conflicted, Jahlil. He finished 2015 strong with Principal Leading roles in three different Independent Feature Films; City of Dogs, Being Black Enough, and Mercy Christmas.

        Alexia Pearl - Claudia

Alexia is an incredibly talented Actress coming off a Principal Leading role in the highly successful 2016 OSCAR NOMINATED, 2016 BAFTA WINNING, and 2015 EMMY AWARD WINNING Short Film; Day One! She will be playing the role of Claudia, Frankie's heartbroken and distraught Girlfriend.

Daniel Rovira - Lil' Monster

Daniel Rovira is a name you may want to remember, because this kid is going places! He was recently nominated for Best Actor in a Short Film (Idyllwild Film Festival) and Best Performance in a Short Film (Young Artist Awards) for his portrayal of Lautaro in the Short Film “Imagination of Young”. He will be playing the gritty role of Lil' Monster, the newest recruit into Cedar Gang.

Michael Grayson III

Michael is a Bay Area superstar! Incredibly talented, hard working and charming, it's only a matter of time before he takes Hollywood by storm! He will playing the innocently murdered Frankie, and is most noted for his Series Regular role on BTV's; The Dirty, featuring Vivica A. Fox and Miguel Nunez Jr.

David Plascencia - Capo
David brings his experience and bone chilling intimidation to breathe life into the role of Capo, the leader of Cedar Gang. David has been working consistently in Hollywood for the past couple years. His recent works are; Being Black Enough, Street Talkin', and Stronghold.


Other Ways You Can Help!

EXPOSURE ! Help us keep the momentum alive by sharing this page to all of your followers. Let's reach as many people as we can, giving everybody an opportunity to be a part of this movement!

#ChangeStartsWithYOU!

story:
Short Summary

Peter McPike writes a screenplay about a werewolf that terrorizes a group of teens in their sleep who are out trick or treating on Halloween. Once he realizes his story has come to life he must warn and convince them it's real. One false move and they could all die.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 
 
 

 

Risks & Challenges

 

Filmmaking is almost always challenging and I can expect that. Contributing to my project is risk free. This short will be made sooner or later. Book it!

story:
Hello!

Welcome and Thank you for visiting our fundraising campaign page for our lovely, emotional, and ambitious film "FishCake"!  We have already raised more than $1,800 but we still need your help!

The Story-

The story of FishCake is about young Sammy, who wants nothing more than to go fishing again with his Uncle Ben who is suffering from Alzhiemer's disease.

How "FishCake" Came to Be-

Director, Drea Garcia is no stranger to struggle, hardship, and plain bad luck which feeds into her style of bittersweet yet poignant style of writing.

The early drafts of the film did involve a child and their relationship to an elderly guardian revolving around the theme of memories. The idea that sparked what would evolve into the final product was the concept of fishing superstitions involving luck.

Through the writing and re-writing process of the script, Drea realized and incorporated ideas that are both relatable and universal to us all. One is  learning how to forgive yourself and others for things beyond their control. The other is learning to realize that, though painful, nothing in life lasts forever and to treasure the "now".

The Goal of "FishCake"-

Though "FishCake" is a short film what it has to offer is nothing small. The most obvious goal of this project is to bring a wonderful film to life, but there is more that we wish accomplish.

One is to help audiences to emotionally connect to the plight caused by this disease and to facilitate awareness

Next, and possibly the most important goal of our film is to aid the search for a cure. We promise that 12% of what we raise in the main campaign WILL go to fund The Fisher Center For Alzheimers Research Foundation.

The "Fish Bowl"-

The Fish Bowl fund is a secondary and optional branch of the main campaign. Money put into the "Fish Bowl" will only go towards The Fisher Center For Alzheimer's Research Foundation, on top of the 12% we intend to donate from the main campaign. The more raised in either fund the more money that goes to aid the search for the cure!

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is a modest $4,500 but the more the merrier!

We need to raise money to cover the conventional costs of crew, catering, transportation, prop/set design, distribution, rentals and anything else that goes into making the best film we possibly can for you!

We'll be shooting a detrimental scene that takes place on a dock, that would require a boat rental to store our equipment to shoot as well as personnel such as Captain and a lifeguard for safety. Our production design isn't so heavy but would require some bigger ticket items such as a paddle boat and kayak. Locations can easily get a little pricey since we would need a private dock along with two separate homes so a fourth of our budget would be used strictly for that. We have a small budget for distribution set aside so that we may submit our film to film festivals. Last but certainly not least, our crew and cast will be working their hearts out and we want to keep them hydrated and well fed and your contributions would certainly help!

In gratitude we are offering some great rewards for those who wish to contribute to the film. These "Perks" include exclusive digital content, handcrafted and custom made products, and specialized items with the FishCake logo and of course name credits in the film.

Our film is part of flexible funding which means we do not loose all of the money if we do not make our goal. We have made the decision to go with flexible funding because we still want to donate to the Fisher Center for Alzheimer's Reasearch Foundation no matter how small our contribution is.

The Impact

The money raised for "FishCake" will go to help dedicated doctors and scientist fight and hopefully cure this life shattering disease that affects people all over the world.

More than 30 million people worldwide live with Alzheimer's today and every 68 seconds a person develops this disease. Over 60 million people are expected to have Alzheimer's by 2030. Director, Drea Garcia has a family history with Alzheimer's. Her great-great grandmother had Alzheimer's along with her great grandmother and fears her own mother will develop it in life. Executive Producer, Leah Pollack has a family member who is suffering from Alzheimers and knows the struggles. Alzheimer's may not directly affect you at this moment but we need to find a cure to better our future.

Our Crew is made up of talented students, who have worked on a variety of projects and have certainly gained experience. Drea Garcia started out as an actor and has the knowledge of the type of communication actors need. She grew up in a large family taking care of kids and she loves the light children can bring and hopes to capture that in the film. Executive Producer Leah Pollack has produced her fair share of projects and is also a great editor. She is currently hard at work making connections with Alzheimer groups in the Savannah Georgia area as well as taking care of a large amount of work to make this film come to life.

We have two young cast members that we are so lucky to work with. We have young Tiffany, who will be playing the role of Mila and Sebastian, who will be playing the role of Sammy.


Risks & Challenges

All involved with this project know the difficulties faced when making a film of any kind. We have all experienced and overcome these hurdles in the past and have made some exceptional art. We are ready to face anything that could hinder FishCake.

Examples include:

- Scheduling conflicts

-"Acts of God" (severe weather, flood, wild fire, etc.)

- Spontaneous equipment failure.

- Location Issues (involving exterior/outdoor scenes)

-Limited Resources

-Child Labor Laws ( Children can only work a certain number of hours a day on set. For good reason!)

Our plan to avoid such challenges would be to monitor the weather and schedule alternative plans just in case as well as have the set prepared before the children arrive. If all possible we will have crew members stay at the location rental the night before and plan for the weekend. We have been hard at work with pre production but we need your donations to help us move into our final steps of preproduction and finally shoot this poignant film! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute monetary funds there is always the chance to donate food for our cast and crew! We also need items such as kayaks, small boats, and fishing gear.

If you are a small business located in or around a Savannah GA the "Fishy Business" perk is right for you!

Last but not least, help spread the word, invite others to view or contribute to our campaign and a worthy cause!

story:
Hello Indiegogo! I'm James Defalco I am a filmmaker, and let me tell you a little bit about myself. I am the writer, director & producer of Long Island Love Story. I graduated from Five Towns College in 2010 with a Bachelors Degree in Film & Video Production. Since Graduating, I have held many jobs in the film and live entertainment industry. I've worked as a freelance cameraman for the IATSE (Which is the International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees) for over 5 years. I have also worked as a cameraman for such sports teams and musical acts as The New York Islanders, Madonna, Justin Bieber, Nicki Minaj, Skrillex, The Weeknd, Lil' Wayne and hundreds more.

Long Island Love Story is about two brothers Michael & Anthony, and how they help each other figure out their individual relationship problems during a huge family party.

Michael is a hopeless romantic who wears his hear on his sleeve. He has been foolish in love in the past, and has had his heart broken. He meets Amy and after six months of dating, he finally coerces her to come out to his parents to meet them and his entire family. She comes from a small family where she has no siblings or cousins. Also at the party, is Michaels high school sweetheart, Jess, who Michael has no idea that she is there.

Anthony is a kind hearted man child, who has been dating his girlfriend Laura for eight years. She has matured since their college days, but Anthony has not. When Laura finds out that she is pregnant she decides to tell Anthony that it's over and he will have no responsibilities when the baby comes. 

It's a sweet and funny romantic comedy in the vein of Brothers McMullen.

This is a very important project to me and my wonderful cast. Since I graduated from college I have been trying to break into the film industry. I've worked as a cameraman for many different companies, but haven't gotten a gig on a tv show or feature film. After plugging along for a while, I decided that I was not going to wait for someone to give me a break. I was going to make my own. I wrote Long Island Love Story as a debut feature using all I had at my disposal, (Mine & my cousins houses, and tons of family as background actors and bit part players).  We filmed over 11 days from July/August of this year, and we did so much with such a small budget.

When I was writing Long Island Love Story I posted it onto the script review website, The Black List. I received a wonderful evaluation on my first draft. Here are just a few of the things that were said about that draft.

"The dynamic between Anthony and Michael is endearing and fun to watch."

"The script has some entertaining banter, and a number of funny lines that keep the characters  and story interesting."
"The story has potential to be developed into a commercially viable indie comedy that would appeal to audiences who enjoyed movies like "Meet the Fockers" and "Rachel Getting Married."
If you contribute to this project you will help make the dreams of me and everyone involved a reality; completing a feature film & sending it off to the festival circuit. 
Production is done, and we're in the process of post-production and need a little bit of help getting that done. I.E sound mixing / color grading etc.
The Cast!
Here is a look at our amazing cast. 

 

 

 

James Defalco plays Michael

 

Ryan Gregorio plays Anthony
Kathryn Brascia plays Amy
Linda Liebman plays Jess

Monica Cioffi plays Laura

 

What We Need & What You Get

Ok so here's what we need...

Principal Photography (The actual filming of the movie) is finished. The reason we're launching this campaign is to raise funds for post production, and to pay our crew and actors, who have worked so hard for very little money. I put our goal at $4500, which should be enough for everything we need, including paying for the perks.

Here is what your contributions will go to:

- Hiring a musician / composer to write the score to the film *Music* 

- A sound editor to fix up some scenes with audio issues.

- Color grading and digital effects when editing

- Paying the crew & cast 

- Entry fees to festivals all over the country, Sundance, Tribeca, Cannes, TIFF, SXSW etc.

- To hold a premiere screening at a local movie theater to celebrate completion of the film.

- Cover the costs of the perks.

Any bit helps, and we hope you contribute!!

Perks!

What is an Indiegogo campaign without perks? So we have some pretty good perks from a standard "thank you" at the end credits of the film, personalized thank you videos, DVD copy, T-shirt, signed posters!

 If you want to be even more awesome and donate more you could have dinner with the cast & director, tickets to the premiere *NYC Residents ONLY* and producers credits. (Producer credit doesn't entitle you to ownership of the film or any future profits should the film be sold. It is merely a vanity credit.)

If we're unable to reach our goal of $4,500 the funds will go to paying the cast and crew (less than if we'd reached the goal) and fulfilling are perks to our contributors. 

The Impact

The impact of fulfilling this campaign will be substantial for this film and myself. I have found success as a camera man, but being a creator, a storyteller is what I long to do. In this business you either wait forever for someone to give you a shot, or you surround yourself with like minded people, and make your own shot.
We hope to raise funds so we can put the final touches on this very personal project and start the process of submitting it to festivals so the world can see what we've done.
We are all dreamers.

Risks & Challenges

There are risks & challenges with supporting any project on Indiegogo. Good thing for Long Island Love Story, there isn't any risk at all as we have finished production, and are seeking funds for post production, festival entries & compensation for our hard working crew and actors.
It's as simple as this. The movie is shot, we need to put it through extensive post production. Once that's done, we'll send it out and start fulfilling our perks to whoever donates.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

If you are unable to contribute, that's fine. Get the word out on social media; Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and let others know of what we're trying to do and show them our trailer and campaign page. 

Help us complete this wonderful film that we cant wait to show to the world!
story_txt:
Hello Indiegogo! I'm James Defalco I am a filmmaker, and let me tell you a little bit about myself. I am the writer, director & producer of Long Island Love Story. I graduated from Five Towns College in 2010 with a Bachelors Degree in Film & Video Production. Since Graduating, I have held many jobs in the film and live entertainment industry. I've worked as a freelance cameraman for the IATSE (Which is the International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees) for over 5 years. I have also worked as a cameraman for such sports teams and musical acts as The New York Islanders, Madonna, Justin Bieber, Nicki Minaj, Skrillex, The Weeknd, Lil' Wayne and hundreds more.

Long Island Love Story is about two brothers Michael & Anthony, and how they help each other figure out their individual relationship problems during a huge family party.
Michael is a hopeless romantic who wears his hear on his sleeve. He has been foolish in love in the past, and has had his heart broken. He meets Amy and after six months of dating, he finally coerces her to come out to his parents to meet them and his entire family. She comes from a small family where she has no siblings or cousins. Also at the party, is Michaels high school sweetheart, Jess, who Michael has no idea that she is there.
Anthony is a kind hearted man child, who has been dating his girlfriend Laura for eight years. She has matured since their college days, but Anthony has not. When Laura finds out that she is pregnant she decides to tell Anthony that it's over and he will have no responsibilities when the baby comes. 
It's a sweet and funny romantic comedy in the vein of Brothers McMullen.
This is a very important project to me and my wonderful cast. Since I graduated from college I have been trying to break into the film industry. I've worked as a cameraman for many different companies, but haven't gotten a gig on a tv show or feature film. After plugging along for a while, I decided that I was not going to wait for someone to give me a break. I was going to make my own. I wrote Long Island Love Story as a debut feature using all I had at my disposal, (Mine & my cousins houses, and tons of family as background actors and bit part players).  We filmed over 11 days from July/August of this year, and we did so much with such a small budget.
When I was writing Long Island Love Story I posted it onto the script review website, The Black List. I received a wonderful evaluation on my first draft. Here are just a few of the things that were said about that draft.
"The dynamic between Anthony and Michael is endearing and fun to watch."
"The script has some entertaining banter, and a number of funny lines that keep the characters  and story interesting."
"The story has potential to be developed into a commercially viable indie comedy that would appeal to audiences who enjoyed movies like "Meet the Fockers" and "Rachel Getting Married."
If you contribute to this project you will help make the dreams of me and everyone involved a reality; completing a feature film & sending it off to the festival circuit. 
Production is done, and we're in the process of post-production and need a little bit of help getting that done. I.E sound mixing / color grading etc.
The Cast!
Here is a look at our amazing cast. 

 
 
 

James Defalco plays Michael
 

Ryan Gregorio plays Anthony


Kathryn Brascia plays Amy

Linda Liebman plays Jess


Monica Cioffi plays Laura

 

What We Need & What You Get
Ok so here's what we need...
Principal Photography (The actual filming of the movie) is finished. The reason we're launching this campaign is to raise funds for post production, and to pay our crew and actors, who have worked so hard for very little money. I put our goal at $4500, which should be enough for everything we need, including paying for the perks.
Here is what your contributions will go to:
- Hiring a musician / composer to write the score to the film *Music* 
- A sound editor to fix up some scenes with audio issues.
- Color grading and digital effects when editing
- Paying the crew & cast 
- Entry fees to festivals all over the country, Sundance, Tribeca, Cannes, TIFF, SXSW etc.
- To hold a premiere screening at a local movie theater to celebrate completion of the film.
- Cover the costs of the perks.
Any bit helps, and we hope you contribute!!
Perks!
What is an Indiegogo campaign without perks? So we have some pretty good perks from a standard "thank you" at the end credits of the film, personalized thank you videos, DVD copy, T-shirt, signed posters!
 If you want to be even more awesome and donate more you could have dinner with the cast & director, tickets to the premiere *NYC Residents ONLY* and producers credits. (Producer credit doesn't entitle you to ownership of the film or any future profits should the film be sold. It is merely a vanity credit.)
If we're unable to reach our goal of $4,500 the funds will go to paying the cast and crew (less than if we'd reached the goal) and fulfilling are perks to our contributors. 

The Impact
The impact of fulfilling this campaign will be substantial for this film and myself. I have found success as a camera man, but being a creator, a storyteller is what I long to do. In this business you either wait forever for someone to give you a shot, or you surround yourself with like minded people, and make your own shot.
We hope to raise funds so we can put the final touches on this very personal project and start the process of submitting it to festivals so the world can see what we've done.
We are all dreamers.

Risks & Challenges
There are risks & challenges with supporting any project on Indiegogo. Good thing for Long Island Love Story, there isn't any risk at all as we have finished production, and are seeking funds for post production, festival entries & compensation for our hard working crew and actors.
It's as simple as this. The movie is shot, we need to put it through extensive post production. Once that's done, we'll send it out and start fulfilling our perks to whoever donates.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
If you are unable to contribute, that's fine. Get the word out on social media; Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and let others know of what we're trying to do and show them our trailer and campaign page. 
Help us complete this wonderful film that we cant wait to show to the world!

story:
About the Film

Our War tells the dramatic story of a family that sees itself divided, much like the country itself, at the outset of the American Civil War. When North Carolina votes to secede from the Union, the eldest son of our family, Jim, decides to leave for the North to join Mr. Lincoln's Army, choosing to fight against his own home, and family.  As the war progresses, the war takes its toll on both Jim and his family, affecting them in ways they couldn't possibly imagine. And the war's end sets the stage for a dramatic, and possibly deadly, reunion.

The film was conceived by Co-Writer and Director, JD Mayo. Having made several films over the years, as well as being a Civil War reenactor, and passionate about American history, JD was ready to tackle a dramatic story set in the midst of America's deadliest conflict. He shared the story with Co-Writer and Producer Steven Hancock, a fellow filmmaker, historian and reenactor. Both worked at developing the story into a powerful tale of family, betrayal, and war.

Inspired by historical films such as Ron Maxwell's Copperhead, Ang Lee's Ride with the Devil, and the miniseries Hatfields & McCoys, the filmmakers have striven to tell this little known truth of American history: That many southerners chose to fight with the Union armies, fighting against their own home and families. Once completed, the film will provide a very dramatic story, while remaining truthful to the time.

The Cast

Ryan Daniel Thompson as Jim


Brigham McNeely as David


Michael Burke as Samuel


Melissa Eastwood as Samantha


Lauren Hatfield as Ashton


Michael Ray Williams as Abner


Steven Hancock as Billy


Angela Pritchett as Nurse


Rusty Cage as Doctor Jenkins


The Crew (So Far)

JD Mayo: Director, Co-Writer


Steven Hancock: Producer, Co-Writer


Tom Gore: Line Producer


Sean Pollock: Director of Photography (War Scenes)


Adam Robert Galloway: Composer


Susan M. Conner: Costume Designer


Evelyn Putnam: Makeup

Angela Pritchett: Special Effects Makeup


William "Bushrod" Moss: Historical Consultant/Reenactor Coordinator

Locations

In addition to assembling a talented cast and crew, we've also been given special permission to film at two amazing locations. For our war scenes, we will be filming on a private location in Stoneville, NC. The owners of the site have graciously allowed us access to the site. We utilized this site to film our promotional trailer back in February.

What These Funds Will Help With:

We have a talented cast and crew coming on board to help make the film possible. However, in order to achieve our goals, we are going to need to raise some funding. Our goal through this campaign is to raise $10,000. From these funds, we will be able to cover several different aspects of the production. This include: 

  • Pre-Production: Funds will help us to either purchase, or rent, props for filming, such as period weaponry and equipment. We will also be able to construct any sets or items we'll need to use for filming.
  • Principal Photography: Funding will help us to pay our cast and crew, as well as provide amenities on set (Food, drinks, etc.), during filming. We can also use these funds to rent any equpment, such as cameras and sound equipment, to make the film. 
  • Post-Production: These funds will also help us with post-production costs. These include hiring people to help with editing, music, sound design (Including ADR and sound effects additions), color correction and visual effects, polishing the film to make it look and sound as terrific as possible. This will also help us to create promotional materials, such as trailers, posters, etc.
  • Festival Submissions: In addition to finishing the film, these funds will help us to submit the film to film festivals across the country, giving thousands of people the opportunity to see it, and react to it.

And of course, with every cent we make over our goal, we will be able to make the film even better.

By helping to donate to our campaign, you will not only help us to achieve our filmmaking goals, but you will also receive some amazing swag, as our way of saying "Thank You" for helping make our film possible.


Risks & Challenges

Making films is always a risky venture, subject to several factors, including schedules, cast/crew availability, weather, and other factors. These can lead to delays in filming, as well as the release of the film.

However, as all of us working on the film are experienced actors and filmmakers, we have learned how to work around these issues, and will bring our expertise to making sure we finish Our War in a timely fashion, and are able to present it to several different film festivals.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everybody can donate to our campaign. And that is okay. There are other ways you can help our campaign. You can help by sharing the link to our campaign everywhere you can online. You can also share the links to our Facebook Page, Twitter Page and Official Blog, to help spread awareness of our film, as well as our campaign.

Thank you for considering contributing to our campaign. With your help, we can make one of the most dramatic, and historically accurate, Civil War films yet made.


Sincerely,
The Our War Team

story:
Hello! My name is Erica. I recently graduated from the University of Utah in May of 2016 and am very excited to bring my script, The Mother Wound, to life!

The Mother Wound is a dark 30 minute drama. It focuses on the struggling relationship between a mother and her two daughters. This is an important story because I feel that so many can relate and find healing in their own relationships as they take in this film. It is great to open discussions about the affects that a patriarchal society can have on women. This short film focuses in on a particular issue; mother-daughter relationships.

I created The Mother Wound because we live in a patriarchal society that constantly pits women against each other in the media and pushes the idea that a woman's worth equates to her beauty. This can cause vicious competition between women and it is devastating for mother-daughter relationships. I really wanted to show the damage that mothers can have on their daughters and how it can be an endless cycle when unrecognized. 

I have been fortunate in bringing together a fantastic cast and crew who have done an amazing job! The film is currently in the last stages of post-production and is due to be finished by the end of September 2016. My goal is to raise enough money to recoup $5000 in production costs and $5000 more to pay back our awesome cast and crew who volunteered so much of their time for this passion project. 

Leading Ladies: 

Quinci Staker 

 

Charla Cochran

 

Stevie Dutson 


Writer/Director: Erica Rowley
Producer: Calvin Rowley 
Assistant Director: John Meier 
Director of Photography: Jacqueline Fowers

Paintings: 
The artwork in the film was done by artist Michael Pulley. If you'd like one of these for your wall you can find the pieces from the film and others at his page here: https://www.facebook.com/michaelpulleyart/?fref=ts


Michael Pulley on set 

 

Thank you for checking out our fundraising page! All donations will greatly help! We will be submitting the film to festivals. Please spread the word and donate if you can! Any amount is greatly appreciated! 

All who donate $5 or more will be credited at the end of the film! 
Thank you so much!!!! 

IMDb: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt5832456/?ref_=nm_fl...

story:
I've been a film-maker for 15 years and had a show in talks with both CW & ABC that ended up falling through.

Chris Evans once said, "If something is your passion, listen to your heart. If it's what you love more than anything else, don't stop doing it for anybody."

All of my almost big breaks can keep building up, I'm not in it for the fame or riches, I'm in it for the art and my love for writing and creating films, that touch people.

I'm currently starting up my own production company Heart & Key Productions to create films I believe in and we already have 3 projects ready for filming.

War on Terror is our first project and we want to go big! Which means aiming high and working with the best. Since this film is a 'world wide war' movie we are raising funds for special fx, props, locations, ect. We had a professional breakdown the script scene by scene adding together the costs of the film and they said we need a minimum of 2 million to make this film, we've looked into product placement, and are searching for investors as we build a business plan and were advised to start a funding website, so now the ball is in your court.

Donate, Share, Follow, Join our newsletter at our website!

War on Terror Synopsis

Gutsy Canadian Astrid’s life is shaken apart by a terrorist attack on the West Edmonton Mall. When the danger seems greater than the government is letting on, she takes it upon herself and best friend James to investigate a multinational conspiracy that threatens to shake the foundations of the modern world. With few allies, from a suspicious Ranger to an Islamic girl with questionable intentions, Astrid must fight to get to the bottom of things before time runs out and the world is plunged into darkness. With a mystery man closing in and planning to destroy over two hundred years of human progress, James safeguards Astrid and they delve deeper into the violent covert realm of the Navy Seals, CIA, Mi6, and the invisible society of Joint Task Force 2. Can a young, inexperienced girl find the courage to stand against global religions, nations and ideals far beyond her own scope, without giving in to the hatred and ignorance even in her own home that she knows is the cause behind it all?

We are hoping to grab the attention of Chris Evans and sign him on as a director, we also have a casting wish list we hope to conquer by raising the funds and getting the scripts into the right hands. We'll be holding contests, keeping fans updated and more all on our website, so keep connected with this campaign and on the films website.

We've decided we want to make this interesting and a little more worth your while so we will film Challenge videos, Prank videos, Dares and even share snippets of the script maybe.... First $100 raised leave comments what you'd like to see then we'll go to $500 and then $1000, $5000, 10 000, 50 000, 100 000, etc.

If we do not reach our goal, the website has a donate button that will stay up throughout the process of pre-pro and production. All funds raised go towards filming equipment, props, FX/Make-up, costume/set design, and locations.

Don't forget to Share, spread the word, donate, and sign up at our website.

story:
THE STORY

LAPSE  follows Paul Campbell, a recent high school graduate, in the wake of the drug-fueled suicide of his best friend, Nathan Parker. When Paul leaves community college to finally return to his hometown of Emerald Valley, CA, his reception is startlingly cold, and it becomes clear that the community at large, including many of Paul’s former friends and their families, blame Paul for Nathan’s death.  Lapse is a post-tragedy narrative—a story about blame set in a world of twisted suburban values that examines the desperate defenses and prejudices of the human heart. 


WHERE YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS GO

Making movies is an expensive, complex process with a lot of moving parts. The production of this film involves a large crew and cast and your contributions to Lapse will go toward -    

             

THE TEAM


RISKS & CHALLENGES 

Producing a film is never a simple task- but nothing is impossible! This is an ambition film, in scope and scale, it’s unlike anything I’ve ever done. But- along with your contributions I will have the opportunity to focus on the challenges of telling a compelling story and creating this film the right way. I've been able to successfully create and work on many projects here at NYU Tisch but this is the last big hurrah before I graduate!


THANK YOU

To show my appreciation, I have created rewards for your contributions to the film.  My wonderful crew and I will be giving this project everything we can with whatever we have. The finished film will be submitted to festivals, and not only will you be able to see yourself in the credits, but know that you played a crucial role in getting us there and helping progress our experience in the industry.

If you aren't able to donate, there are always other ways to support the project- you can share this campaign via Facebook, Twitter, any other form and spread the word about this film to as many people as possible! 

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out the campaign and help us bring LAPSE to life.

story:
NO COMMENTARY: New Virtual Reality Series 

Our Mission is to capture unbiased reality using VR.  No Commentary is a Virtual Reality Series for anyone tired of being told what to think by the media.   

What does "unbiased media mean anymore?", "Is it even possible?", "Why is that important"? 

I believe that most of the anger directed at the media in recent years is related to excessive, and very biased commentary. I'm not a journalist, but I wanted to tell stories that put people in major events and let them think about conclusions for themselves.

360° Virtual Reality Video is the perfect way to show viewers what is happening and allow them to experience a moment in time.  It like I took the Eric Garner Protest and bottle it for anyone to experience later. If you know someone that was there send this to them.  If you wish you could see what it was like view it on your iPad phone and move it around. 

VR Headset not required.

You don't need a VR Headset to experience this documentary. Click the video on a phone or iPad and then move it around while it plays.

Be one of the first to back the project with just $25 you can get a 4K digital version of Episode .1  "No Commentary: Eric Garner Protest NYC".


Future Episodes will follow the 2016 Presidential Campaign.

With your help I'm also looking to add to this project an shoot an unbiased virtual reality episodes that follows the 2016 Presidential Campaign. 

Here is some of my past work. 




Risks & Challenges

I'm not yet a member of the press.  At the moment I don't have a Press Pass so I'm having trouble recording the 2016 Presidential events. 

Please email me if you work for the campaigns or in the News industry and would like to help.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this documentary. https://youtu.be/c9k2yP9Na1I
  • Forward us to presidential campaigns! VRVideo.TV
  • Hire us to create a VR Video for your next event.
  • Share this with members of the press. I need to get press to get a press pass. Go figure.

Sharing VR is my Mission! Unbiased Media for All

These videos are free for all to experience. We want to capture history and sharing this video is a great FREE way to support:  https://youtu.be/c9k2yP9Na1I
