story:
Though intelligent, nine-year-old Aiden acts like he has no mind of his own. His tiger Mummy has his entire future planned out for him. The first step? The Gifted Education Programme (GEP) - a valuable and exclusive curriculum that promises better education for the gifted mind.

When Aiden finds Ah Gong, an old magical shadow puppeteer at a neighbouring car park, he knows this is his chance to find a voice. Will Aiden find the courage to stand up for himself?

You might be familiar with Amy Chua’s “The Battle Hymn of the Tiger Mother”. When it came out in 2011, it created an uproar in the West, bringing the spotlight back on Asian parenting and the seemingly impossible standards that have been forced upon the children of the East. How ludicrous! How heartless! How can this be right?

As Asians—Singaporeans—ourselves, we’ve experienced it first hand. For better or for worse, an unsatisfactory grade can mean a hot taste of the cane and bitter disappointment for supper. To many old school Asian parents, your happiness now means little compared to your potential for success. But what does it mean for the children? For us?

Even now, as young adults about to graduate and make our First Contribution to Modern Society (jobs!), we have friends who decided to put aside their interests to pursue “proper careers” that will ensure a “bright and stable future”, purely because of their parents’ wishes.

That’s how Aiden’s story was born. Using Aiden’s perspective, we want to question “success”. We want to brave the path less travelled, to hold our future in our own hands. Films like Jack Neo’s “I Not Stupid” (2002) and dramas like MediaCorp TV’s “Lion Moms” (2015) have given their two cents. This is ours.

Aiden’s story is a blend of fantasy and reality. Through the use of wayang kulit (shadow puppetry), animation and the story of “The Silly Little Girl and the Funny Old Tree” (by Singaporean playwright Kuo Pao Kun), we hope to bring you a little magic.


HIGHLIGHTS OF THE FILM

Our film takes place at three main locations — a house, a primary school and a multi-storey car park. Based on the mood of its central scenes, we chose and built on distinct colour palettes for each of them.

As with any film production, the excitement truly starts when we see the script coming to life. Apart from the usual planning and coordination, we spent a considerable amount of time designing each set, painstakingly sourcing and making the props ourselves. Following the demands of the script, we had to transform the bare multi-storey carpark into an enchanting garden for Ah Gong and Aiden. Take a peek!

We have completed principal photography and are now in the midst of post-production. With your kind support, we will be able to share the film with you very soon!


So who are we? We are a group of three final-year undergraduates from Wee Kim Wee School of Communication and Information, Nanyang Technological University (NTU), specialising in Broadcast and Cinema Studies. 

Why the name? It all started from a Whatsapp message that Choon Ling sent at 12.30a.m. several months ago…

And with that, the director has spoken...

Junfeng has directed various projects including the anchor video for “Beyond50” and an accompanying MV for “从心发现 家的味道”. In addition, he was also heavily involved in various aspects of production for various local movies such as "3688" and "7 Letters", both directed and produced by local director Royston Tan. His experiences in various theatre and film productions have given him many opportunities to explore the intricacies and complexities of many characters.

Mei Zhen has been freelancing in the film industry since 2013. She has worked on various projects ranging from TV commercials to short films to reality TV series to feature films. Mei Zhen is also given an opportunity to take up the role of “Assistant Production Coordinator” in a large-scale reality TV show, Asia’s Got Talent Season 1. She has worked with producers from various countries such as Singapore, Malaysia, Australia, Taiwan, Hong Kong, and America.


An avid film student and TV addict, Choon Ling is fascinated by all things cinematic. Her participation in the 2014 Singapore International Film Festival Youth Jury Programme has made her more adept at film writing, while her internship at FremantleMedia Asia and Viddsee have introduced her to the thrill of reality TV production and short film distribution. She was a programmer for Perspectives Film Festival 2015: Transition and aspires to be a well-rounded film practitioner.


We’ve been able to make it thus far because of the support from National Youth Council (NYC) and the People’s Association Youth Movement (PAYM), but we need your help to bring this film closer to reality. Other than the required cut by Indiegogo and PayPal upon campaign completion, the bulk of our money will be spent as funds for our pick-up shoot, which includes transport, equipment rental, food and props. We will also be hiring a Visual Effects Artist for our animated dog (exciting!). We’re procuring the rights to “Wang Chun Feng” as well, an essential piece that was featured dominantly in the original “The Silly Little Girl and the Funny Old Tree” play.

In a nutshell, the funding raised through Indiegogo will cover the following:


To thank you for your contribution, we have prepared different kinds of perks for you. Here are some of them!

Motivational Posters

Specially designed by our art assistant Kaiyan, these are the exact posters that Mummy hung up in the living room while Aiden prepares for his GEP exams. Now, they are yours to keep, and we hope they will motivate you as well! Designs may vary.


Postcards

Postcards featuring stills directly from our film's footage and comes with a handwritten message from us! Designs may vary.


As students and Singaporeans who’ve been through it ourselves, we understand the academic, familial and societal pressures faced by our peers and by extension, anyone affected by the modern education system. If you feel for our story and would like to join Aiden on his magical journey, please support us by contributing to us on Indiegogo!

Alternatively, you may like our Facebook page at Aiden 奇幻的偶遇 where you will receive production updates and sneak a peek of what happens behind the scenes of our production. Help us share the page with your friends!

story:
ESports is growing more rapidly than ever, and it's now clear that this is not a passing fad. However many people still doubt the validity of electronic competition. We're here to change that mindset. All of the post production work on this project is being done by members of the smash community, so when you support this project, you aren't just supporting a film, you're supporting the growth of a community!

The world of competitive Super Smash Brothers Melee is high stakes and cutthroat. There are heroes, villains, and even gods, and everyone is competing to make a name for themselves. 60 Frames follows three players, a newcomer (Kenji), a rising challenger (Squid), and a master (HuGs), each looking to climb the ranks and solidify their place in the halls of melee history. The path is hard though, and the competition is fierce. When the game is on the line, your focus narrows, and the world vanishes, leaving only you, your opponent, and the game. The sounds become sharper, the visuals become brighter, and awareness is heightened. It's not just strategy and cognition that wins games, it's the ability to flow in high level situations. In this movie we look at what it takes to succeed in high level competition, and what it feels like to experience the glory of victory and the sting of defeat.

story:
BRITAIN - SHATTERED ISLES, STOLEN HISTORY

Britain's stolen history, and the Roman conspiracy to conceal a catastrophe... 

The traditional view of world history is increasingly challenged as new and surprising evidence surfaces globally - evidence which contradicts the simplistic time-lines promoted by academia. 

Conventional notions of history and religion, deliberately convoluted and confused, mould our perceptions of the past and our very origins, distorting our ideas of the present and the future. 

Britain's ancient history is obscure, to say the least. For example, we all know about 'Roman' roads... But when the Romans arrived in Britain to civilise the savage warring tribes, these 'primitive' Britons were driving metal 'chariots' on the long straight roads we are told were constructed by the Roman invaders. 

It appears that the islands of Britain in former times enjoyed a highly advanced civilisation. 

So what happened to change that - and why is it such a big secret? 


THE TEAM

Ingrid Maclean

I'm a linguist and former tutor now home educating my twin daughters and researching and writing about the origins and structure of language and its association with all that catastrophic history we don't get to see.

As Mason Bigelow I've written a book about the lost history of Britain (I'm now working on another) and a play based on Comyns Beaumont's life of Francis Bacon as the secret son of Elizabeth I and the author of the plays of Shakespeare. 

I've just finished a book of short stories based on my personal experiences of spiritualism, rosicrucianism and freemasonry, following on a traumatic and tragic accident which turned my world upside down and showed me a bigger picture. 

I curate the Comyns Beaumont Archive with the Du Maurier family, and, through RESONANCE BookWorks, publish titles by Comyns Beaumont, J W Dunne and David Lindsay, along with books on related topics by well-known authors previously out of print, as well as works by new writers.

We also have a Puppet Museum with a Punch & Judy Show, which might seem a wee bit incongruous, but when you watch the film you'll be surprised to see how many seemingly weirdly-placed dots actually do join up!


Mark Windows

I am a film-maker and researcher. I also have a weekly show Windows on the World which covers the news not found in the mainstream. The show was an instant hit on The People's Voice TV and has carried on covering ancient history and global geopolitics, and giving a wider view of what is going on in the world. 

I have been making documentaries, news features and even music videos for quite some time. My first ever short documentary gets a mention on the Walthamstow Wikipedia page. 

My latest feature documentary is about legendary Shadows bassist Jet Harris. The film is distributed by Wienerworld and has many five star reviews.

I like observational documentaries where the story comes from the subjects rather than just a “what if..” or linear voice-over of events. My documentaries reflect this, concentrating on the subjects to create the narrative.


Our friends:

We have on board Dr John Hart from the National CV of Britain; Christopher Toyne - grandson of William Comyns Beaumont, the renowned pre-Velikovsky catastrophist uncle of Daphne Du Maurier; Igor Witkowski, the noted researcher into historical secret weapons programs, and sixties' icon Donovan, whose interest in Atlantis and Bacon's St Albans is legendary.


BRITAIN - SHATTERED ISLES is a massive story and a game-changing theory for history. The film will explore Britain and its forgotten past in a journey through ancient texts, hidden history and megalithic sites.

The catastrophe that shattered the great land mass of Hyperborea to form the British Isles caused what has been referred to as “collective amnesia” - a feeling of loss for something we may not consciously recall, but which lives on in every story ever told.

The rewriting of history after the Roman invasion deliberately obscured the fascinating past of The British Isles, turning it eventually - and significantly - into the 'United Kingdom'.

With our own meticulous research and the help of many experts in the ancient history of Britain our film will give a revealing view of the past and present, showing how and why Britain's true history has been hidden for 2,000 years. Most importantly, it will become clear just what this means geopolitically today.

There are those who have always known about this hidden past, but they cannot admit to the truth  and  preserve the status quo...

BRITAIN - SHATTERED ISLES brings this dark history to light. It literally does change your world.


Campaign:

Your contribution will help way beyond the funding of the film. The story we are presenting is a game-changer and will reveal why our history has been hidden, and what the aims of this very real historical conspiracy really are.

If you are interested in our lost heritage and the global geopolitical agenda we see around us, your contribution will help reveal the nature of a plan centuries in the making, and the reason why it cannot be allowed to continue.

This film is not only politically but philosophically important; it reunites the British with their hidden past, showing in plain sight just how long history has been manipulated by the few to control the many.


What your contribution means:

Because of our experience we can work on a very low income stream. This film, however, needs funding to cover contributions from well-known and professional guests - scientists, historians, actors and musicians - and not only production but travel costs, to access archives all over the country. The filming and editing involves many locations and a lot of time, but our combined editing and directing experience makes this much easier. We are a small and highly efficient team.

Through our contacts with expert production personnel we can make this feature-length film for much less than a regular feature documentary. We have access to the best post-production facilities in the UK, and can use downtime in these facilities to master the film for international broadcast, DVD or TV.


How we will use the money:

We have allocated £5,000 for location, travel and guest contributors. For production costs, filming, editing and post-production we have allocated £15,000. For research, script and copyright issues we need only £5,000, as we have carried out fifteen years' combined research on the content of this film.     


How else you can help: 

Look into the ancient history of Britain, Noah's Ark, Punch & Judy, and even Dr Who - it may join up some dots for you too. 

Pass on the info, talk about the film with your friends, love each other and wish us well. If you have anything you think would help - research, practical skills, whatever... do let us know. 

 

There will be screenings in London, Bristol, York, Newcastle and Edinburgh. Dates to be confirmed later.


Next year we will organise Magical Mystery Tours to some of the locations featured in the film. Separate tours will cover Bristol, Avebury and Stonehenge; York and Harrogate; Edinburgh, and the Scottish Isles.

story:
In Russian - Русский

What it’s all about

«Lubovi Skotoprigonyevska» is an independent non-profit full-length feature film based on The Brothers Karamazov, F. Dostoevsky’s last and most magnificent novel. The action centers round the brothers Karamazov’s struggle with their women, their passions and God. The detective line of the murder runs in the background. In the foreground there is a love story of a teenage girl in a wheelchair and Aleksey Karamazov, the youngest brother, who is torn apart by his brothers’ passions and his brothers’ women, because they consider him to be an angel and the only person able to help in their complicated relations. The film explores the Human at the highest point of internal stresses and contradictions. In a situation of choice and overcome by their passions, will these people forgive each other and who will stay alive?

Why it is important 

Dostoyevsky helps us to understand ourselves. At some point in life, all of us will meet a person who'll become important to us and the situation may not always be so simple. What should one do, and how is it possible to survive a betrayal? How can one overcome oneself without destroying the opponent? How can one overcome the pain, stay alive and forgive the other person? Keeping in touch with Dostoevsky’s characters we can change our souls and the world around us.

Our project is international. And we hope that the number of people who help us will grow. 

Now Jan Eilhardt, an аlternative filmmaker from Germany, has joined us and he is willing to help us work on the script: 


Fire Natasha from Spain, who sings anything from opera to rock, plays the violin, is also with us: 


Franziska Junge, the beautiful actress from Berlin, involved in our project: 


We are supported by the musicians Laury Sommers and Liis Keerberg - authentic nature guys from Estonia:


Why donate

We have already started. The film is being shooting since September 2015. 

Our team is working without payment, dreaming of being linked to this great work and Dostoevsky’s genius. 


However, making a film is one thing.  Making a quality film is another, and they are largely separated by budget.  

We need this 96К USD to make the quality film, and even that will be cutting it close, but we are confident we can do it.  This is where the money will be allocated:  

Meet our crew 


What happens if the campaign doesn't reach our goal?

If we do not reach the required goal, we will work with any amount we will receive with joy, love and appreciation! Above all, we are committed to giving you the backer rewards you deserve! Meeting our goal would be amazing, but any contribution, no matter how big or small, will be helpful in allowing us to complete the film.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, you can still help us out tremendously. Please, share this project with everyone you know! Share on social media, with friends and family, fans of russian culture and literature, or with anyone may be interested in this film. Thank you!

www.lubovithemovie.ru

www.fb.com/LuboviSkotoprigonyevska/

Русский

Этот фильм откроет новый взгляд 
на великого автора и его ключевое произведение

О чем наш фильм?

«Любови Скотопригоньевска» - независимый некоммерческий полнометражный художественный фильм по мотивам последнего и самого удивительного романа Достоевского "Братья Карамазовы".  В центре событий  - борьба братьев Карамазовых с женщинами, со страстями, с Богом. Детективная линия убийства  проходит на заднем плане. На переднем - любовь девочки-подростка в инвалидном кресле и Алексея Карамазова, которого разрывают братья и их женщины, так как считают человеком ангелом, который один только может помочь в их сложнейших запутанных отношениях. Фильм исследует Человека в высочайшей точке его внутреннего напряжения и противоречий. В ситуации выбора и преодоления своих страстей. Смогут ли эти люди простить друг друга, и кто вообще останется жив? 

Почему это важно?

В жизни каждого происходят судьбоносные встречи, нам открывается великий дар любви. Но реальность не всегда наполнена радужными красками. Как пережить предательство близких? Как преодолеть боль и остаться самим собой? Как простить другого, переступив через свои принципы? Герои Достоевского помогают нам изменить и собственную душу и окружающий мир.

Наш проект международный. С каждым днем мы все больше и больше ощущаем поддержку совершенно разных людей со всех уголков планеты.

Совсем недавно к нам присоединился альтернативный кинорежиссёр из Германии Jan Eilhardt. Он готов помочь в работе над сценарием:

В нашей команде и Наташа из Испании - пламенная, страстная натура, голосу которой подвластны все жанры от оперы до рока, которая также удивительно и проникновенно играет на скрипке:

Franziska Junge, прекрасная актриса из Берлина, участвует в нашем проекте: 

Участники проекта - музыканты из Эстонии Laury Sommers и Liis Keerberg, тонкие ценители нетронутой в своей чистоте и первозданности Природы:

Мы просим поддержки!

Мы уже начали съемки. Работа над фильмом ведется с сентября 2015 года. 

Наша команда работает безвозмездно, вдохновленная возможностью прикоснуться к великому произведению бессмертного гения Достоевского.


Однако, снимать фильм это одно, а вот сделать в результате качественную профессиональную работу – совсем другое, и чтобы эти два полюса соединились, безусловно, потребуется определенный бюджет. 

Для завершения проекта нам необходимо 96 000$. И мы верим, что с помощью людей, которые разделяют нашу страсть, сможем это сделать. Вот как будет распределен бюджет: 



Представляем нашу команду:



Если цель проекта не будет достигнута, 

мы, несомненно, продолжим работать над фильмом и будем рады любой сумме, которую примем от вас с огромной признательностью! И конечно же, мы обещаем отблагодарить вас не только словами, но и выбранной вами наградой за спонсорскую поддержку! Конечно, будет просто замечательно, если мы достигнем своей финансовой цели, но любой вклад, независимо от того, большой он или маленький, очень ценен для нас, позволяя нашему делу шаг за шагом воплощаться в жизнь.

Как еще вы можете помочь?

Даже если Вы не можете оказать нам финансовую поддержку, мы очень просим вас помочь другими средствами. Пожалуйста, расскажите о нашем проекте всем, кого вы знаете! Напишите о фильме в социальных сетях, поделитесь этой информацией с друзьями и семьей, с любителями русской культуры и литературы, со всеми, кто может заинтересоваться нашим фильмом. Присоединяйтесь к нам в социальных сетях и подписывайтесь на сайте! Большое спасибо!

story:
SHORT SUMMARY



He will be accompanied by several teams who will not interfere in the naturalness of the process, but will help him feel protected and open. At some point this journey will be like reality-show or a street musical, but the most important thing is the documentary story in which the hero will live here and now. A multimillion audience will be gathered after 10 days of regular live streams. And a little bit later the world of cinema will enrich itself with another story of genuine human values.



The authors of the film have personally experienced this state of mind to the full extent, but they managed to change their fate, breaking through what is predestinated and irresistible. 

Family history of Natalia and Anna, mother and daughter, became the basis of the script for a documentary "House". Now they together with their team are authors of a cycle of nostalgic genre projects: a series "Farland", a musical "Escape!", a historical reconstruction "Fortezzo". To help people who have lost touch with their homeland is the meaning of our service in the art. Writers, operators, designers gathered around us. obsessed with the same idea of making the world better.



Before we started this work we discussed all possible obstacles and project concepts. Being an expedition through a dynamic reality, our project is is rafting, so let us use it as a basis. And if we do not blow away all the obstacles, then we will just pass them. Our main goal is to pass all the rueful feelings straight to the spectator. Until this moment we never had a bad experience. But do we have an alternative course of action? Yes, we do. First is to sell the TV channels the right of public display. The second one is to gain support from Indian Embassy in Ukraine and to appeal for promotion of our Project in Indian diaspora all over the world, which is the second biggest diaspora in the world after a Chinese one– 25 million people. Besides, our character is a future diplomat, so it seems to us that his colleagues’ loyalty is free from risk.


Our journey has several important components. In the first place, it is our character’s live streams form different cities in India. On coming in contact with the place his soul comes to life – here is my school, I first threw myself into a skiey river here.Through feelings of a young Indian we walk through a great path from the ancient time to our days, we dive into a culture of India, we observe stories of rise and fall of empires, of big and proud cities. On this side of the screen, we all become brave travelers together with the young and fearless heart that burns with love to his two homelands. Victor becomes our guide into another world, mostly closed for the fair faced. A mystical and evanescent world. A saree of illusions of the young traveler will be softly unreeled.



NATALKA KORZH
Writer and Director

If I ever get prohibited to generate ideas even for an hour, “tomorrow” will never come. Natalia got a film director education in the Kyiv National I. K. Karpenko-Kary Theatre, Cinema and Television University in 2006. By that time, she was a certified journalist by that time and was promoting an all-Ukrainian printed media. She conducted several investigations, visited some flash points as an analytics journalist. But her creative side came over the passion and bravery. Early International documentary festivals brought her prizes. A film-portrait “I will go back to my town” won the nomination “Movie about life” on the “Time Ribbon” Festival, and her film-reconstruction “Peresopnytsia Gospel” about creating the relic in the 15th century got “Litopys” gran-prix. People like Natalia are often called a God-given talent. They’ve got a unique talent to feel and reveal people, a unique skill to become a lifelong friend from first minutes. This is the pre-condition for Natalia being a portrait genre master in documentary film directing. «Half-Blood Prince Returns» is the most reverent project for Natalia since she is an author of a unique idea as well as its producer. Now it’s up to you to decide on the futurity of nostalgic trend in general, performed by a skydivefilm.com team, and on the consistency of this very project in particular.

ANNA KORZH
Writer and Director

   Anna is a professional violinist and a film director. One can say she has a perfect pitch to human soul. This year she graduates the Kyiv National I. K. Karpenko-Kary Theatre, Cinema and Television University, and after that she wants to do the round world trip with a camera and to make notes from the most interesting places on Earth.  In 2016 Anna was elected as a member of student jury of DocuDays, international festival of documentary films. Being a curator of the program of documentary films in Public Association “CUC” (Contempоrary Ukrainian Cinema) Anna held unforgettable meetings with directors of fresh documentary masterpieces. Her own documentary “House” has seen almost all Europe and reached the heart of every spectator. The film is about life of a man, whose biography was complemented with a line of war, who lost his home. This is a deep tragedy about our present day country. As a director Anna couldn’t omit this topic, especially since she had personally experienced the pain.  This year Anna is going to represent her first fiction film “At The Depth”.

NATALIYA EDWARDS
Executive Producer

       Nataliya Edwards has produced and directed several independent films and web productions in the Ukraine, Kiev and New Mexico area. She has graduated from National University of Cinema and Television (Kiev, Ukraine, TV production-Director) and CNM College (certified in Film Crew Tech. and Post Production program). Talie is experienced in producing and directing a documentary film “A Smile Instinct“, where she had united two countries (USA and Ukraine) and investigated “where a smile came from?”.Last summer she traveled from NY, NY to Florida, Miami with a group of children from the folklore group “Golden gates” from Russia (San-Petersburg) and Georgia (Tbilisi). Through the Traditional Russian and Georgian songs, dances and music those kids opened their hearts and souls and showed them that it is necessary to live in Peace. The name of Documentary film where Talie is a Producer and a Director is “I want to Hug the World”.

PAVEL KOLCHYN 
Chief Cameraman

This ever-smiling man can be seen floating above the surface with a camera on support. The trick of levitation movements lies in an almost invisible hoverboard. Those familiar with this magical device know how hard it is to keep balance on it, but in our situation Pavel shoots on high speed and with marvelous accuracy.  Perhaps, this is due to a 20-year experience in film making and TV-production. Pavel can see the unusual in ordinary things. He does this equally professionally both with 8 cameras on PTS and with a single camera on a quadcopter. These skills laid a basis of his professional success and high demand in Poland, China, Sri Lanka, Georgia, Russia, Kazakhstan, Greece, and Croatia. He spent seven years studying psychology and human subconsciousness, and now he is teaching young cameramen to visualize illusions in a film school “World of Cinema”. His work was honoured with the Order of Saint George the Trophy Bearer of the second degree. Maybe art is a lie, but at the same time lie is a truth, Pavel suggests.

ALEXEY BAZANOV
Designer 
     

A real magician of post-production. Compositing, animation, color correcting and titles – these are a small part of his professional skills. He began his career as a junior staff scientist at the Academy of Legal Sciences of Ukraine, developed and supported web-sites, published his research and even patented his own invention in the sphere of legal informatics. Having thoroughly mastered paint and vector graphic editing software, compositing, 3d-tracking and video-editing, Alexey now devolves his knowledge to other professionals and controls a big team of creative designers. He is keen on photography and traveling.

ALEKSANDR YEREMENKO
Video Editor

Aleksandr has 15 years of experience as a director. He took part in plenty of projects. He rose through the ranks from TV-news to authorial TV shows, “Exclamation mark” being one of them on TVi. Took part in shooting advertising videoclips. He has a creative approach to shooting process and maintains a friendly atmosphere on a shooting location.
MYROSLAV HERASYMOVYCH 

Scriptwriter

Head of Cinema Department at School of Arts (independent arts union and authors group), a movie scriptwriter.


We are from Germany, America, Ukraine, but we all have the same roots, and we all have a TV and movie experience in different countries. It is not by chance that we came together around a key idea – to preserve a sense of our own homeland. About 35 million of ethnic Ukrainians have been born or settled far beyond their home country.

Our character Victor, after 18 years in India, is living in Ukraine now. He is 20, but little time will pass and his choice of the country will become a decisive decision. Where his children will be born, what religion shall they choose, ideals of which nation he will serve to? It is possible that the trip to his roots and meeting with his father can potentially give Victor his fateful decisions, and it's up to you to help him to make a right choice.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading this campaign all over the word is a huge help. House us when we're in town for a festival or buy us a drink, because all of our spare change goes to this project.

She conducted several investigations, visited some flash points as an analytics journalist. But her creative side came over the passion and bravery. Early International documentary festivals brought her prizes. A film-portrait “I will go back to my town” won the nomination “Movie about life” on the “Time Ribbon” Festival, and her film-reconstruction “Peresopnytsia Gospel” about creating the relic in the 15th century got “Litopys” gran-prix. People like Natalia are often called a God-given talent. They’ve got a unique talent to feel and reveal people, a unique skill to become a lifelong friend from first minutes. This is the pre-condition for Natalia being a portrait genre master in documentary film directing. «Half-Blood Prince Returns» is the most reverent project for Natalia since she is an author of a unique idea as well as its producer. Now it’s up to you to decide on the futurity of nostalgic trend in general, performed by a skydivefilm.com team, and on the consistency of this very project in particular.
ANNA KORZHWriter and Director
   Anna is a professional violinist and a film director. One can say she has a perfect pitch to human soul. This year she graduates the Kyiv National I. K. Karpenko-Kary Theatre, Cinema and Television University, and after that she wants to do the round world trip with a camera and to make notes from the most interesting places on Earth.  In 2016 Anna was elected as a member of student jury of DocuDays, international festival of documentary films. Being a curator of the program of documentary films in Public Association “CUC” (Contempоrary Ukrainian Cinema) Anna held unforgettable meetings with directors of fresh documentary masterpieces. Her own documentary “House” has seen almost all Europe and reached the heart of every spectator. The film is about life of a man, whose biography was complemented with a line of war, who lost his home. This is a deep tragedy about our present day country. As a director Anna couldn’t omit this topic, especially since she had personally experienced the pain.  This year Anna is going to represent her first fiction film “At The Depth”.
NATALIYA EDWARDSExecutive Producer
       Nataliya Edwards has produced and directed several independent films and web productions in the Ukraine, Kiev and New Mexico area. She has graduated from National University of Cinema and Television (Kiev, Ukraine, TV production-Director) and CNM College (certified in Film Crew Tech. and Post Production program). Talie is experienced in producing and directing a documentary film “A Smile Instinct“, where she had united two countries (USA and Ukraine) and investigated “where a smile came from?”.Last summer she traveled from NY, NY to Florida, Miami with a group of children from the folklore group “Golden gates” from Russia (San-Petersburg) and Georgia (Tbilisi). Through the Traditional Russian and Georgian songs, dances and music those kids opened their hearts and souls and showed them that it is necessary to live in Peace. The name of Documentary film where Talie is a Producer and a Director is “I want to Hug the World”.

PAVEL KOLCHYN Chief Cameraman



This ever-smiling man can be seen floating above the surface with a camera on support. The trick of levitation movements lies in an almost invisible hoverboard. Those familiar with this magical device know how hard it is to keep balance on it, but in our situation Pavel shoots on high speed and with marvelous accuracy.  Perhaps, this is due to a 20-year experience in film making and TV-production. Pavel can see the unusual in ordinary things. He does this equally professionally both with 8 cameras on PTS and with a single camera on a quadcopter. These skills laid a basis of his professional success and high demand in Poland, China, Sri Lanka, Georgia, Russia, Kazakhstan, Greece, and Croatia. He spent seven years studying psychology and human subconsciousness, and now he is teaching young cameramen to visualize illusions in a film school “World of Cinema”. His work was honoured with the Order of Saint George the Trophy Bearer of the second degree. Maybe art is a lie, but at the same time lie is a truth, Pavel suggests.
ALEXEY BAZANOVDesigner      A real magician of post-production. Compositing, animation, color correcting and titles – these are a small part of his professional skills. He began his career as a junior staff scientist at the Academy of Legal Sciences of Ukraine, developed and supported web-sites, published his research and even patented his own invention in the sphere of legal informatics. Having thoroughly mastered paint and vector graphic editing software, compositing, 3d-tracking and video-editing, Alexey now devolves his knowledge to other professionals and controls a big team of creative designers. He is keen on photography and traveling.


ALEKSANDR YEREMENKOVideo EditorAleksandr has 15 years of experience as a director. He took part in plenty of projects. He rose through the ranks from TV-news to authorial TV shows, “Exclamation mark” being one of them on TVi. Took part in shooting advertising videoclips. He has a creative approach to shooting process and maintains a friendly atmosphere on a shooting location.


MYROSLAV HERASYMOVYCH Scriptwriter
Head of Cinema Department at School of Arts (independent arts union and authors group), a movie scriptwriter.




We are from Germany, America, Ukraine, but we all have the same roots, and we all have a TV and movie experience in different countries. It is not by chance that we came together around a key idea – to preserve a sense of our own homeland. About 35 million of ethnic Ukrainians have been born or settled far beyond their home country.
Our character Victor, after 18 years in India, is living in Ukraine now. He is 20, but little time will pass and his choice of the country will become a decisive decision. Where his children will be born, what religion shall they choose, ideals of which nation he will serve to? It is possible that the trip to his roots and meeting with his father can potentially give Victor his fateful decisions, and it's up to you to help him to make a right choice.







Other Ways You Can Help
Spreading this campaign all over the word is a huge help. House us when we're in town for a festival or buy us a drink, because all of our spare change goes to this project.

story:
Final update:

Hi everyone,

I want to sincerely thank each and every individual for their contributions. Although, we did not reach 5k, it was a very successful campaign. You will all leave a permanent positive stain in my life that I shall never forget for you. We have been filming for the past 2 weeks, working around the clock to get the best scenes. We are working with expert directors, artists, heart surgery survivors, and supporters to present the best story. My surgery is scheduled for Sunday the 12th of February 2017. By God's grace and your prayers I will make it through just like I have last year, God willing. 
Regardless of the outcome of my surgery, I will accept what ever comes my way. My dream had always been to become a professional filmmaker and thanks to you my dream is becoming a reality.


Thanks to all the contributors! I'd hope to impact your life positively just like you've impacted mine.

Best,
Ahmed Deiab.

Update 2: 

Dear friends,

I wanted to take a moment to really thank you for the efforts you have made towards this campaign by contributing, sharing, or encouraging people to get involved. I am deeply moved by your support. It is great to be shown that I'm not alone and the people close to me are so supportive, loving, and caring. Thank you, truly!!!

I wanted to update you. Because of you, I have been able to buy the filming equipment. We will start filming right away and will keep you frequently updated.

From this point forward, all contributions will be allocated for the cost of my surgery.

 

 

Update: Watch Ahmed's live TV interview where he tells his story and discusses the documentary: https://youtu.be/7soEp9_j7W0

My name is Ahmed Deiab, I am 25 years old and I was diagnosed with congenital heart defects in January 2016.

I didn't experience any significant symptoms until after my first open heart surgery that involved changing the aortic valve and replacing it with a mechanical one. Dr. Yehia Balbaa is my surgeon who performed the operation in Feb 2016.

During my recovery stage, around October 2016, I found out that I have to undergo a second open heart surgery ASAP because my mitral valve is failing and my heart is functioning at 60% efficiency.

I am an accountant by profession and my passion is film production, screenwriting, and film directing. My first success is a play 'Bas Inta Mesh Shamem' currently running in Cairo's Miami theatre.

I want to thank my parents, my brothers, my relatives, and most definitely my friends who've been soooooo supportive to me. Thank you. I love you. And I want to tell you that you are part of the reason why I am still alive and that you are part of my success.

A few weeks ago I was sitting in my office at work staring at the outside through my window, contemplating about my second operation and recalling the medical complications I experienced after my first operation. My heart began to ache, I was sick to my stomach and I was feeling depressed. Then I snapped. I thought I have to stay busy for the next few weeks until find myself getting sedated for the second operation. The idea that came to mind is filming a documentary, about what I've been going through.

I pitched the idea to my friends, my family, and my colleagues - they couldn't be more supportive. I want to reach out to you through this campaign. I need your help so I can share my story and so I can inspire and motivate those who been or are going through a similar health problem.

Open heart surgeries are expensive and therefore your contributions will be allocated to the partial cost of the surgery and making the documentary. 

If you have any questions or concerns or you would like to know more, please don't hesitate to reach me via e-mail: ahmed.deiab@gmail.com 

Thank you. I love you all.

Our Team

Director

Ahmed Deiab is an Egyptian writer and filmmaker. Deiab worked as an assistant director in various short films and documentaries. This film is his directorial debut. His play “Bas Inta Mesh Shamem” is currently playing in theaters, and features the Egyptian star FathiAbdelWahab and a group of young promising actors. He has also completed writing a screenplay for his first feature film and in process of marketing it.

Producer

Karim Shabaan is a Cairo-based filmmaker with plenty of experimental endeavors under his belt. Starting around 2006, he has worked in a variety of styles, from experimental short films to advertising, music videos, documentaries and short feature films. His first feature film Fi Youm (In a Day) was awarded a 'Special Mention' at the Cairo International Film Festival 37th edition (2015).

 

What do we need?

We are currently in the process of producing the film and therefore we need your help and support. I'd like to mention that our crew believe in this project and they love it therefore they are volunteering their time, effort and compensation. However, we still need your help and support in funding filming equipment, sound rig etc... After production we will need your support with post production phase which includes editing. I would like to emphasize that this film is inspired by a true story representing real events and people. By supporting us you're not just supporting a film, you are joining a journey, a dream that represent you and us.

Last message

We believe in this documentary and we will make it no matter what. If we don´t receive the full amount (5,000$), your contributions will still go towards making ‘Open Heart’. We are immensely grateful for all the support you can offer us. If you can't contribute you can still help by sharing our Indiegogo page on your social media and with people you think might be interested.

story:
LINKS

http://www.facebook.com/forsakenfilm

http://www.instagram.com/forsakenfilm/

SHORT SUMMARY 

‘Forsaken’ will touch on a number of themes that we believe are highly relevant to our society at this time: neglect, radicalism and how the world would appear, should it become destroyed by a political regime . Through Jai, our protagonist, we will explore themes of isolation, perseverance and sacrifice. We’ll start with his character initially in a flashback sequence and then a number of years later throughout. Seeing how Jai changes not only physically but through the performance will hopefully convey how years under a regime and isolation has impacted him. With this we hope our audience can relate, in the sense of identifying how their own hardships have changed them, thus making our character accessible. We’ll use the robotic character of YL0 to create a relationship for Jai and to show that in times of isolation, our companions become those we sometimes overlook or least expect. This interesting dynamic between human and machine is built upon a number of nuances in the dialogue written throughout, but also through the cinematography and physical interaction too. Early in the film, Jai’s reason for staying on the planet is established as being the long search for his brother Kalen. This motivation is truly the ultimate driving force of the film’s narrative and Jai’s character arc. His perseverance to reach a defined end goal gives the story shape. It is also another element of the film that will connect our audiences to the story. We hope they will identify with sticking by something and being unrelenting in the hurdles that arise. Following this we’ll explore the idea of sacrifice, where through challenges in his journey, Jai will have to make decisions of what to let go of and how to cope with the loss of what has been ‘forsaken’. In wider relation to our own world, our film will also look at the repercussions of war, from some exploration of PSTD to the consequences on the environment itself. 

MISSION OBJECTIVE

In order to authentically present a world torn apart by war, access to a truly suited location is key. After a long location scout, we have chosen to shoot mainly in the countryside of Lithuania. Here we have a number of derelict settings at our disposal. We also have great connections and support from locals. Now here is where we need your help! Your donations will allow us to transport our sizeable crew and actors that are based in London, to Lithuania. We will also need to transport our equipment safely and securely. Relating back to creating the authentic world of the film, your money will also support our art department. A number of props and costumes are to be created by talented production designers, who will no doubt make this planet almost tangible on screen. They will also be working to put together YL0. Our robotic character is to be constructed as a fully functioning and flying drone, with detailed paint work to finish.

IMPACT

For ‘Forsaken’, we are looking to employ the skills of a VFX artist. We understand the power of special effects in the genre and hope to enhance key moments to be visually rich and powerful. Ultimately though, we are making a film rooted in practicality. This hopefully allows us to present the true grit of a post-war world but also let Jai’s character and story shine through. In terms of the off-screen impact, the film will be followed by a social media campaign, the foundations of which have already been laid. Prospectively we look to create a film that has the potential to be submitted to a number of film festivals internationally and allow our investors to be part of the success as executive producers. Please also note, we are very favourable of product placement queries and your opinions on the script. 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES 

We are very excited to be working on such an ambitious project with such an international team. However, we understand there are a number of challenges we face. Firstly we’ll be experiencing a cold Lithuanian winter that goes down to even -20°C degrees. Notably, a lot of our film is shot outdoors. Fortunately, with enough money raised we will be able to sufficiently provide our cast and crew(and even equipment!) with suitable means of warmth. Another challenge will be successfully finding the right faces for the characters we have on paper. No doubt through the extensive casting we have planned, we will be able to find actors who’s talents shine through. Yet with funding, we will look to really take care of them both through expenses and a great working relationship. Finally, we aim to construct every scene of the film with a precise attention to detail. No doubt this will be a challenge for the short time in which the shoot is allocated. However, funding will allow us to invest in extra time at the locations if needed. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN SUPPORT

Even if you are unable to provide a financial contribution, we would still kindly ask you to get in touch with us if you’ve felt intrigued by our proposal. Whether you would just like to read the script, contribute ideas or even like any kind of role in the film please contact us. We appreciate any support for ‘Forsaken’ and look forward to bringing you more from us in 2017. Don't forget to make use of the Indiegogo share tools and visit our social media pages for updates on the film. We can't wait to hear from you soon!

You can also check out some of our director's previous work below:

http://www.joshuafernandezoxby.com

http://danielramfilm.tumblr.com

Our best,

The team of 'Forsaken'

Don't forget to make use of the Indiegogo share tools and visit our social media pages for updates on the film. We can't wait to hear from you soon!
You can also check out some of our director's previous work below:
http://www.joshuafernandezoxby.com
http://danielramfilm.tumblr.com
Our best,
The team of 'Forsaken'

story:
What is it about? Real Lemons tells the story of two brothers in rural, conservative America. Hardened criminal Jesse, openly gay, ropes his high-spirited and naive younger brother John into committing a robbery. They both have something to gain from the money - John wants to win back his estranged ex-girlfriend, Jesse'd like to afford to live somewhere he's truly accepted - but you can't buy your way out of a rut.

Who am I? My name's Julian Buchan and I am the co-writer and director of Real Lemons. I've been obsessed with films all my life and since first getting a taste of filmmaking on a feature documentary in 2012, I have been writing and directing my own narrative short films for the last 5 years. On top of that, I have directed, produced  and edited music videos, marketing reels and assisted a feature producer and a successful TV show-runner.

Why Indiegogo? Crowdfunding evens out the playing field. It affords filmmakers, creators, inventors, who don't have access to huge funding, the means to realise their ideas and execute them at a high level. What's exciting about Indiegogo is that donors can see the impact they've made before their eyes. Not only is it an excellent platform for young filmmakers like myself, but it's also fantastic experience for the crew, great footage for the cast and could get the notice of film festivals and influencers.

How much needs to be raised and where is the money going? We need to raise $21,000. "What?! That's loads!" Well..It is and it isn't! The truth is films aren't cheap. And in this industry money goes very quickly. You have to account for full insurance coverage, crew fees, cast fees, location hire, expensive equipment rental, costumes, props, post-production, music. All of these factors amount to the stunning array of cinema we have today. And, you know, it'd be nice to also make a living sometimes - so if we reach our target we can even pay our amazing team for their hard work. Y'know, rent and food and just the cost of living.

BUT with Indiegogo it's completely doable!  A small contribution from lots of you rapidly adds up. Before you know it we'll have reached our target ! (And exceeded it you say??)

What's different about this film? What's different is that it is my first fully SAG approved film. This gives me access to truly talented actors who are part of the union. It also means the cast must be paid union-rates for their time and skill, and the pressure is oooon to deliver quality. And that's good for you because you're then guaranteed a great product.

It's important in today's political climate, where minorities threaten to be stripped of their freedom of speech and civil rights, that we continue to make films that challenge the status quo; films that try to understand what defines us and our behaviour, and who is accountable for our actions. This story hopes to contribute to that effort.

Is it risky? Of course it is. You never know how something's going to turn out. We crowdfunded for the last short I directed, ANNA, and not only exceeded our target by $1500 but the film continues to be selected and screened at festivals more than a year later (no you cynics, these aren't more alternative facts, see for yourself: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1303460128...). So if past successes are anything to go by, it's a risk worth taking.

What if we don't reach the target? Honestly, I can't let knockbacks like that get me down. None of the money donated will go to waste if we don't reach $21k. My team and I will make something great to give back to you. It may not be on the same scale but the priority here is making quality art.

What are the challenges and how will you overcome them? Locations could fall through, cast may get offers they can't turn down, crew may drop out. All of these things could happen. These factors have hindered the largest multi-million productions, but they get made anyway. Me and my devoted team are committed and assure you we can find a way to keep the show on the road. 

Other Ways You Can Help. Even if you can't financially contribute, you can spread the word! Tell your friends and family, share on social media, recommend grants that may be interested in subsidising, recommend publications, podcasts, websites that may want to feature the campaign. Every little helps.

THE CAST

Alex Feldman

Alex Feldman was born in Kiev, Ukraine, and grew up in New York. He is a graduate of The New York Conservatory For The Dramatic Arts. As an actor, Feldman has been a presence in Film, Theater and Television for over a decade. He has made guest star appearances on such hit shows as Code Black, Shooter, Law & Order, Cold Case, Without A Trace, Law & Order: Criminal Intent, CSI: Miami and In Plain Sight. Film credits include Chernobyl Diaries (Producer Oren Peli), Repo Chick (Director Alex Cox), The Bling Ring (Director Michael Lebmeck).

Alex is the CEO and founder of For Actors By Actors, a successful acting network based in Los Angeles, CA.

IMDB

Travis Owens

Texas born and Arkansas raised, Travis always had a natural knack for performing and making people laugh. In his early teens a life long passion and journey of studying different acting methods and performing comedy began. Travis later found that a love for comedy helped him mine deeper into the dramatic, by finding the flaws and idiosyncrasies of characters. A lesson of "anything to enrich the story" was quickly learned. Travis currently writes and performs comedy, and acts nationwide. 

IMDB

Rod Rondeaux

Rod Rondeaux is an actor, stuntman, horse trainer and registered member of the Crow tribe. In 20+ years of stunt work he has appeared in The Revenant, The Missing, The Lone Ranger, The Scorpion King, Wild Wild West, Texas Rising, Cowboys & Aliens, and many more films. Recently turned to acting, he has played starring roles in Meek's Cutoff (opposite Michelle Williams, pictured), the award-winning indie feature Mekko, and the soon-to-be-released Land. 

IMDB

Mekko Official Trailer

Melia Kreiling

Melia Kreiling is a Greek American actor, raised in Athens, Greece. She resides in Los Angeles, CA. Melia has trained in contemporary dance and then drama in London, England. She has worked as a dancer in Europe, and as an actor in television and film; The Borgias (Showtime), Tyrant (FX), Guardians of the Galaxy (James Gunn) and Committed (Stelana Kliris). She can be seen in the upcoming movie Mindgamers (premiering this March) alongside Sam Neil (Jurassic Park) and Tom Payne (The Walking Dead), and is currently preparing for her roles in Amazon's The Last Tycoon, and indie film The 200 by prolific greek director Pantelis Voulgaris. 

Melia has a little dog called Ouzo, she enjoys cinema by John Cassavetes, writes poetry, continues her dance training in her free time, and volunteers for rehabilitation programs for drug-addicted underaged girls, and the homeless. 

Melia is represented by CAA and Brillstein Entertainment Partners in Los Angeles, Piers Nimmo Management in the UK. 

IMDB

Isabella Applen

Isabella Applen is a Bay Area-based singer/songwriter who plays acoustic guitar. Her songs are usually whimsical, sometimes strange, and always playful. Nature is the most predominant theme across her music, though some common song topics include love, friendship, depression, and how time relates to the self. Isabella sees her music as a vehicle for expressing aspects of herself which might otherwise be unknowable; writing for her is both a form of discovery and exploration, as well as a mechanism for communication and connection. Her debut album is scheduled for release this summer. 

Instagram

 

THE CREW

Ian Asbjornsen - Director of Photography

Ian Asbjørnsen is a 2nd generation cinematographer born and raised in Los Angeles. His cinematography for music videos has premiered nationally on NBC’s Last Call with Carson Daly, mtvU, and the online sites Spin Mag, Pitchfork, Noisy, XXL Magazine, Brainfeeder Records, Glamour Mag UK, and Topshop. Commercial projects include AT&T and UK televised informercials, and documentary work can be seen on City Walk, the LA Emmy nominated national television series. He was the recipient of the International Cinematographers Guild Scholarship Award while he was attending USC’s School of Cinematic Arts for his M.F.A. Ian has trained extensively under veteran cinematographers Gary Capo, ASC (The Thin Red Line, The Perfect Storm, Waterworld) and his father Stuart Asbjørnsen (National Geographic, Baywatch). He shot his first feature film, a visual effects-heavy science fiction film (untitled and currently in post production), in Montana in 2016.

Amy Reedy - 1st Assistant Director

Amy Reedy is a Writer-Director-Actor with her MFA from USC's Film & Television Production Program most known for writing for James Franco's feature film adaptation Don Quixote: The Ingenious Gentleman of La Mancha; for winning Best Student Film at the LA Int. Underground Film Festival for the short musical she wrote and starred in, Love Song; and for her Viral YouTube videos, with, for example, over 2 million views for the short LGBT comedy-drama she wrote and directed, Truth or Drink. Reedy recently gained online distribution for her short film Girl In Her Twenties on IndieFlix and BitPix, and GIHT was also nominated for Best Short Film at the Female Eye Film Festival in Toronto, screened at the Carmel Int. Film Festival, and played at Grauman’s Chinese Theatres in the HollyShorts Film Festival. Reedy has currently been working in the commercial side of film as well, writing and directing award-winning AT&T commercial Gelateria Uli. She has also currently written and directed over 70 commercials for health website HealthQueens, a platform with a following of over 200,000. In terms of more personal projects, she is currently in post-production for a book trailer to accompany her dystopian romantic thriller novel.

IMDB

You can share the campaign using this link: https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/2e468a70
story_txt:
What is it about? Real Lemons tells the story of two brothers in rural, conservative America. Hardened criminal Jesse, openly gay, ropes his high-spirited and naive younger brother John into committing a robbery. They both have something to gain from the money - John wants to win back his estranged ex-girlfriend, Jesse'd like to afford to live somewhere he's truly accepted - but you can't buy your way out of a rut.
Who am I? My name's Julian Buchan and I am the co-writer and director of Real Lemons. I've been obsessed with films all my life and since first getting a taste of filmmaking on a feature documentary in 2012, I have been writing and directing my own narrative short films for the last 5 years. On top of that, I have directed, produced  and edited music videos, marketing reels and assisted a feature producer and a successful TV show-runner.

Why Indiegogo? Crowdfunding evens out the playing field. It affords filmmakers, creators, inventors, who don't have access to huge funding, the means to realise their ideas and execute them at a high level. What's exciting about Indiegogo is that donors can see the impact they've made before their eyes. Not only is it an excellent platform for young filmmakers like myself, but it's also fantastic experience for the crew, great footage for the cast and could get the notice of film festivals and influencers.
How much needs to be raised and where is the money going? We need to raise $21,000. "What?! That's loads!" Well..It is and it isn't! The truth is films aren't cheap. And in this industry money goes very quickly. You have to account for full insurance coverage, crew fees, cast fees, location hire, expensive equipment rental, costumes, props, post-production, music. All of these factors amount to the stunning array of cinema we have today. And, you know, it'd be nice to also make a living sometimes - so if we reach our target we can even pay our amazing team for their hard work. Y'know, rent and food and just the cost of living.
BUT with Indiegogo it's completely doable!  A small contribution from lots of you rapidly adds up. Before you know it we'll have reached our target ! (And exceeded it you say??)

What's different about this film? What's different is that it is my first fully SAG approved film. This gives me access to truly talented actors who are part of the union. It also means the cast must be paid union-rates for their time and skill, and the pressure is oooon to deliver quality. And that's good for you because you're then guaranteed a great product.
It's important in today's political climate, where minorities threaten to be stripped of their freedom of speech and civil rights, that we continue to make films that challenge the status quo; films that try to understand what defines us and our behaviour, and who is accountable for our actions. This story hopes to contribute to that effort.

Is it risky? Of course it is. You never know how something's going to turn out. We crowdfunded for the last short I directed, ANNA, and not only exceeded our target by $1500 but the film continues to be selected and screened at festivals more than a year later (no you cynics, these aren't more alternative facts, see for yourself: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1303460128...). So if past successes are anything to go by, it's a risk worth taking.
What if we don't reach the target? Honestly, I can't let knockbacks like that get me down. None of the money donated will go to waste if we don't reach $21k. My team and I will make something great to give back to you. It may not be on the same scale but the priority here is making quality art.

What are the challenges and how will you overcome them? Locations could fall through, cast may get offers they can't turn down, crew may drop out. All of these things could happen. These factors have hindered the largest multi-million productions, but they get made anyway. Me and my devoted team are committed and assure you we can find a way to keep the show on the road. 
Other Ways You Can Help. Even if you can't financially contribute, you can spread the word! Tell your friends and family, share on social media, recommend grants that may be interested in subsidising, recommend publications, podcasts, websites that may want to feature the campaign. Every little helps.
THE CAST
Alex Feldman

Alex Feldman was born in Kiev, Ukraine, and grew up in New York. He is a graduate of The New York Conservatory For The Dramatic Arts. As an actor, Feldman has been a presence in Film, Theater and Television for over a decade. He has made guest star appearances on such hit shows as Code Black, Shooter, Law & Order, Cold Case, Without A Trace, Law & Order: Criminal Intent, CSI: Miami and In Plain Sight. Film credits include Chernobyl Diaries (Producer Oren Peli), Repo Chick (Director Alex Cox), The Bling Ring (Director Michael Lebmeck).
Alex is the CEO and founder of For Actors By Actors, a successful acting network based in Los Angeles, CA.
IMDB
Travis Owens

Texas born and Arkansas raised, Travis always had a natural knack for performing and making people laugh. In his early teens a life long passion and journey of studying different acting methods and performing comedy began. Travis later found that a love for comedy helped him mine deeper into the dramatic, by finding the flaws and idiosyncrasies of characters. A lesson of "anything to enrich the story" was quickly learned. Travis currently writes and performs comedy, and acts nationwide. 
IMDB
Rod Rondeaux
Rod Rondeaux is an actor, stuntman, horse trainer and registered member of the Crow tribe. In 20+ years of stunt work he has appeared in The Revenant, The Missing, The Lone Ranger, The Scorpion King, Wild Wild West, Texas Rising, Cowboys & Aliens, and many more films. Recently turned to acting, he has played starring roles in Meek's Cutoff (opposite Michelle Williams, pictured), the award-winning indie feature Mekko, and the soon-to-be-released Land. 
IMDB
Mekko Official Trailer

story:
Short Summary

We created this funding page to help us make our film the best it could be. The production crew consists of second year film students who study at the University of Portsmouth. With a bigger budget, we can create a more authentic and professional film which we intend to put into film festivals once finished. Your money will go towards props, costume, prosthetics, and other various expenses.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We’ve set ourselves a target of £500.

For this project we’ll be working with talented actors and we’ll be filming in multiple locations, and your money could help us get them (and ourselves) there. We’ll be buying costumes to fit our 70’s setting and we’ll be dressing our sets ideally with authentic props.The closer we get to our goal the better we can achieve the look we want.

 

In return, you could get your name in our credits, get yourself a lovely new poster or even your own digital download of our film to show your friends what you helped us make! Our campaign video demonstrates the kind of look we want to achieve, which can only be made authentic with your help. Every penny will help us!

 

Risks & Challenges

The deadline isn’t too far away and filmmaking is tough, especially in horror as it’s a difficult genre to nail. We’re looking to film in multiple locations across a few days but we’ve a great crew and a brilliant Director. We’re more than confident we’ll make a film we’re proud of and hopefully one that’ll scare you!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any contribution is appreciated, but even if you can’t a share of this page and a like on our Facebook will help us a lot too!

story:
This is far more than just a film, it’s a movement of good and of new hope, so please join me. I am reaching out to likeminded people who can help me make this film happen in whatever way they can.  ​

THE WORLD NEEDS THE ENLIGHTENMENT NOT A REVOLUTION, join me.

The Enlightenment Sci Fi Trilogy is a thought provoking and controversial series of films with modern day, relevant concepts which will resonate within so many people, producing worldwide appeal.  The concept looks at many theories from around the world, the purpose of the pyramids, reincarnation, ancient times,  the soul's’ true path, to why is the number three everywhere?

It is a battle between good and evil in modern and ancient times, to free the Earth, and it’s people 

For anyone who is serious about investing in the film, or offering their services. Once a NDA is signed i will send you the film concept, treatment, and film business plan, its very impressive.

A brief outline of the film.

The aim of the first movie is to slowly reveal to the audience the concept of the film, the horror of what is happening around us, our true purpose and what is heading towards the Earth. It will be based around three characters in modern day England. The main character is a disabled child call Anna, the chosen one, she is the key to starting the Enlightenment across the planet.  Next is David, the other lead character. He is a psychiatrist who works in the same hospital as Anna, and also a talented psychic. The third Melchior, is an advanced human, sent to earth to find and protect Anna and attempt to guide her to the Magi elders

A brief film interpretation 

My interpretation of the film will start in a slow, dark, visual manner. At first Anna, the hero of and main character in the film will be portrayed as being evil and disturbed and will be taken to a hospital for the mentally insane. David, the other lead character, he is a psychiatrist who works in the same hospital as Anna, and also a talented physic. He lives in a ram shackled, isolated, old dark house situated on the beach front near to woodlands.  He will be surrounded by sinister spirits. The first part of the film will be slow, dark and eerie.

The film will then lead into wonder and mystery as David is also searching for the truth, he senses all is not right with the world and is fascinated by ancient Sumerian texts, the pyramids, and world conspiracies. He is concerned with the recently found Planet X, which the Sumerians named Nibru and the dangers this has to the Earth.

The world needs a revolution of Enlightenment not a revolution of more weaponry and aggression.  By viewing our levels of intelligence as a marker of achievement in our lives we limit our own abilities of creative and psychological freedoms of our consciousness.  This film has the ability of breaking through these self-inflicted barriers which cause fear and aggression toward others leading to bigotry, discrimination and hate.

The opportunity of furthering mankind through ways we already know within our own psyche are the only way to peace and harmony. We will all understand far more about our own path in this life and our true purpose, this can be achieved without fear, self-doubt, and control.

We have within us all a knowing of a unity of oneness toward our fellow man/woman and a communion with the Earth that no one wants destroyed but unless we do raise our consciousness and live with understanding of our true purpose this will never be achieved.

story:
About the Film

Cécile is a cinematic exploration of coming-of-age in an American circus after WWII. It follows the life of Cécile Lechance, a young French woman who is forced to replace her late mother in a dual trapeze act alongside her mourning father. Trying desperately to fit into American culture at the same time, Cécile struggles to balance her identity as a woman, a performer, and a daughter to a broken man. One day, she meets Jean, a Carnie transgender man working the ropes, and discovers the very change she's been searching for. 

 

Circus Dreams 

This film was inspired by a real life introduction to the extravagant setting of a circus and the intriguing characters who continue to live within it. At a time of uncertainty and fight for acceptance, this film explores the heart of our current social struggles in the magic of a performance space and a post-war era. 

 

Why do we need your help? 

Script, crew, and most of the actors in place – we are now heading into pre-production and production. This means that every dollar you donate will directly help us cover the cost of: building the circus set, hiring talented crew, paying for location fees, work shopping scripts, casting actors, renting high-quality equipment, providing on-set catering, paying for music composition, and much more. 

Our last film, "Sasha," was made on a micro budget of only about $3,000 total! It was well-received in festivals and picked up awards for best actress, director, and cinematography. So if given the opportunity to fulfill our new vision with the necessary budget – you can trust us to deliver! 

 

Every Dollar Counts.

It's true, every single dollar makes a difference. So if you're reading this and asking yourself, will my 5, 10, or 20 dollars count? The answer is YES, absolutely. Making a film costs a lot of money and we need all the help we get get, from every lunch to every stand we rent. The great thing about IndieGoGo is that we get to keep every dollar we raise. So really guys, every dollar counts and it means everything to us.  

 

About Us

Director / Co-Writer: Jonathan Chekroune

Jonathan Chekroune has been working as a freelance director and cinematographer for almost eight years now. After studying film in Miami, he worked as a grip on set for several years and eventually he worked his way up to directing small music videos and commercials. After several years, Chekroune now has worked with companies, such as L'Oreal, Christie's, and Royal Caribbean. His last short film 'Sasha' was very well received at film festivals around the world including Cannes Film Festival's Short Film Corner. He is currently based in New York City.  - www.chekroune.com

 

Producer: Jennifer Sharpe

Hailing from the indie film scene in Canada, Jennifer Sharpe is a filmmaker who looks to shed light on our shared human experiences and create content with purpose. 

Traceable, her feature length documentary, is set against the backdrop of the fast-fashion industry and our increasing disconnect of where and how clothing is made. Traceable had its world premiere at the Raindance Film Festival in London, UK, and was distributed by Pivot TV in the USA; and by Bell Media (MTV Canada, Bravo, E!) in Canada. 

To support her love of documentary filmmaking, Jennifer directs and produces a wide range of video content that has taken her to far-away corners of the globe.  She is best known for coming in under-budget. 

Jennifer currently lives in Brooklyn, NY  

http://www.jenniferksharpe.com/

 

Cinematographer: Alex Hill

Alexander Hill is a Cinematographer based in New York. Born in Germany to a family in the armed services, he was able to see many parts of the world early in his life.  This is where he discovered his love of story telling.  His works allows him to blend this interest along with both art and technology.  Alex focuses on narrative and commercial work, often specializing in beauty and fashion pieces.  He has shot campaigns for L'Oréal, S'well Bottle, eBay, Stella Artois, Adore Me, and several fashion brands.  He has also recently collaborated with George Pelecanos, independent film producer and former writer for The Wire, on his most recent short film, Confidential Informant, adapted from the short story.  Alex first worked with Jonathan Chekroune on his short film Sasha.  - http://alexanderhill.tv/​ 

 

Writer: Matt Stall

Matt Stall studied Creative Writing and Film History at Miami University, Oxford, OH as well as Screen Writing and Film Production at Full Sail University, Winter Park, FL on his way to two degrees.  He has written or co-written several short films and ghost writes material for a popular YouTube personality.  CECILE is Matt's first collaboration with Jonathan Checkroune.

 

Editor: Ryan Devine

Ryan Devine is an editor at Giaronomo Productions, a movie trailer house in New York City. He's worked on marketing campaigns for major motion pictures such as Rogue One: A Star Wars Story, Arrival and Kingsman: The Secret Service, among many others. He grew up in Centerville, Ohio and studied video production at Ohio University. 

 https://vimeo.com/ryandevine

 

Composer: Ben Devine

Ben Devine is a sound mixer and composer. He first collaborated with Jonathan Chekroune on "Sasha" which won him Best Score Award at the 2016 NYC Indie Film Festival. 

https://soundcloud.com/bendevine7
