story:
Welcome to Kegland!

Hello Fellow Keggies,

Killer Keg is the new horror comedy from indie director Brad Leo Lyon (Little Creeps/Monsters on Main Street/Roommates) filming this winter on the Sun Coast of Florida. It's Groundhog Day meets Happy Death Day as a group of friends decide to throw a kegger to cheer up a friend after his girlfriend dumps him. Problem? Well, the mysterious keg they find for the party causes them to relive the same day over and over again and with each new day another person disappears. 

We're the team behind such movies as Little Creeps which starred Dustin Diamond and Lark Voorhies of Saved By the Bell, the late great horror icon Robert Z'Dar, WWE Hall of Fame member Jake the Snake Roberts, and the legendary Joe Estevez.  We also created Monsters on Main Street featuring Todd Bridges (Diffrent Strokes), Martin Klebba (Pirates of the Caribbean 1-3, 5), and Robert Z'Dar again. In total, director Brad Leo Lyon has been a credited producer on over 30 movies and TV episodes which starred many legends of cinema like Tony Todd (Candyman/Final Destination), Robert Miano (Fast & Furious/Dungeons and Dragons), Kane Hodder (Yes, Jason from Friday the 13th),  music artists like Bone Crusher, and UFC legends like Dan Severn.  

Our team, along with a bunch of awesome people from Florida and beyond, are coming together to make this insanely fun movie. We have a budget to make the movie, but we could make a heck of a lot better one with your help! The particular area where we're filming doesn't have an infrastructure for film which means it's not rich with experienced and highly trained crew or cast. Many more people are going to have to be brought in from out of the area and placed in hotels than originally budgeted for. That's where you come in, we're offering you some crazy perks to help us make this movie the best it possibly can. With your help we can bring in the additional crew and cast we need, create a few sets we're lacking, and even cast some exciting celebrities you'll love to see pop up in the film.

We might sound like a broken record here but what we're striving to do is increase the budget of our film so we can make a better movie. We need to increase our budget for lodging, travel, and create a budget to build a couple sets. These are our primary goals and what we need to reach the minimum of $18,000 in order to do. This budget also takes into account funds we'll need to actually fulfill the perks being purchased here plus IndieGoGo's fees (5%), credit card service fees (roughly 2.9%), and a 5% reserve fee they hold. The perks are the fun part!

We're not just asking you to help, we're inviting you to become part of the film! You can actually visit the set, appear in the film, get credited as a producer and much more. It's a pretty exciting opportunity to be party of a film family and actually experience making a movie from the inside of the set. As a matter of fact, everyone who contributes will get to be part of our private, secret group where we'll share updates, stories, photos, and video journals about our experience making the movie.

If we make it to some of our stretch goals we're even going to make a documentary about the making of this movie where EVERYONE who participated in the film can come be a part of. But, let's not get ahead of ourselves first.

 

Here are a list of some of the perks available as well as some various notes that you really should read before purchasing.

  • SOCIAL MEDIA SHOUT OUT - We're so thankful for your support we're going to scream it at the top of our lungs. Now, you might not hear us actually do this. So instead of hoping you do, we're also going to paste it on our social media fan page. You can find it on Facebook at facebook.com/KillerKeg 
  • BEHIND THE SCENES ACCESS - When you support this film you're becoming part of the team. As part of the team, we want you to be able to know what's going on. So we're going to send you an invite to our private group where we're going to post updates of what goes on behind the scenes in making Killer Keg
  • KILLER KEG KOOZIE - It's a Koozie, it's shaped like a Keg, it says Killer Keg, and its awesome! Oh, I guess it helps with the temperature of your beverages. 
  • LIMITED EDITION SIGNED POSTER -  It's an 11X17 poster of Killer Keg signed by the director and a number of the cast!
  • EXCLUSIVE CAMPAIGN T-SHIRT - This T-Shirt is only available to those who participate in making Killer Keg happen! 
  • A VIDEO FROM KEGLAND - Want a personalized thank you for your support? How about director/actor Brad Leo Lyon going live with you on a Facebook Video? Need a Twitch guest star? Whatever you want, rather it's pre-recorded or we join you live, we're happy to thank you for your help! (live videos are based on the availability of the director and typically will need to be scheduled in advance. Length of the video is up to the sole discretion of director Brad Leo Lyon.)
  • DINNER WITH THE DIRECTOR - If you've ever wanted all of your questions answers about the making of a movie, how to get into the film industry, or anything else you want, there isn't much of a better way than to sit down with the director for dinner and have him all to yourself. Dinner is on us, though technically you paid for it at a restaurant in Charlotte County Florida where some of the filming is taking place. (travel and accommodations are not included so you'll have to get yourself here)
  • KEG MASTER CLASS - Director Brad Leo Lyon is well known for his seminars regarding the "business of acting for film" and his "introduction to film acting" classes. He'll be putting on a private, one day master class in Charlotte County, Florida and will teach you the ins and outs of the industry. This seminar will teach you the fundamental skills in acting for film while also sharing with you the business knowledge of the industry you'll need to succeed. This is an exclusive master class being taught only to Killer Keg supporters! 
  • ACTOR'S HEADSHOT - Lyon Productions, the motion picture studio that is producing Killer Keg will host a one day Actor's Headshot event. By purchasing the perk, you'll be able to attend and have your professional actor's headshot taken. This is a must have if you intend to be a professional actor submitting for auditions. Travel and lodging to the Charlotte County, Florida area for this event is the responsibility of the purchaser.
  • ACTING REEL - Every actor must have an actor's reel in their arsenal to capture the quality auditions that truly launch their career. Yet, actor's always ask if they don't have a reel, how can they get the auditions they need so they can get footage to make a reel. Here's your answer! Lyon Productions will SHOOT & EDIT a speed reel for you during a one day event in Charlotte County, Florida as part of the Killer Keg campaign. This opportunity is extremely below the normal cost of producing a reel and is only being offered exclusively in this campaign. It is the responsibility of the purchaser to provide their own travel and lodging to the Charlotte County area during this one day even. The date is expected to be held in December, 2019 following the end of the campaign. 
  • PRO ACTOR PACKAGE EVENT - This is the mega package for those of you aspiring actors and professionals alike. Lyon Productions, the motion picture studio producing Killer Keg, is hosting a one day event where we will provide you with the headshot and actor's reel you need to get your career moving in the right direction! You'll also be able to attend our master class, which includes our Intro to Acting for Film Seminar, the Business of Acting for Film Seminar, and our Advanced Acting for Film Seminar. All three events along with the reel and headshot are part of the package along with a Killer Keg package of swag including a T-Shirt and Poster and other surprise goodies! Lunch is also included. (Travel and lodging to be provided by the purchaser. The event is expected to be held in December following the end of the campaign. All purchases are final, seats are limited, so you must attend the date once announced. This will be a weekend date in December, prior to the Holidays, or just following the Holidays in the Charlotte County, Florida area.) 
  • INSANE ACTOR MEGA PACKAGE - You're getting a huge boost to your dreams of becoming an actor with this mega pack - Attend our Master Class, have your headshot made, get a speed actor's reel shot & edited, go to dinner with the director, receive a walk on role as an extra, and even get a special thanks credit on IMDB and in the end credits of the film! (Travel & Lodging provided by the Purchaser)
  • YOUR PRODUCT ON SCREEN - Your product, business, or service will be visually seen on screen in a scene of the film. For instance, your beer bottle with your logo visible may be sitting on a table cast member(s) are sitting at while having a conversation. Don't have a physical product? That's okay! We'll place an advertisement conveniently but not too discreetly into a seen. Perhaps your advertisement is visible in a fake open magazine or table advertisement sits on the table in a coffee shop. Heck, maybe your business card is seen in the room of one of the actor's homes. We'll make it happen!  The scene will be shot during principal photography in 2019 but will not be available to be seen until the film's premiere which is estimated to be October of 2020 but that date is subject to change without notice. (Any product is to be supplied to the production at no cost. Placement of the product, service, or advertisement is up to the sole creative decision of director Brad Leo Lyon. There is no guarantee of the length of screen time.) . {A contract will be supplied giving us the rights to use your company's logo, likeness, and/or other marketing related material in the film.}
  • YOUR PRODUCT INTERACTED WITH - Your product, business, or service will be directly interacted with on screen. Remember that beer bottle mentioned above? Now picture it being picked up by an actor in the film, enjoyed on screen with a nice big moan of satisfaction when the bottle is sat back down. We might even say the name of your product or business right on screen! (Any product is to be supplied to the production at no cost. Placement of the product, service, or advertisement is up to the sole creative decision of director Brad Leo Lyon. There is no guarantee of the length of screen time.) . {A contract will be supplied giving us the rights to use your company's logo, likeness, and/or other marketing related material in the film.}
  • FILMED ON LOCATION - Own a business you'd love to see in the movie? We have a montage scene in our film that would be perfect to include your business advertised directly on screen. You & or part of your staff may even get to appear as extras in the scene! This is available to Florida area businesses preferably in Southern Florida (Southwest is ideal) but we can work out most locations with a couple hour drive of the Punta Gorda/Port Charlotte area. Other areas of Florida and even other states are available at an additional cost. If you're in another state just comment or email us and we'll see if we can work it out. This is open to any business although coffee shops, restaurants, and/or bars could receive extended time on screen due to being an ideal fit for scene(s) of our film. (Length of time on screen is up to the sole discretion of the director in relationship to his vision of the editing and pacing of the movie.) 
  • A WALK ON ROLE - You, YES YOU, will get to be in the movie! You'll get to visit set and appear as an extra in the movie. Remember, this is a movie that involves a time loop so you may even be seen several times. (travel and accommodations are not included)
  • SPEAKING ROLE - Actors go on dozens of auditions competing  with hundreds of actors for a chance at a speaking role. You just landed one with one click. You'll get an actual speaking role in the movie with dialog written for you specifically by director Brad Leo Lyon. You'll have to sign a contract of course. That means you'll be coming to set, eating with the cast and crew, and getting to talk in the movie. You'll be fully credited for your role in the movie in the end credits of the film and on IMDB.
  • BE A PRODUCER - The top people on set are the producers. When a movie wins best picture, it's the producers who are awarded the title. The only way you could be credited any higher on the movie is if the word executive came before the word producer. You'll be fully credited as an Associate Producer in the opening credits of the movie and on IMDB. Bragging rights don't get much better. 
  • BECOME AN EXECUTIVE PRODUCER - Remember when we said bragging rights don't get much better? You know, literally right before this sentence? Well this is the one exception. You'll be credited in the opening credits of the film, on the movie's poster, and in the trailer as Co-Executive Producer. This is the king of all credits, the Executive Producer is the highest title on the film set. Time to wear your crown. 
  • THE ULTIMATE KEGSPERIENCE (Keg Experience) - This is an insane opportunity to truly show off to your friends and family that you're a real producer on the film? How you ask? Because director Brad Leo Lyon will come TO YOU and screen the movie for you and your friends so all of them can see YOU are credited as a CO-Executive Producer in the opening credits of the movie, on the poster, and in the trailer. You'll also get to visit set, meet the cast and crew, have lunch with everyone, and get a special prize. Not to mention you're going to be loaded up with all kinds of swag from the film. You'll even get to attend the premiere of the movie with 5 of your friends and family. (Travel and Accommodations are not provided, but we are paying for ourselves to get to you for the private screening.)
  •  

Lyon Productions (the motion picture company making this movie) and director Brad Leo Lyon have produced numerous feature films and TV episodes. So getting this film made isn't a risk. But making a great film has its challenges. Major motion picture studios make movies for millions of dollars. Did you know one of the film unions, which we'll leave nameless here, considers a film a low budget starting under 2.5 million dollars. So making an awesome movie on a shoe string budget is difficult.

The great part here is we're helmed by a director who does this for a living. He's produced dozens of films and has directed numerous movies that have shot in a fraction of the time normal "Hollywood" movies are made while still being cinematic and entertaining.

Yet, we won't deny money does help a lot. So the better budget we have, the better movie we will make. We, meaning all of you who are joining us here in Kegland along with our great team of people already apart of making cinematic history with us.

 

Beyond your contribution, spreading the word about this campaign will help do wonders for us. Even if you cannot contribute, letting people know about Killer Keg and the kegalicious perks available could help do wonders.

This you can do:

  • Share our campaign on your social media like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, and anything else you have.
  • Tell your friends and family about it. Maybe they're future keggies too!
  • Do you have friends in the media? Share our campaign with them and they may just help spread the word even further.
  • Follow our social media page(s). www.KillerKeg.com should have a link to all of them as they become available.
story_txt:
Welcome to Kegland!
Hello Fellow Keggies,
Killer Keg is the new horror comedy from indie director Brad Leo Lyon (Little Creeps/Monsters on Main Street/Roommates) filming this winter on the Sun Coast of Florida. It's Groundhog Day meets Happy Death Day as a group of friends decide to throw a kegger to cheer up a friend after his girlfriend dumps him. Problem? Well, the mysterious keg they find for the party causes them to relive the same day over and over again and with each new day another person disappears. 

We're the team behind such movies as Little Creeps which starred Dustin Diamond and Lark Voorhies of Saved By the Bell, the late great horror icon Robert Z'Dar, WWE Hall of Fame member Jake the Snake Roberts, and the legendary Joe Estevez.  We also created Monsters on Main Street featuring Todd Bridges (Diffrent Strokes), Martin Klebba (Pirates of the Caribbean 1-3, 5), and Robert Z'Dar again. In total, director Brad Leo Lyon has been a credited producer on over 30 movies and TV episodes which starred many legends of cinema like Tony Todd (Candyman/Final Destination), Robert Miano (Fast & Furious/Dungeons and Dragons), Kane Hodder (Yes, Jason from Friday the 13th),  music artists like Bone Crusher, and UFC legends like Dan Severn.  

Our team, along with a bunch of awesome people from Florida and beyond, are coming together to make this insanely fun movie. We have a budget to make the movie, but we could make a heck of a lot better one with your help! The particular area where we're filming doesn't have an infrastructure for film which means it's not rich with experienced and highly trained crew or cast. Many more people are going to have to be brought in from out of the area and placed in hotels than originally budgeted for. That's where you come in, we're offering you some crazy perks to help us make this movie the best it possibly can. With your help we can bring in the additional crew and cast we need, create a few sets we're lacking, and even cast some exciting celebrities you'll love to see pop up in the film.


We might sound like a broken record here but what we're striving to do is increase the budget of our film so we can make a better movie. We need to increase our budget for lodging, travel, and create a budget to build a couple sets. These are our primary goals and what we need to reach the minimum of $18,000 in order to do. This budget also takes into account funds we'll need to actually fulfill the perks being purchased here plus IndieGoGo's fees (5%), credit card service fees (roughly 2.9%), and a 5% reserve fee they hold. The perks are the fun part!
We're not just asking you to help, we're inviting you to become part of the film! You can actually visit the set, appear in the film, get credited as a producer and much more. It's a pretty exciting opportunity to be party of a film family and actually experience making a movie from the inside of the set. As a matter of fact, everyone who contributes will get to be part of our private, secret group where we'll share updates, stories, photos, and video journals about our experience making the movie.
If we make it to some of our stretch goals we're even going to make a documentary about the making of this movie where EVERYONE who participated in the film can come be a part of. But, let's not get ahead of ourselves first.
 

Here are a list of some of the perks available as well as some various notes that you really should read before purchasing.


SOCIAL MEDIA SHOUT OUT - We're so thankful for your support we're going to scream it at the top of our lungs. Now, you might not hear us actually do this. So instead of hoping you do, we're also going to paste it on our social media fan page. You can find it on Facebook at facebook.com/KillerKeg 

BEHIND THE SCENES ACCESS - When you support this film you're becoming part of the team. As part of the team, we want you to be able to know what's going on. So we're going to send you an invite to our private group where we're going to post updates of what goes on behind the scenes in making Killer Keg

KILLER KEG KOOZIE - It's a Koozie, it's shaped like a Keg, it says Killer Keg, and its awesome! Oh, I guess it helps with the temperature of your beverages. 

LIMITED EDITION SIGNED POSTER -  It's an 11X17 poster of Killer Keg signed by the director and a number of the cast!

EXCLUSIVE CAMPAIGN T-SHIRT - This T-Shirt is only available to those who participate in making Killer Keg happen! 

A VIDEO FROM KEGLAND - Want a personalized thank you for your support? How about director/actor Brad Leo Lyon going live with you on a Facebook Video? Need a Twitch guest star? Whatever you want, rather it's pre-recorded or we join you live, we're happy to thank you for your help! (live videos are based on the availability of the director and typically will need to be scheduled in advance. Length of the video is up to the sole discretion of director Brad Leo Lyon.)

DINNER WITH THE DIRECTOR - If you've ever wanted all of your questions answers about the making of a movie, how to get into the film industry, or anything else you want, there isn't much of a better way than to sit down with the director for dinner and have him all to yourself. Dinner is on us, though technically you paid for it at a restaurant in Charlotte County Florida where some of the filming is taking place. (travel and accommodations are not included so you'll have to get yourself here)

KEG MASTER CLASS - Director Brad Leo Lyon is well known for his seminars regarding the "business of acting for film" and his "introduction to film acting" classes. He'll be putting on a private, one day master class in Charlotte County, Florida and will teach you the ins and outs of the industry. This seminar will teach you the fundamental skills in acting for film while also sharing with you the business knowledge of the industry you'll need to succeed. This is an exclusive master class being taught only to Killer Keg supporters! 

ACTOR'S HEADSHOT - Lyon Productions, the motion picture studio that is producing Killer Keg will host a one day Actor's Headshot event. By purchasing the perk, you'll be able to attend and have your professional actor's headshot taken. This is a must have if you intend to be a professional actor submitting for auditions. Travel and lodging to the Charlotte County, Florida area for this event is the responsibility of the purchaser.

ACTING REEL - Every actor must have an actor's reel in their arsenal to capture the quality auditions that truly launch their career. Yet, actor's always ask if they don't have a reel, how can they get the auditions they need so they can get footage to make a reel. Here's your answer! Lyon Productions will SHOOT & EDIT a speed reel for you during a one day event in Charlotte County, Florida as part of the Killer Keg campaign. This opportunity is extremely below the normal cost of producing a reel and is only being offered exclusively in this campaign. It is the responsibility of the purchaser to provide their own travel and lodging to the Charlotte County area during this one day even. The date is expected to be held in December, 2019 following the end of the campaign. 

PRO ACTOR PACKAGE EVENT - This is the mega package for those of you aspiring actors and professionals alike. Lyon Productions, the motion picture studio producing Killer Keg, is hosting a one day event where we will provide you with the headshot and actor's reel you need to get your career moving in the right direction! You'll also be able to attend our master class, which includes our Intro to Acting for Film Seminar, the Business of Acting for Film Seminar, and our Advanced Acting for Film Seminar. All three events along with the reel and headshot are part of the package along with a Killer Keg package of swag including a T-Shirt and Poster and other surprise goodies! Lunch is also included. (Travel and lodging to be provided by the purchaser. The event is expected to be held in December following the end of the campaign. All purchases are final, seats are limited, so you must attend the date once announced. This will be a weekend date in December, prior to the Holidays, or just following the Holidays in the Charlotte County, Florida area.) 

INSANE ACTOR MEGA PACKAGE - You're getting a huge boost to your dreams of becoming an actor with this mega pack - Attend our Master Class, have your headshot made, get a speed actor's reel shot & edited, go to dinner with the director, receive a walk on role as an extra, and even get a special thanks credit on IMDB and in the end credits of the film! (Travel & Lodging provided by the Purchaser)

YOUR PRODUCT ON SCREEN - Your product, business, or service will be visually seen on screen in a scene of the film. For instance, your beer bottle with your logo visible may be sitting on a table cast member(s) are sitting at while having a conversation. Don't have a physical product? That's okay! We'll place an advertisement conveniently but not too discreetly into a seen. Perhaps your advertisement is visible in a fake open magazine or table advertisement sits on the table in a coffee shop. Heck, maybe your business card is seen in the room of one of the actor's homes. We'll make it happen!  The scene will be shot during principal photography in 2019 but will not be available to be seen until the film's premiere which is estimated to be October of 2020 but that date is subject to change without notice. (Any product is to be supplied to the production at no cost. Placement of the product, service, or advertisement is up to the sole creative decision of director Brad Leo Lyon. There is no guarantee of the length of screen time.) . {A contract will be supplied giving us the rights to use your company's logo, likeness, and/or other marketing related material in the film.}

YOUR PRODUCT INTERACTED WITH - Your product, business, or service will be directly interacted with on screen. Remember that beer bottle mentioned above? Now picture it being picked up by an actor in the film, enjoyed on screen with a nice big moan of satisfaction when the bottle is sat back down. We might even say the name of your product or business right on screen! (Any product is to be supplied to the production at no cost. Placement of the product, service, or advertisement is up to the sole creative decision of director Brad Leo Lyon. There is no guarantee of the length of screen time.) . {A contract will be supplied giving us the rights to use your company's logo, likeness, and/or other marketing related material in the film.}

FILMED ON LOCATION - Own a business you'd love to see in the movie? We have a montage scene in our film that would be perfect to include your business advertised directly on screen. You & or part of your staff may even get to appear as extras in the scene! This is available to Florida area businesses preferably in Southern Florida (Southwest is ideal) but we can work out most locations with a couple hour drive of the Punta Gorda/Port Charlotte area. Other areas of Florida and even other states are available at an additional cost. If you're in another state just comment or email us and we'll see if we can work it out. This is open to any business although coffee shops, restaurants, and/or bars could receive extended time on screen due to being an ideal fit for scene(s) of our film. (Length of time on screen is up to the sole discretion of the director in relationship to his vision of the editing and pacing of the movie.) 

A WALK ON ROLE - You, YES YOU, will get to be in the movie! You'll get to visit set and appear as an extra in the movie. Remember, this is a movie that involves a time loop so you may even be seen several times. (travel and accommodations are not included)

SPEAKING ROLE - Actors go on dozens of auditions competing  with hundreds of actors for a chance at a speaking role. You just landed one with one click. You'll get an actual speaking role in the movie with dialog written for you specifically by director Brad Leo Lyon. You'll have to sign a contract of course. That means you'll be coming to set, eating with the cast and crew, and getting to talk in the movie. You'll be fully credited for your role in the movie in the end credits of the film and on IMDB.

BE A PRODUCER - The top people on set are the producers. When a movie wins best picture, it's the producers who are awarded the title. The only way you could be credited any higher on the movie is if the word executive came before the word producer. You'll be fully credited as an Associate Producer in the opening credits of the movie and on IMDB. Bragging rights don't get much better. 


BECOME AN EXECUTIVE PRODUCER - Remember when we said bragging rights don't get much better? You know, literally right before this sentence? Well this is the one exception. You'll be credited in the opening credits of the film, on the movie's poster, and in the trailer as Co-Executive Producer. This is the king of all credits, the Executive Producer is the highest title on the film set. Time to wear your crown. 

THE ULTIMATE KEGSPERIENCE (Keg Experience) - This is an insane opportunity to truly show off to your friends and family that you're a real producer on the film? How you ask? Because director Brad Leo Lyon will come TO YOU and screen the movie for you and your friends so all of them can see YOU are credited as a CO-Executive Producer in the opening credits of the movie, on the poster, and in the trailer. You'll also get to visit set, meet the cast and crew, have lunch with everyone, and get a special prize. Not to mention you're going to be loaded up with all kinds of swag from the film. You'll even get to attend the premiere of the movie with 5 of your friends and family. (Travel and Accommodations are not provided, but we are paying for ourselves to get to you for the private screening.)
 


Lyon Productions (the motion picture company making this movie) and director Brad Leo Lyon have produced numerous feature films and TV episodes. So getting this film made isn't a risk. But making a great film has its challenges. Major motion picture studios make movies for millions of dollars. Did you know one of the film unions, which we'll leave nameless here, considers a film a low budget starting under 2.5 million dollars. So making an awesome movie on a shoe string budget is difficult.
The great part here is we're helmed by a director who does this for a living. He's produced dozens of films and has directed numerous movies that have shot in a fraction of the time normal "Hollywood" movies are made while still being cinematic and entertaining.
Yet, we won't deny money does help a lot. So the better budget we have, the better movie we will make. We, meaning all of you who are joining us here in Kegland along with our great team of people already apart of making cinematic history with us.
 

Beyond your contribution, spreading the word about this campaign will help do wonders for us. Even if you cannot contribute, letting people know about Killer Keg and the kegalicious perks available could help do wonders.
This you can do:

Share our campaign on your social media like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, and anything else you have.
Tell your friends and family about it. Maybe they're future keggies too!
Do you have friends in the media? Share our campaign with them and they may just help spread the word even further.
Follow our social media page(s). www.KillerKeg.com should have a link to all of them as they become available.

story:
Short Summary

Thanks so much for your interest so far and welcome to the campaign for the short film Faulty Roots.

I’m Ella, an 18 year old Londoner, and the producer & writer of the film! After having worked as an actor for many years, I decided that I wanted to create and share something of my own. Mental health problems are common in teens today and I want to share a story that may help raise awareness of this and the issues that come with them.

Any support that you can give would be greatly appreciated.

The Film

The story follows the young character of Lola, who is forced to form a friendship with Zack. The two each suffer from genetic conditions which affect their lives in different ways. They will change each other's stories forever. 

Check out our IMDB Page: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt10551374

Meet the Cast

Lola ~ Ella Greenwood

I will be playing the role of Lola.

I’m a British actress born and raised in London, England. Having joined youth theatres and productions from a young age, I trained in both stage and screen. I made my screen debut as lead character Lina in New York Director Adam Llamas' horror 'In Front of You' and my stage debut at local theatres as well as the West End. I trained with the National Youth Theatre of Great Britain. I’m also a voice-over actor, having narrated books for Audible/Amazon and having voiced a key character in a new American series. I have recently been called a 'Rising Young Acting Talent' by David Duprey of That Moment In and 'one of those "up-and-comers" to watch circumspectly' by Entertainment Writer Ruth Hill.

I have been working extremely hard to bring this film to life and can’t wait to share Lola’s story.

Susan ~ Sarah Eastwood

Sarah will be playing the role of Susan.

Sarah is a wonderful actress who has undertaken intensive acting training in the UK and has worked on over 40 projects, all predominately film & TV, including ITV, SKY & Amazon Prime productions. She starred in the award winning film ‘A Pinprick of Light’ that screened at Cannes Film Festival.

I first worked with Sarah on the film ‘In Front of You’ where she played my on-screen mum. We immediately connected and I was in awe of her talent as well as her complete passion and kindness. I can’t wait to work with her again.  

Zack ~ Sani Thabo

Sani will be playing the role of Zack.

Sani is a brilliant young actor who trained at The Young Creatives Portsmouth Acting School. He has experience on stage, acting at the New Theatre Royal and in the Brighton Fringe Festival. He also has screen experience, having acted in the short films Third Wheeling, Transteen and Listen.

I first saw Sani give an excellent performance in ‘Third Wheeling’. He brought the same comedic talent and light heartedness to his audition and will do an amazing job bringing Zack to life.

What We Need & What You Get

The Director of Photography

We have an extremely talented DoP on board, Ash Lang Wen Li.  Ash grew up in Hong Kong, before pursuing a Film and Politics double major at Wesleyan University (Connecticut, USA), where she received the Freeman Asian Scholarship, a merit-based scholarship that covered 4 years of undergraduate tuition. She has a strong narrative background, and has worked with cinematographers whose work has been recognised by the Oscars, the Emmys and the BAFTAs. I absolutely love Ash's work and I know that she is the right DoP to bring my vision to life. Check out her showreel below:

Budget Breakdown

Here is an outline of our budget:

Cast & Crew: I want to make sure to pay my cast & crew at least the minimum wage and as much as I can as they deserve to be rewarded for their hard work and dedication.

Equipment: A lot of our equipment will be brought by the crew as they have their own that they usually work with but there is still some equipment that we will need to hire externally.

Production: This is to cover the cost of costumes, catering and any other things that we need for the shoot.

Insurance: The shoot will need to be insured and this has to be taken into account when budgeting.

Contingency: This is to ensure that we have some of our budget set aside for any last minute things that we need or to cover any issues that may arise.

Post-Production: To make sure we the film is edited well, and to cover the audio and colour grading costs a part of our budget will go towards creating the final version of the film.

Film Festivals: Submitting the film to festivals will be costly but we want to share our story and message with as many people as possible and so we want to try and get it into great film festivals once its finished.

What you get

Perks include: IMDB Credits, Original Artwork, Personalised Thank You Messages, Behind The Scenes Pictures, Signed Scripts and Private Links to the film.

 The Impact

My project will help to shine light on some of the issues faced by teens and to hopefully make these issues seem less daunting and isolating. I want to keep an important conversation going beyond the end of the film. I love films because they bring people together, and can impact people in so many different ways. By supporting the film, you're not only supporting a great team of cast & crew, but also important characters with an inspiring message to tell.

I have got to witness firsthand the production of different short films, including my experience as the lead roles in the films 'Before Nightfall' and 'In Front of You'. Getting to see people bring their vision to life inspired me and created a passion for me to want to do the same. 

I will continue to post information, pictures, & trailers on film's social pages so that you can see the effect of your contribution and follow along with the production journey.

Risks & Challenges

We want to make sure that we tell the story as well as we can to enable us to reach as wide an audience as possible. We want to hire a post-production team that really understands the vision and does the crew's hard work justice. We need to allow for any last minute cancellations or equipment problems.

As someone with experience in seeing productions just like this happen before, I know that not all issues can be avoided but I am extremely organised, work well under pressure and have the motivation to ensure that this shoot will be a success.

Other Ways You Can Help

I want to reach as many people as possible and so sharing the campaign page, following the film on Twitter and Instagram, and even talking about the film will help so much. 

I'm passionate that this film can be enjoyed by all different audiences and has a message that everyone needs to hear.

Check us out!

Our Twitter Page: www.twitter.com/faultyroots

Our Instagram Page: www.instagram.com/faultyroots

On behalf of myself, the team and the fellow supporters, thank you for your time and interest.

story:
Telling Ryan Road Story.

 

Hello possible contributors, Tyler Geis here. Writer/Producer and Director of Ryan Road Story. After years of making feature films for very little money and a few short films, producing a web series', and working for network television, it's time to roll the dice again. I present to you the campaign to fund Ryan Road Story. The plot of the film is simple. It's about a filmmaker who returns home from Hollywood after hearing of the tragic passing of his brother who had his struggles with drugs. It's a project the team and i have had in the works for almost four years now. For me, I'm close to this story. I plan to film this in my hometown. Matter of fact, the neighborhood i grew up in is the bulk of the filming locations. But more importantly the plot hits home to me. And I'm sure it hits home to a lot of people near and far. By taking part in funding this project you will be bringing to life something that explores universal themes that we all can connect with.

What We Need & What You Get

 The more you donate, the more of an integral part you get to be on this project. Yes, there's t-shirts to give away, digital downloads of the finished film, DVD's, posters, maybe even some cool little props that will appear in the film. But we also offer perks that range from your name in the end credits all the way up to Executive Producer credit. That's right, even if you've never been apart of making a film, but you have always wanted to have a stake in one. You have a chance to get the credit upon a very generous donation to the project. This film has a lot of things lined up already. Cast, crew, locations, some gear. But day in and day out, things can get costly. Your donations will be helping keep us afloat through production and into post production as well.

More Than A Movie

We could have made this film a few years back. But what we needed just wasn't there. We needed to dive deeper. I needed to dive deeper. The film always had the plot of a family dealing with a tragic loss of one of their members. But it never was at the forefront of the story. As i mentioned in the video that goes along with this campaign, i have lost track of how many people i grew up with who were either a friend, or just someone i would hear about, that has had to deal with an addiction to drugs. I know so many families that have had to deal with losing one of their own to drugs. So for me, personally, I'm trying to make this film for them. So with your donation to push this project forward. You're helping a story get told that people all over can sympathize with.

Fortune Favors the Bold

This film has been a challenge from day one. Writing, Casting, coming close to filming then having to halt things. I live in another state from the rest of my cast and crew. But all challenges aside, everyone who's involved with this has wanted to lift this off the ground for some time now. Your support and help really makes it stand up. Filmmaking is hard, ask anyone who has ever tried it. And sometimes it's almost safe not to create something this close to you. But the fact that it is very close to a lot of us involved with it, means we're going to take good care of the integrity of the project despite whatever challenges come our way.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute. This isn't our first crowdfunding campaign. We understand people have to live within their means. So if you can't make a contribution out of the gate or even at all. We want you to show this off to the people you know as well.  The message this film conveys has universal appeal because it deals with very human problems that aren't looked at in a judgemental way. Share it on social media, but please have a caption on your post so people just don't keep scrolling. We want this project funded but we also want the word out as well. If you see this and feel a strong connection to the material and get the urge to want to reach out, please do so. The more movement we get around this project, the more closer it gets to being made.

Thank you so much for reading and watching.

-Tyler
story_txt:
Telling Ryan Road Story.
 
Hello possible contributors, Tyler Geis here. Writer/Producer and Director of Ryan Road Story. After years of making feature films for very little money and a few short films, producing a web series', and working for network television, it's time to roll the dice again. I present to you the campaign to fund Ryan Road Story. The plot of the film is simple. It's about a filmmaker who returns home from Hollywood after hearing of the tragic passing of his brother who had his struggles with drugs. It's a project the team and i have had in the works for almost four years now. For me, I'm close to this story. I plan to film this in my hometown. Matter of fact, the neighborhood i grew up in is the bulk of the filming locations. But more importantly the plot hits home to me. And I'm sure it hits home to a lot of people near and far. By taking part in funding this project you will be bringing to life something that explores universal themes that we all can connect with.

What We Need & What You Get
 The more you donate, the more of an integral part you get to be on this project. Yes, there's t-shirts to give away, digital downloads of the finished film, DVD's, posters, maybe even some cool little props that will appear in the film. But we also offer perks that range from your name in the end credits all the way up to Executive Producer credit. That's right, even if you've never been apart of making a film, but you have always wanted to have a stake in one. You have a chance to get the credit upon a very generous donation to the project. This film has a lot of things lined up already. Cast, crew, locations, some gear. But day in and day out, things can get costly. Your donations will be helping keep us afloat through production and into post production as well.

More Than A Movie
We could have made this film a few years back. But what we needed just wasn't there. We needed to dive deeper. I needed to dive deeper. The film always had the plot of a family dealing with a tragic loss of one of their members. But it never was at the forefront of the story. As i mentioned in the video that goes along with this campaign, i have lost track of how many people i grew up with who were either a friend, or just someone i would hear about, that has had to deal with an addiction to drugs. I know so many families that have had to deal with losing one of their own to drugs. So for me, personally, I'm trying to make this film for them. So with your donation to push this project forward. You're helping a story get told that people all over can sympathize with.

Fortune Favors the Bold
This film has been a challenge from day one. Writing, Casting, coming close to filming then having to halt things. I live in another state from the rest of my cast and crew. But all challenges aside, everyone who's involved with this has wanted to lift this off the ground for some time now. Your support and help really makes it stand up. Filmmaking is hard, ask anyone who has ever tried it. And sometimes it's almost safe not to create something this close to you. But the fact that it is very close to a lot of us involved with it, means we're going to take good care of the integrity of the project despite whatever challenges come our way.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute. This isn't our first crowdfunding campaign. We understand people have to live within their means. So if you can't make a contribution out of the gate or even at all. We want you to show this off to the people you know as well.  The message this film conveys has universal appeal because it deals with very human problems that aren't looked at in a judgemental way. Share it on social media, but please have a caption on your post so people just don't keep scrolling. We want this project funded but we also want the word out as well. If you see this and feel a strong connection to the material and get the urge to want to reach out, please do so. The more movement we get around this project, the more closer it gets to being made.
Thank you so much for reading and watching.
-Tyler

story:
Nocturnus Summary

My name is Sam Hodge and I’ve had the opportunity to direct previous films Twelve Pole Manor and Glam (short). As a director, I have been able to enlist the help of many talented creators, fabricators, writers, performers, etc. We have a cast and crew of approximately 30 experienced and novice individuals ready and willing to give all of their energy to make a truly different imagining of vampires happen. 

Nocturnus follows a group of innocent people who have been captured and held hostage to witness an ancient ceremony where vampiric creatures display their intent and need for blood. They are then released into a longboard lost wilderness and hunted without remorse. 

This film will utilized practical effects and needs funding to make that happen with as much detail as possible. If you help find Nocturnus, what will you be helping us buy? You will be helping us purchase the necessary elements to complete makeup, prosthetics fabrication, special effects material and safety supplies, wood, paint, and materials to build an ancient community in the forest, and various materials to make it all happen. 

This project will advance the filmmaking community in the Appalachian region and provide learning experiences to cast and crew with little experience. There is no risk of this film not being made because it is already under way. Once completed, it will be available for purchase via DVD and streaming platforms. 

If you contribute enough to be named a producer, we will happily provide credits on the film and IMDb! 

 Even $1 helps our cause and regardless of whether you can contribute, spread the word and share this project with everyone you know!

story:
Short Summary

“A rhythmic short film which expresses the impact everyday life has on a newly diagnosed coeliac, and how she discovers her own tempo.”

The Story

Holly, an Irish woman newly diagnosed with coeliac disease has to suddenly say goodbye to all things gluten for, well... forever. The sudden lifestyle change takes her on a turbulent journey; With a mix of frustrating times, a splash of envious times and a sprinkling of lighthearted times. Supermarket shopping, social gatherings, reminiscing and everyday prep. Will she take it all in her stride?

Overview

This is a topic that could quite easily be boring, which is why an inventive approach is essential. It’s not a ‘feel sorry for me, I have coeliac disease’ film; it’s an immersive and creative film which highlights various important factors. The short will be carried by strong rhythmic sound design and fast paced inventive editing. Basing it upon rhythm reflects the planning and incessant vigilance a coeliac must take. 

Directors Attachment

6 months ago, I was diagnosed with coeliac disease. When the doctor saw the flattened villi in my gut, he told me I have probably had it for years. Although it would have been good if it were diagnosed sooner, much of my twenties involved working & travelling the world, downing copious amounts of beer whilst trying any food without having to worry about language barriers and understanding labels.  Things have changed for me now, and for many with coeliac disease, it involves much planning and many sacrifices. 

Coeliac disease is an autoimmune disease which destroys your gut due to antibodies being produced at the presence of even a tiny crumb. A gluten free diet for life is the only medication.  Gluten is found in wheat, rye, spelt and barley - which is in more food and drink than you'd expect! A coeliac never wants to be branded fussy or complicated and research shows that most will avoid social situations like eating out due to concerns over cross-contamination. 

I aim to help the one percent of the population with coeliac disease who sometimes feel misunderstood, by making something which people without the disease can connect with in an insightful and enjoyable way.

What I Need & What You Get

This is a self initiated project and I need all the help I can get. Luckily I have managed to talk my way into getting some stuff for free, like crew, however unfortunately there are still additional things that need to be covered. These are locations, kit hire, props/costume, cast and crew travel and food expenses, talent, composer, post-production assets, distribution / film festivals around the world. 

If I don’t manage to raise the full amount, I will still make what I can, just a simplified version. If I successfully reach more than the aim, I will donate it to CoeliacUK towards medical research.

As well as your good deed to help get the show on the road, there are also unique perks for you. Click inside them to see what you get! 

The Impact

At least one percent of the population are living with coeliac disease. Awareness has got a lot better in recent years, however, many coeliacs still feel misunderstood. Making this film aims to have a voice for the coeliacs and connect the people who haven’t heard of it, understand it better. Then from the audience getting more of an emotional connection to the disease, I hope it encourages them to look into and research the disease further.

Sometimes communicating something verbally to someone won't have the same impact as them watching and experiencing a subject through storytelling, vision and sound. 

I’ve seen funny coeliac or gluten free videos, and the more scientific informative videos on the subject, but not one like this yet.

 

The Main Character  //  Holly Ashman

Holly is an actress based in London who works extensively film, tv and commercials. She has worked on a number of award winning short films over the years including 'Are You Albert?' and 'Ella'. You may have also seen her in the Surf TV Idents for Celebs Go Dating, Uber - Night Riders Commercial & Volkswagen Just Drive Commercial. She has most recently performed at the Edinburgh Fringe and filmed a guest role on Eastenders. She has a passion for telling stories through her craft and working with like minded creatives in bringing new characters and projects to life. Holly is somebody who believes in the power of film and has always loved how it can be used as a platform to inspire people. She is hoping to start writing scripts of her own. Holly and the Writer/Director Hayley worked together in 2016 and are very much looking forward to collaborating again, tackling such an important subject!

 

MAIN CREW

Writer & Director   //   Hayley Repton

Hayley is an Editor based in Manchester. She has a strong passion for storytelling and enjoys both directing and editing. She has recently made a short film ‘Broken Brain’ based around ADHD which British rapper Stormzy described as “sick and insightful”. The film was played at film festivals around the world, from Yorkshire to New York. Hayley also has a background in DJing and has a passion for sound design, so she hopes to add that creative spin on the short film which tackles the subject of Celiac Disease in a way that has not been done before.

 

Director of Photography // Mark Kuczewski

SHOWREEL: https://vimeo.com/258357651

Mark has worked as a DOP and camera operator on a number of films, adverts and music videos shot in various locations such as Ghana, Iceland, America, Greece & Finland. He gained a masters in filmmaking at London Film School and has also directed a number of short films. One of these was ‘Staff Picked’ on Vimeo and the others went on to be screened at festivals including the BAFTA Qualifying Aesthetica Short Film Festival. Check out his mad skills in the Showreel link.

 

Assistant Director // Matt Geeling

Matt, Head of Animation at Fuzzy Duck Creative, see’s him produce and direct animations daily. However, he also has a love for film and he’s been eager to work on a live-action film for a while now. The time has come… He’s ready to transfer his organisational skills from managing a group of creative Animators, to managing a group of creative Filmmakers... on a REAL LIFE FILM SET! 


Production Coordinator // Marina Oftedal

Marina left behind the sunshine and ancient ruins of Rome to pursue a career in filmmaking in the UK. She now lives in the not so sunny Manchester! Marina has managed and overviewed multiple projects throughout the years. The latest production she managed is the award-winning film Beautiful in the Morning (2019) which is currently touring the country with screenings and opened LA Femme Festival this October. She proudly takes up projects that match her view of filmmaking as a strong medium that not only is able to entertain but also influence, and contributes to productions with her mediterranean charisma and scandinavian work ethic. Aiming to live life with constant self-development and new challenges, she is currently writing a coming of age feature film.

 

Dominic Mathewson //  Gaffer 

Dom has worked as a Gaffer on various short films such as Angels, Directed by Dave Hartill, and adverts such as United Utilities Water Saving Weather Idents, Directed by Anderson West. He has worked on variety of jobs from marketing and social media campaigns to social documentaries. His passion for film really comes from his unique creative approach in which his analysis of modern cultural trends and how they impact on visual and music mediums. What’s more, Dominic brings his passion for the environment into the workspace. An avid sustainability supporter and environmental enthusiast! He is always looking to find new ways to create more sustainable ways of working.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I will be extremely grateful for any help! It will really make a difference. If you can’t afford it, I understand. A share of the page will be appreciated too.

story:
Short Summary

THE OTHERKIND -FEATURE FILM

GENRE: SCIENCE FICTION/HORROR/ FEATURE FILM

Officer Aidan, a recovering alcoholic Irish police officer, wakes up in his squad car surrounded by shattered glass. He has no memory of arriving there in the middle of nowhere in the woods.

THE OTHERKIND

LOG LINE:

Villagers in Dalkey, Ireland; start witnessing people disappearing through their Lake Lough Dan.

PLOT: 

It’s a cold summer night in July during the 1960s on small dirt road in Dalkey, Ireland.

In the town of Dalkey, Officer Aidan, lies unconscious in his squad car. He wakes up delirious, not knowing how he got there.

The Irish tinsel town is in trouble. 

Aidan, the alcoholic Police Officer, tries to save what is left of Dalkey, Ireland from it being taken over by an unknown source.

Strange disfigured bodies start to wash up on the shore of Dalkey.

The village is being attacked. People are losing their minds from something taking control.

A source from their own lake, is in their little home town.

A young Irish woman, Mona, fearless at heart.

Is the only one to have a chance at surviving, “The Otherkind.”

THE OTHERKIND WGA: Registration Number: 1835421 

MARY C. RUSSELL-DIRECTOR AND SCREENWRITER OF "THE OTHERKIND"

 

  • Mary C. Russell is a genre filmmaker, originally from the Bay Area but growing up a little differently than the average American girl, having moved to Singapore as an expat at ten years old. She graduated from Columbia College Hollywood in 2015 with a BFA in film production, majoring in directing. Currently based in Los Angeles.

    In 2015 Mary wrote, directed, and produced the dark horror comedy, CARVED. CARVED was debuted online by Blumhouse before being picked up for distribution by Filmchella in 2018, and is currently streaming on Amazon Prime with a three year contract.

    She has since then been hired to direct and co-write genre short films, music video, and direct/dp a season of a reality television series "Art Huntress," for AZTV based out of Arizona.


  • WHAT DO YOU GET OUT OF THIS ENDEAVOR?

    A chance to be a part of something creative, out of the normal film circuit. To support an independent filmmaker whose looking to break the glass ceiling. I want to bring a beautiful group of creatives together and remind people why we do what we do. To make art and spend time with your loved ones. A reminder. 

  • If you would like to email for inquiries: 

    mcrpicturehouse@gmail.com

    Website: www.marycrussell.com

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • A TOTAL BUDGET OF $500,000.00 or AIM FOR MORE we would be aiming to shoot in IRELAND and the United States! 
  • 5% -$25,000.00 or MORE - Investing includes a formal contract and attachment as an Executive Producer Role. This includes producer points to be discussed with production team, flight and hotel stay for a week or less during location scout, and camera rehearsals and/or production on the film location if out of the United States in Ireland. The percentage of distribution ownership of profit to be discussed in person. The percentage of profit within theatrical/online distribution to be discussed with production team. This also includes attending post production sessions, when film is in post. The investor will be able to attend the premier and attend the wrap day.  The investor also receives credit within the feature film, in the rolling credits. The investor will receive also a prop from the feature film.
  • 2%-4% - $10,000.00-$20,000.00 - Investing includes a formal contract and select producer points of ownership of product of film given to a low budget producer. Attendance of the investor to set for one day, if filming in the United States. They will receive a copy of final product and credit in the feature film/rolling credits. A poster of the feature film will be given to investor and prop also in addition given from the film.  
  • 1 % - $5,000.00 - OR LESS. -To receive online link to final feature film and credit. They will receive an invite of a Screening or premier of the final feature film. They will receive a poster print and copy of the film. 
  • If we do not reach our final goal...which we will! But if we don't, where does the money go!??The production team would open an account it would just be put into a starter fund for the feature film for THE OTHERKIND, for pitching to or towards talent involvement and/or companies with or in reach of funding for future developments of the feature film production of THE OTHERKIND. 

TOTAL: $460,000.00

The Impact

 

  • How will this make an impact on film?
  • WE WANT TO CHANGE THESE PROMINENT STATISTICS.
  • The statistics of Women accounted for in 2019 8% of directors, down 3 percentage points from 11% in 2017. This is 1 percentage point below the 9% achieved in 1998. By role, women comprised 16% of writers, 21% of executive producers, 26% of producers, 21% of editors, and 4% of cinematographers.
  • You will be impacting and helping the percentage of female directors get films made in addition to changing the statistic of the amount of female directors actually working. We are specifically aiming within genre filmmaking. I want to have a 50% by 50% crew talent and crew, having gender equal pay rolls on set. 
  • In addition for being an advocate for equal opportunity and equal pay. I think this film is a strong political statement on how communities or towns can be affected by information. As to why the aliens invade and manipulate the people within Ireland around a lake/lough. There is a strong point being made behind this film. 
  • TEMP TIMELINE: 
  • PRE-PRODUCTION: DECEMBER/JANUARY 2019-MAY2020
  • PRODUCTION: JUNE/JULY 2020
  • POST PRODUCTION: AUGUST/SEPTEMBER 2020

Risks & Challenges

The risks, I am facing will be Marketing, finding the right crew local to Ireland for the right project and hiring on the right production team to make this big project happen for us! 

I have been pitching this feature for about three years going now. It's time to make it, low budget or mid budget. Time to put in the work. :) 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just sharing the trailer! OR sharing Mary C. Russell's Work helps getting this creative project made! And that's all there is to it. www.marycrussell.com

The percentage of distribution ownership of profit to be discussed in person. The percentage of profit within theatrical/online distribution to be discussed with production team. This also includes attending post production sessions, when film is in post. The investor will be able to attend the premier and attend the wrap day.  The investor also receives credit within the feature film, in the rolling credits. The investor will receive also a prop from the feature film.

2%-4% - $10,000.00-$20,000.00 - Investing includes a formal contract and select producer points of ownership of product of film given to a low budget producer. Attendance of the investor to set for one day, if filming in the United States. They will receive a copy of final product and credit in the feature film/rolling credits. A poster of the feature film will be given to investor and prop also in addition given from the film.  

1 % - $5,000.00 - OR LESS. -To receive online link to final feature film and credit. They will receive an invite of a Screening or premier of the final feature film. They will receive a poster print and copy of the film. 
If we do not reach our final goal...which we will! But if we don't, where does the money go!??The production team would open an account it would just be put into a starter fund for the feature film for THE OTHERKIND, for pitching to or towards talent involvement and/or companies with or in reach of funding for future developments of the feature film production of THE OTHERKIND. 



TOTAL: $460,000.00
The Impact
 

How will this make an impact on film?
WE WANT TO CHANGE THESE PROMINENT STATISTICS.
The statistics of Women accounted for in 2019 8% of directors, down 3 percentage points from 11% in 2017. This is 1 percentage point below the 9% achieved in 1998. By role, women comprised 16% of writers, 21% of executive producers, 26% of producers, 21% of editors, and 4% of cinematographers.
You will be impacting and helping the percentage of female directors get films made in addition to changing the statistic of the amount of female directors actually working. We are specifically aiming within genre filmmaking. I want to have a 50% by 50% crew talent and crew, having gender equal pay rolls on set. 
In addition for being an advocate for equal opportunity and equal pay. I think this film is a strong political statement on how communities or towns can be affected by information. As to why the aliens invade and manipulate the people within Ireland around a lake/lough. There is a strong point being made behind this film. 
TEMP TIMELINE: 

PRE-PRODUCTION: DECEMBER/JANUARY 2019-MAY2020

PRODUCTION: JUNE/JULY 2020
POST PRODUCTION: AUGUST/SEPTEMBER 2020


Risks & Challenges
The risks, I am facing will be Marketing, finding the right crew local to Ireland for the right project and hiring on the right production team to make this big project happen for us! 
I have been pitching this feature for about three years going now. It's time to make it, low budget or mid budget. Time to put in the work. :) 

Other Ways You Can Help
Just sharing the trailer! OR sharing Mary C. Russell's Work helps getting this creative project made! And that's all there is to it. www.marycrussell.com

story:
Short Summary

Two Birds in a Cage is about a young Gay man, Connor, hiding his sexuality in a deeply Catholic region of Australia. Living in a homophobic town with his equally homophobic family, Connor finds himself completely alone in his struggles... Until he finds the courage to take a leap of faith and confide in his best friend, and first love, Sean.

But with the eyes of the small, homophobic community constantly watching, it's not long before the couple are seen being intimate, and words spreads. Eventually, this leads to a gang of men, most likely led by Connor’s father, Rob, abducting Sean and dragging him to an outlying field where they beat him and leave him to die.

After a desperate search Connor finds him just in time... Or does he?

Director:

Harry Weston

Born and raised in Perth, WA, Harry Weston is currently in his 4th Semester at Bond University. Harry won a full Film and Television scholarship to Bond after winning Best Overall Filmmaker at the 2017 BUFTA Awards with his First World War movie "Dulce et Decorum est, Pro Patria Mori". Harry also won Best Director and Best Sound Design for his debut movie.


Directors statement:

"For me, 'Two Birds In A Cage' is a very important story to tell. Sadly, it's still a controversial topic in some areas of today's society. The story is also personal to me. It's loosely based on one of my best friends. His Story has always resonated with me. He's a 20 year old Gay man whose Catholic family is so homophobic, he still hasn't told any of them the truth out of fear of what they will say and do. My heart breaks for him. I hope this story can shed light on the issue and encourage more change and acceptance." 

 

Producer

Ellie Olman

Ellie has always been a set on becoming a producer and has shown her ability across the years. Having began her film studies five years prior, including 5 semesters at Bond her experience in this field is unparalleled. She understands the craft like the back of her hand and has produced all projects she has been apart of. Ellie has the ability to manage projects of a higher degree that may be on a big scale and a bit ambitious like Two Birds in a Cage, but challenges like that fuel her too do her best work. She has the perfect balance of the creative aspect and the business aspect of the job and as a result can produce anything to the highest degree.


Producer’s statement:
“I found Harry’s take on a topical story very intriguing, there are a lot of issues in this film that
will have their light shed, coming from a family that have first hand experienced a lot of the
main themes to the story, I have a great understanding of the characters. This in turn creates a
passion filled drive to be able to bring this exciting story to life. There are a lot of locations that
will authenticate this film and create a very realistic final piece. The team is highly committed to
create a piece of art that will be of high quality and impact.”

Director of Photography:

Eliza Chambers

Eliza began her studies midway through 2018 and is now in her 5th semester of film and television. From day one she has been set on enhancing and honing her cinematography skills. She has become undoubtedly the best Director of Photography in the cohort and has expressed her prowess through every piece of work she has created thus far, and is looking forward to carrying
on down this road through Two Birds in a Cage and whatever she creates after.

 

Production Designer:

Dayna Williams

Naturally gifted with an incredible eye for creativity and attention to detail. She has an incredible understanding of how to bring reality and authenticity to the screen through her impeccable skill to create settings, costumes and props that not only bring productions to life, but give another depth to them and the characters. Her ability is crucial to a production like this as the realism and authenticity in the production design will be such a huge part of creating this gritty yet passionate story.

Editor:


Abbey Williams

Abbey is one of these people who can do just about anything and everything in film, from sound design to producing to directing. However, one of, if not her most prolific abilities in film is editing. Abbey has edited most of Harry’s films here at bond and the two have worked very closely over the past year and a half. They have an incredible relationship and understanding of each other’s ideas and how to bring them to life. Abbey can edit any type of project together, including gritty drama’s, so there is no doubt she can do it again. Abbey is one of very few who will be able to pull this project off in the edit.

story:
What is this story about?

Dating has changed a lot over the years but it still comes down to a simple thing – two people, sitting across from each other, and how they get along. How their hearts speak to one other – or not! Making a connection is no easier when you are, ahem, over a certain age. In fact, sometimes it seems, the older you get, the crazier your dates become.

This short film is about two people who have met online and now meet for real. Does the promise of the online profile hold up in person? Let’s see what happens.

Why should you contribute?

Support women filmmakers! Our writer, director, producers, and editor are all women. Women are still underrepresented in key positions in the film industry. Let’s change that, one film at a time. Not that we are excluding men – there are still plenty of dudes contributing both in front of and behind the camera on this film.

Support women in comedy! Again, women are underrepresented in the comedy world. And we are funny, darn it! Let’s change the world, one laugh at a time.

Support diversity in filmmaking! We have a very diverse cast and crew. Greater diversity of people means a greater diversity of ideas. This is what our world looks like. This is what our entertainment should look like.

Support…..age diversity in filmmaking! Some of us are, shall we say, no longer in our 20s. And that’s ok. We still have lives. We’re still interesting. And we still deserve to have stories told about us.

Where does the money go?

It takes a village to raise a child and a city to make a film. A lot of time, money, effort, and equipment go into every moment you see on screen. We filmed under a SAG-AFTRA contract with professional actors and hired professional technical crew. Our film has already been shot, is currently being completed, and then will be submitted to film festivals so it can be seen. Each phase needs funding:

  • Production costs – cast, crew, gear (camera, lighting, sound), makeup and hair, location fee, insurance, and food for our hardworking cast and crew
  • Post Production costs – editing, music composing, color correction, sound mixing
  • And beyond – film festival submissions

Any funds raised above and beyond our goal will go towards future film projects. We want to make more movies for you to enjoy!

How are you important?

We can’t do this without you! Filmmaking is a collaborative effort and you can help. We appreciate your contributions, whether you contribute financially or spread the word and share the project. We raise our coffee cups to you in thanks!

story:
Synopsis

Alice is drowning in debt, city expenses, and the worst nanny job. She nannies an Upper Eastside poodle that has deemed her lower than the dirt. 

Tired of feeling stuck, she answers a Craigslist ad seeking to fill a phone entertainer position. Alice arrives for her interview only to realize she definitely misread the job posting. Down the rabbit hole (yeah, we went there) and way out of her comfort zone, will Alice break her loosing streak? 

Writer's Statement 

Wonderland is a bold, colorful, adventurous tale about regaining your confidence. As an actor and habitual people pleaser, I’ve often felt like the least powerful person in a room. I carried an immense amount of self-doubt beneath my eager to please persona. 

A few years ago I was hired for a job that was completely antithetical to everything I believed about myself. I became the assistant manager of a nightclub. As an infrequent club goer myself, my new job was the furthest thing from my comfort zone. My confidence was at an all time low and it felt like the job would just be my next spectacular failure.

But...I didn't fail. I handled my position and was welcomed into the fantastical NYC nightlife scene. Excelling in that world has made me feel purposeful, confident, and taught me how to feel comfortable taking up space. 

This film is everything I love in a movie. It's funny, enigmatic, and most importantly, hopeful. Sometimes life throws you a curveball, and while it might not be what you wanted, it might be exactly what you needed. 

The Team

Emily Weider | Writer/ Actor

Emily is an actor/writer, bred in New Jersey and based in New York City. Recent credits include a short film, I’m Fine, which is anticipating a festival release in Summer 2020. She has a BFA in Drama from North Carolina School of the Arts as well as independent studies with Bob Krakower and the Upright Citizens Brigade. Emily is passionate about telling stories that highlight and advocate for the different, unconventional, and unlikely heroes. 

Cameron Morton | Director/ Producer 

Cameron is a New York City-based director, originally from Atlanta, GA. She has worked with
Big Beach Films and SPACE on Ryder Farm. Cameron is an alum of the Telluride Film Festival
Symposium, and a graduate of North Carolina School of the Arts with a BFA in Acting. She most
recently acted as a directing panelist for the LA Women’s Weekend Film Challenge and she is
currently a Creative Culture Filmmaking Fellow at the Jacob Burns Film Center. Cameron works
as a freelance director and editor with a focus in narrative shorts. 

Lori Kusatzky | Producer 

Lori currently works for the head of the Book Division and TV / Film Lit Department at Abrams Artists Agency. Previously, she worked at Innovative Artists for a year and a half, and Interlochen Arts Camp for two years as a stage manager. Past internships include PR / Marketing at CNN and casting at Tara Rubin. BFA Drama: UNCSA.  

Director of Photography | Rove

Rove is a freelance cinematographer born and raised in Boston. He has worked largely in the narrative world, shooting music videos that have premiered on CMT and short films that have premiered at Riverrun Film Festival, LA Indie Shorts, Palm Springs Film Festival, and more. He is a graduate of North Carolina School of the Arts with a BFA in Filmmaking and a concentration in cinematography. He was mentored by Thomas E Ackerman ASC and David E Elkins SOC. 

Costume Designer | Karla Ortiz 

Karla is a New York City-based stylist with a focus in historical costuming. She worked as
an intern for Helen Uffner Vintage, where she assisted in costuming for film and TV, including
shows and films such as THE MARVELOUS MRS. MAISEL, JOKER and HUNTERS. She has also
worked internationally in editorial styling and media, with publications such as Chapelle
Magazine in Spain, Maple Magazine in Mexico City, and Remezcla. Currently, she is
chasing the history behind every thread.

Visual References

References for the film include:The Grand Budapest Hotel (Dir. Wes Anderson), Twin Peaks (Dir. David Lynch), and Zola (Dir. Janicza Bravo). 

Your Impact

Curious where your donation might go? Here is a breakdown of how we plan to allocate our funds. The majority of our budget will go towards paying our wonderful crew, and making sure we have top notch camera equipment so that we can make this film really beautiful. 

Crew: $4,160

Actors: $500

Camera Equipment: $1,100

Location Rental: $300

Meals & Crafty: $200

Costumes: $250

Production Design: $1,200

Production Insurance: $750

Post-Production: $500

Thank You

Lastly, thank you for reading through our page, and considering donating to the project. I am so excited and proud to bring this crazy story to life.

Sincerely, 

Emily
