story:
The Peace Martyr -  شهيد السلام -  השהיד של השלום



Rabin's assassination has impacted Palestinian lives perhaps more than any others’, yet 20 years have passed since his murder and their voices are yet to be heard.

This independent film will provide a current and retrospective view, examining what the Palestinian society has gone through. 



We will speak with those Palestinian leaders who were part of the Oslo accord and hear personal stories about their connection with Rabin, as well as elicit the voices of the younger generation who did not know Rabin.


Where your money is going

Your contribution will allow us to complete the film production!

In addition it will support Palestinian men and women’s arts & crafts.


What You Get

In these days of partisan entrenchment it is vitally important to widen the lens in order to understand the situation.

Unbiased independent documentary film that gives voice to the Palestinian society, by exploring its rich tapestry of differing  viewpoints and opinions.

In addition to supporting the film, those who donate over 10 $ will get a thank you gesture. You also get some Palestinian authentic art & crafts.

Check the sidebar for all our packs.

How You Can Help!

·  Give: Even $1 brings us closer to our goal!  (But only above 10$ you'll get our amazing crafts)

·  Share: Spread the word through social media, sharing our page, and telling your friends.


Yael Arava

Director/ Producer

Yael Arava is an Israeli film maker; born in Jerusalem, raised by her grandfather, a member of the Lechi underground movement. In her early 20’s she moved to Los Angeles and later relocated in London, but always stayed attached to Israelis and Palestinians. The Israeli-Palestinian conflict is a big part of her work as a journalist and as a film maker. Her latest film “Mirrors”  was produced about a year ago.

Mirrors -

The Director of the film sets off on a journalistic journey, which ends up being a personal one. From the Declaration of Independence of Israel, to that of Palestine, between Jewish and Palestinian underground movements such as Lechi and Hamas. The views reflecting the pastoral landscapes and the suffocating…

Israel/Palestine –

Holy Dust - 70 min (31 June 2007) Since the dawn of Christianity, Bethlehem has been one of the holiest places of pilgrimage, but after years of Intifada, the pilgrims no longer come. Life, for Bethlehem’s residents, has become a mass of bitter contradictions.

In 1999 she created and produced  a prime time program and film for the 4th anneversery for Rabin’s murder, as independent for channel 2 Israel.


www.factsproductions.com

story:
Our Film

Olivia and Lyka are both government spies and a married couple that are separated by work, they are unable to be together without putting Lyka's life in danger. The film follows their struggle as they try and accept the life that fate has set for them.

It is a ten minute short film exploring the themes of:  fate, love and  the misconceptions of reality.

  • Genre: Romance/Drama
  • Sub Genre: Spy

We intend to screen the film once post production has been completed.

 

What We Need & What you get

We need to raise a total of £800 pounds to help cover the following:

  • Actors transportation costs (London to Lincoln, Lincoln to London)
  • Actors overnight accommodation costs
  • Transport to locations
  • Food costs
  • Actors wages
  • Props and Costume Department

Everyone who donates will receive a free copy of the film and an individual thank you letter.

 

Our Team

 Gaby Zak (Director and cinematographer)

Gaby is the director of our film, she has worked on multiple student and professional films. Her most recent film of critical acclaim is Little Sh*t which was awarded the best British short at the London Short Film Festival 2018 were she worked as a runner/assistant. 

You can view Gaby's cinematography work here: gzak46.wixsite.com/photography

 

Phil Wilson (Editor and Assistant Director)

Phil is a talented editor, his film he completed on his BA(Hons) has been shown at multiple film festivals around the world including; India, Birmingham and Lincoln (Indie Lincs). 

 

Kelly Hodgkiss (Writer and Producer)

Kellys a Producer and writer she has experience writing for LND Magazine and has worked on multiple student and professional film projects. She worked as the production manager for Lauren Hatchard on the film was shown at the Clermont-Ferrand international film festival and as the producer on Harrogate films. 

You can view her showreel here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=37cMrngRPxE

 

Soundtrack 

We have been given permission to use a song by the talented: Tom Day & MonsoonSiren

Check it out on SoundCloud here: https://soundcloud.com/tomday/tom-day-monsoonsi...

 

Meet Our Cast

All of our cast have worked on high scale productions from projects for ITV to the Ladbible.

Callum Kerr

Callum will be playing Lyka a Russia spy who sought asylum in England, he is married to Olivia but becomes Eva's love interest when Basin forces the married couple to seperate. 

Callum has worked on many projects where he has acted and modeled, these include the Robbie Williams music video 'Mixed Signals' and a commercial for Jaguar. 

 

 

Matea Hrustic

Matea will be playing Olivia she is an office agent for a British intelligence agency, she is married to Lyka. But when she discovers Basin's plot to kill them both she decides to change sides and work for Basin to prevent her own death. 

Matea has worked in both acting, modeling and dancing she has worked as a Dancer for Britain's Got Talent and is represented by Isles Management. 

 

Stacey Gough 

Stacey will be playing Basin the head of a Russian mob. He is the former employer of Lyka and hired Olivia to kill Lyka. 

Stacey has worked on a large number of projects, his most recent project is the feature film Innocent Candy which he will be starring in the film is currently in pre production. 

 

Ruxandra Porojnicu

Ruxandra will be playing Eva, she pursues Lyka as a love interest she is the first girl Lyka meets when he attempts to starts his new life after Olivia's betrayal.

Ruxandra is a actress and model, she has appeared in multiple music videos and short films and attended the National University of Dramatic Arts. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you can't afford to donate, it would be great if you could;

  • Check out out our websites 
  • Like our social media pages 
  • Share our campaign

 

Social Media sites;

Instagram: @gzakproductions_

Facebook: GZAK Productions 

Twitter: @GzakProductions
story_txt:
Our Film
Olivia and Lyka are both government spies and a married couple that are separated by work, they are unable to be together without putting Lyka's life in danger. The film follows their struggle as they try and accept the life that fate has set for them.
It is a ten minute short film exploring the themes of:  fate, love and  the misconceptions of reality.

Genre: Romance/Drama
Sub Genre: Spy

We intend to screen the film once post production has been completed.

 

What We Need & What you get
We need to raise a total of £800 pounds to help cover the following:

Actors transportation costs (London to Lincoln, Lincoln to London)
Actors overnight accommodation costs
Transport to locations
Food costs
Actors wages
Props and Costume Department

Everyone who donates will receive a free copy of the film and an individual thank you letter.
 
Our Team
 Gaby Zak (Director and cinematographer)

Gaby is the director of our film, she has worked on multiple student and professional films. Her most recent film of critical acclaim is Little Sh*t which was awarded the best British short at the London Short Film Festival 2018 were she worked as a runner/assistant. 
You can view Gaby's cinematography work here: gzak46.wixsite.com/photography
 
Phil Wilson (Editor and Assistant Director)

Phil is a talented editor, his film he completed on his BA(Hons) has been shown at multiple film festivals around the world including; India, Birmingham and Lincoln (Indie Lincs). 
 
Kelly Hodgkiss (Writer and Producer)

Kellys a Producer and writer she has experience writing for LND Magazine and has worked on multiple student and professional film projects. She worked as the production manager for Lauren Hatchard on the film was shown at the Clermont-Ferrand international film festival and as the producer on Harrogate films. 
You can view her showreel here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=37cMrngRPxE
 
Soundtrack 
We have been given permission to use a song by the talented: Tom Day & MonsoonSiren
Check it out on SoundCloud here: https://soundcloud.com/tomday/tom-day-monsoonsi...
 
Meet Our Cast
All of our cast have worked on high scale productions from projects for ITV to the Ladbible.
Callum Kerr 
Callum will be playing Lyka a Russia spy who sought asylum in England, he is married to Olivia but becomes Eva's love interest when Basin forces the married couple to seperate. 
Callum has worked on many projects where he has acted and modeled, these include the Robbie Williams music video 'Mixed Signals' and a commercial for Jaguar. 
 
 
Matea Hrustic 
Matea will be playing Olivia she is an office agent for a British intelligence agency, she is married to Lyka. But when she discovers Basin's plot to kill them both she decides to change sides and work for Basin to prevent her own death. 
Matea has worked in both acting, modeling and dancing she has worked as a Dancer for Britain's Got Talent and is represented by Isles Management. 

 
Stacey Gough 
Stacey will be playing Basin the head of a Russian mob. He is the former employer of Lyka and hired Olivia to kill Lyka. 
Stacey has worked on a large number of projects, his most recent project is the feature film Innocent Candy which he will be starring in the film is currently in pre production. 

 
Ruxandra Porojnicu
Ruxandra will be playing Eva, she pursues Lyka as a love interest she is the first girl Lyka meets when he attempts to starts his new life after Olivia's betrayal.
Ruxandra is a actress and model, she has appeared in multiple music videos and short films and attended the National University of Dramatic Arts. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help
Don't worry if you can't afford to donate, it would be great if you could;

Check out out our websites 
Like our social media pages 
Share our campaign

story:
We want YOU to have the opportunity to have the best EXPERIENCE of "THE BROKEN MAN".

Strong female leads and minorities are UNDERREPRESENTED in MEDIA and by the WORLD. That is not the case here. Our TEAM is a wonderful blend of the best people.

There are several GOALS to meet. This includes the possibility of securing equity investments, and/or shooting the 22 min pilot and/or shooting the feature film and/or series.

The pilot script and the feature script are written.

The NEW MEXICO SPOTLIGHT FOUNDATION (a 501c3 non-profit organization established to help New Mexico talent) is fiscally sponsoring “The Broken Man”. Donations made this way are 100% TAX DEDUCTIBLE.

https://newmexicospotlightfoundation.org/produc...

We're also partnered up with THUNDERBIRD GROUP LLC, an Indigenous Entertainment Company lead by C. Pony Vigil.

https://thunderbirdgroup.co/2018/03/10/the-brok...

info@thebrokenmanmovie.com

No ZIP files will be opened.

PDF documents preferred.
